 10670                                  	;mov	di,10 ; 0Ah
 10671 000016A9 BF0A00                  	MOV	DI,SAVEXIT
 10672                                  	;MOV	CX,6
 10673                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10674 000016AC B106                    	mov	cl,6
 10675 000016AE F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 10676 000016B0 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
 10677 000016B4 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 10678 000016B6 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
 10679 000016B9 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
 10680 000016BB B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10681                                  HAVDIF:
 10682 000016BE 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10683 000016C1 BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10684 000016C4 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10685 000016C6 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10686 000016C8 D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10687 000016CA 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10688                                  
 10689                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10690                                  	;
 10691                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10692                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10693                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10694                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10695                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10696                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10697                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10698                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10699                                  	; into the PSP.
 10700                                  	;
 10701                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10702                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10703                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10704                                  	; for all cases.
 10705                                  	;
 10706                                  
 10707                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10708                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10709                                  
 10710 000016CC A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10711 000016CF 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10712                                  
 10713                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10714 000016D3 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10715                                  					;    memory left
 10716 000016D6 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10717                                  					;    OK
 10718                                  					; N: 
 10719                                  
 10720 000016D8 C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10721 000016DE C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10722                                  addr_ok:
 10723                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10724 000016E4 C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10725                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10726 000016EA C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10727                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10728 000016EF C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10729                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10730 000016F5 C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10731                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10732 000016FA C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10733                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10734 00001700 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10735                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10736 00001704 C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10737                                  ;
 10738                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10739                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10740                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10741                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10742                                  ; initialize this pointer.
 10743                                  ;
 10744                                   	;mov	word [38h],-1
 10745 0000170A C7063800FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB],-1
 10746                                  	;mov	word [3Ah],-1
 10747 00001710 C7063A00FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB+2],-1
 10748                                  
 10749                                  	; 06/05/2019
 10750                                  	; Set the real version number in the PSP - 5.00
 10751                                  
 10752                                  	;mov	word [es:PDB.Version],1406h ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:4FB6h)
 10753                                  	; 07/12/2022
 10754 00001716 26C7064000070A          	mov	word [ES:PDB.Version],(MINOR_VERSION*256)+MAJOR_VERSION
 10755                                  
 10756 0000171D C3                      	retn

 10882                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10884                                  ;
 10885                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10886                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10887                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 10888                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 10889                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 10890                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10891                                  
 10892                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10893                                  
 10894                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 10895                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 10896                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 10897                                  StrCmp:
 10898 0000176C 56                      	push	si
 10899 0000176D 57                      	push	di
 10900 0000176E 50                      	push	ax
 10901                                  Cmplp:
 10902 0000176F AC                      	LODSB
 10903 00001770 E8C942                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10904 00001773 E81943                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10905 00001776 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 10906 00001778 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 10907 0000177B 47                      	INC	DI
 10908 0000177C E8BD42                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10909 0000177F E80D43                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10910 00001782 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 10911 00001784 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 10912                                  
 10913 00001786 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10914 00001788 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 10915                                  PopRet:
 10916 0000178A 58                      	pop	ax
 10917 0000178B 5F                      	pop	di
 10918 0000178C 5E                      	pop	si
 10919 0000178D C3                      	retn
 10920                                  
 10921                                  ;Break <STRCPY - copy ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10922                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10923                                  ;
 10924                                  ;   Strcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI and make uppercase
 10925                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 10926                                  ;	characters.
 10927                                  ;
 10928                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - pointer to source string
 10929                                  ;		ES:DI - pointer to destination string
 10930                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string
 10931                                  ;		DS:SI point byte after nul byte at end of source string
 10932                                  ;   Registers modified: SI,DI
 10933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10934                                  
 10935                                  StrCpy:
 10936 0000178E 50                      	push	ax
 10937                                  CPYLoop:
 10938 0000178F AC                      	LODSB
 10939 00001790 E8A942                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10940 00001793 E8F942                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert / to \ ;
 10941 00001796 AA                      	STOSB
 10942                                  
 10943 00001797 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10944 00001799 75F4                    	JNZ	short CPYLoop
 10945 0000179B 58                      	pop	ax
 10946 0000179C C3                      	retn

 11030                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11031                                  ;
 11032                                  ;   Idle - when retrying an operation due to a lock/sharing violation,
 11033                                  ;   	   we spin until RetryLoop is exhausted.
 11034                                  ;
 11035                                  ;   Inputs:	RetryLoop is the number of times we spin
 11036                                  ;   Outputs:	Wait

 11061                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11062                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11063                                  ;
 11064                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11065                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11066                                  ;
 11067                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11068                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11069                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11070                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11071                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11072                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11074                                  
 11075                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11076 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11077 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11078 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11079 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11080 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11081 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11082                                  endstruc
 11083                                  
 11084                                  TableDispatch:
 11085 000017DB 55                      	PUSH	BP
 11086 000017DC 89E5                    	MOV	BP,SP
 11087 000017DE 53                      	PUSH	BX			; save BX
 11088                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+6]

 11091                                  	;cmp	[bp+4],bl

 11095 000017EA 8A5E04                  	MOV	BL,[BP+TFrame.Index]	; get desired table index
 11096 000017ED 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH			; convert to word
 11097 000017EF D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1			; convert to word pointer
 11098 000017F1 43                      	INC	BX			; point past first length byte

 11101 000017F2 035E06                  	ADD	BX,[BP+TFrame.Tab]	; get real offset

 11300                                  ;Break	<MSG_RETRIEVAL- get beginning addr of system and parser messages>
 11301                                  
 11302                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11303                                  ;   DOS 4.00
 11304                                  ;
 11305                                  ;   Inputs:	DL=0 get extended error message addr
 11306                                  ;		  =1 set extended error message addr
 11307                                  ;		  =2 get parser error message addr
 11308                                  ;		  =3 set parser error message addr
 11309                                  ;		  =4 get critical error message addr
 11310                                  ;		  =5 set critical error message addr
 11311                                  ;		  =6 get file system error message addr
 11312                                  ;		  =7 set file system error message addr
 11313                                  ;		  =8 get address for code reduction
 11314                                  ;		  =9 set address for code reduction
 11315                                  ;   Function:	get/set message address
 11316                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI points to addr when get
 11317                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11318                                  
 11319                                  ;Procedure MSG_RETRIEVAL,NEAR
 11320                                  ;	ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:NOTHING
 11321                                  
 11322                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11323                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 11324                                  
 11325                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 11326                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 11327                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 11328                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 11329                                  ;;
 11330                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 11331                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 11332                                  ;;
 11333                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 11334                                  ;;	push	ds
 11335                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 11336                                  ;;
 11337                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11338                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11339                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11340                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 11341                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11342                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11343                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11344                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;
 11345                                  ;;	SHL	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. times 2
 11346                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11347                                  ;;	ADD	SI,AX		    ;AN000;;MS. position to the entry
 11348                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11349                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11350                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 11351                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 11352                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11353                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;

 11355                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;

 11357                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11358                                  ;;
 11359                                  ;;	pop	ds
 11360                                  
 11361                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit

 11422                                  ;============================================================================
 11423                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 11424                                  ;============================================================================
 11425                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11426                                  
 11427                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 11428                                  
 11429                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 11430                                  
 11431                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11432                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11433                                  
 11434                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11435                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 11436                                  ;
 11437                                  ; Sleaze for time savings: first instruction is a return. This is patched
 11438                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 11439                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11440                                  
 11441                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11442                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11443                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 11444                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 11445                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 11446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11447                                  
 11448                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 11449                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 11450                                  ;	iret
 11451                                  ;	push	cs
 11452                                  ;	call	$-2
 11453                                  ;%endmacro
 11454                                  
 11455                                  ; ---------------------------
 11456                                  
 11457                                  ; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11458                                  %if 0
 11459                                  
 11460                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 11461                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 11462                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 11463                                  ECritMEM:
 11464                                  ECritSFT:
 11465                                  ;
 11466                                  ECritDisk:
 11467                                  
 11468                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 11469                                  
 11470                                  	pushf
 11471                                  	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 11472                                  	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 11473                                  
 11474                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11475                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 11476                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 11477                                  ;
 11478                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 11479                                  ;	iret ; *
 11480                                  
 11481                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11482                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11483                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 11484                                  	; 06/11/2022
 11485                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 11486                                  ;	iret	
 11487                                  
 11488                                  	; 06/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11489                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11490                                  	push	cs ; *
 11491                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret ; *		
 11492                                  	
 11493                                  ECritDisk_0:
 11494                                  	PUSH    AX
 11495                                  	;MOV	AX,8000h+critDisk
 11496                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 11497                                  	mov	ax,8001h
 11498                                  	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11499                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11500                                  	POP     AX
 11501                                  	retn
 11502                                  
 11503                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11504                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11505                                  ECritDisk_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11506                                  LCritDisk_iret: 
 11507                                  	iret
 11508                                  
 11509                                  ECritDisk_2:
 11510                                  	;;popff ; *
 11511                                  	;;retn
 11512                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_3 ; *
 11513                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2: ; *
 11514                                  ;	iret
 11515                                  	
 11516                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11517                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11518                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_3
 11519                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2:
 11520                                  	;iret
 11521                                  
 11522                                  ECritDisk_3:
 11523                                  	push    cs ; *
 11524                                  	; 13/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11525                                  	;call	ECritDisk_iret2 ; *
 11526                                  	;retn
 11527                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11528                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret
 11529                                  	retn
 11530                                  
 11531                                  ;EndProc ECritDisk

 11909                                  ;============================================================================
 11910                                  ; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11911                                  ;============================================================================
 11912                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 by Erdogan Tan, 04/05/2019
 11913                                  
 11914                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11915                                  
 11916                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 11917                                  ;
 11918                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 11919                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 11920                                  
 11921                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 11922                                  ;
 11923                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 11924                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 11925                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 11926                                  ;	$RawConIO
 11927                                  ;	$RawConInput
 11928                                  ;	RAWOUT
 11929                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 11930                                  ;
 11931                                  
 11932                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 11933                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 11934                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 11935                                  
 11936                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11937                                  
 11938                                  ;	TITLE	CPMIO2 - device IO for MSDOS
 11939                                  ;	NAME	CPMIO2
 11940                                  
 11941                                  ;
 11942                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 11943                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 11944                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 11945                                  ;
 11946                                  
 11947                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 11948                                  ;
 11949                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 11950                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 11951                                  ;	OUTT
 11952                                  ;	TAB
 11953                                  ;	BUFOUT
 11954                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 11955                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 11956                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 11957                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 11958                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 11959                                  ;
 11960                                  ;	Revision History:
 11961                                  ;
 11962                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 11963                                  
 11964                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 11965                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 11966                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 11967                                  
 11968                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 11969                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 11970                                  
 11971                                  
 11972                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 11973                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 11974                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 11975                                  
 11976                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 11977                                  ; 08/11/2022
 11978                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 11979                                  
 11980                                  ;
 11981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11982                                  ;
 11983                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 11984                                  ;
 11985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11986                                  ;
 11987                                  
 11988                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 11989                                  
 11990                                  ; Inputs:
 11991                                  ;	None
 11992                                  ; Function:
 11993                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 11994                                  ; Returns:
 11995                                  ;	AL = character
 11996                                  
 11997 000018E3 1E                      	push	ds
 11998 000018E4 56                      	push	si
 11999                                  INTEST:
 12000 000018E5 E86F42                  	call	STATCHK
 12001 000018E8 753A                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 12002                                  ;*************************************************************************
 12003                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12004 000018EA 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 12005 000018F0 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 12006 000018F2 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 12007 000018F4 E8B334                  	call	IOFUNC
 12008                                  no_sys_wait:
 12009                                  ;**************************************************************************
 12010 000018F7 B484                    	MOV	AH,84h		; (Microsoft Networks - KEYBOARD BUSY LOOP)
 12011 000018F9 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 12012                                  
 12013                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 12014                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 12015                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 12016                                  
 12017                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12018 000018FB 36803E[BD0D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 12019 00001901 751A                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 12020                                  
 12021 00001903 50                      	PUSH	AX
 12022 00001904 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 12023 00001905 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 12024 00001906 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 12025                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 12026 00001907 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 12027                                  
 12028                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 12029                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 12030                                  
 12031 00001908 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 12032 00001909 1F                      	POP	DS
 12033                                  
 12034                                  	;MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 12035                                  	; 26/06/2024
 12036 0000190A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 12037 0000190C E89A02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 12038                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 12039 0000190F E855F2                  	call	READTIME
 12040 00001912 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 12041 00001915 E89102                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 12042                                  
 12043                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 12044                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 12045                                  ;	push	bx
 12046                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 12047                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 12048                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 12049                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 12050                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 12051                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 12052                                  ;	pop	bx
 12053                                  
 12054 00001918 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 12055 00001919 5A                      	POP	DX
 12056 0000191A 59                      	POP	CX
 12057 0000191B 5B                      	POP	BX
 12058 0000191C 58                      	POP	AX
 12059                                  NoUpdate:
 12060                                  
 12061                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12062 0000191D 36FF06[BD0D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 12063                                  
 12064                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 12065 00001922 EBC1                    	JMP	short INTEST
 12066                                  GET:
 12067 00001924 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 12068 00001926 E88134                  	call	IOFUNC
 12069 00001929 5E                      	POP	SI
 12070 0000192A 1F                      	POP	DS
 12071                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 12072                                  
 12073                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12074                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12075 0000192B 36C606[BC0D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 12076                                  	;
 12077 00001931 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 12078 00001933 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 12079                                  
 12080                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12081                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 12082                                  	; 20/06/2023
 12083 00001935 36FE06[BC0D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 12084                                  noscan:
 12085 0000193A C3                      	retn
 12086                                  ;
 12087                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12088                                  ;
 12089                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 12090                                  ;
 12091                                  ;
 12092                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 12093                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12094                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12095                                  ;
 12096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12097                                  ;
 12098                                  
 12099                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 12100 0000193B 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12101                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 12102 0000193D AC                      	lodsb
 12103 0000193E 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 12104 00001940 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 12105                                  NEXT_STR1:
 12106 00001942 E88D02                  	call	OUTT
 12107 00001945 EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 12108                                  
 12109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12110                                  ;
 12111                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 12112                                  ;
 12113                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 12114                                  ;
 12115                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 12116                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12117                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12118                                  ;
 12119                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12120                                  
 12121                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12122                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:58D4h
 12123                                  
 12124                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 12125                                  
 12126                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12127                                  	;mov	ax,ss
 12128                                  	;mov	es,ax
 12129 00001947 16                      	push	ss
 12130 00001948 07                      	pop	es
 12131                                  
 12132 00001949 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12133 0000194B 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 12134 0000194D AD                      	lodsw
 12135                                  
 12136                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 12137                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 12138                                  
 12139 0000194E 08C0                            or	al,al
 12140 00001950 74E8                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 12141 00001952 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 12142 00001954 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 12143                                  
 12144                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 12145                                  
 12146 00001956 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 12147 00001958 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 12148 0000195A 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 12149 0000195D 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 12150                                  
 12151                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 12152                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template. This is an inconsistant state
 12153                                  ; of affairs. Pretend that the template was empty:
 12154                                  ;
 12155                                  
 12156                                  NOEDIT:	
 12157 0000195F 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 12158                                  EDITON: 
 12159 00001961 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 12160 00001963 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 12161                                  
 12162                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 12163                                  
 12164                                  NEWLIN: 
 12165 00001964 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 12166 00001968 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 12167                                  
 12168 0000196C 56                      	push	si
 12169 0000196D BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 12170 00001970 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 12171 00001975 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 12172 00001977 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 12173 00001979 E867FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 12174 0000197C 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 12175 0000197E 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 12176                                  
 12177                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 12178                                  ;
 12179                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 12180                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 12181                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 12182                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 12183                                  
 12184                                  GETCH:
 12185 00001980 E860FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12186                                  GOTCH:
 12187                                  ;
 12188                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 12189                                  ; input queue.
 12190                                  ;
 12191 00001983 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 12192 00001985 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 12193                                  
 12194                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 12195                                  
 12196                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 12197                                  
 12198                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12199                                  
 12200                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 12201                                  
 12202 00001987 2E3A06[710A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 12203 0000198C 7439                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 12204                                  
 12205                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 12206                                  
 12207 0000198E 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 12208                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12209                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12210 00001990 7466                    	je	short BACKSP
 12211 00001992 3C08                    	cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 12212                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12213                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12214 00001994 7462                    	je	short BACKSP
 12215                                  
 12216                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here.
 12217                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 12218                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 12219                                  	;		
 12220                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 12221                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 12222                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 12223                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 12224                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 12225                                  	;	
 12226                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 12227                                  
 12228                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12229                                  	;
 12230                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 12231                                  
 12232                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 12233                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 12234                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 12235                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 12236                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 12237                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 12238                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 12239                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 12240                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 12241                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 12242                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 12243                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 12244                                  	
 12245                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12246                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 12247                                  
 12248                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12249                                  %if 0
 12250                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12251                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 12252                                  ;	cursor
 12253                                  
 12254                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 12255                                  
 12256                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12257                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 12258                                  
 12259                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 12260                                  	NOP
 12261                                  	NOP
 12262                                  
 12263                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 12264                                  
 12265                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12266                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.
 12267                                  
 12268                                  ;***	JZ	short LineDel
 12269                                  	NOP
 12270                                  	NOP
 12271                                  
 12272                                  %endif
 12273                                  
 12274                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 12275                                  
 12276 00001996 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 12277 00001998 7430                            jz	short ENDLIN
 12278                                  
 12279                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 12280                                  
 12281 0000199A 3C0A                            cmp	al,c_LF ; 0Ah
 12282 0000199C 7442                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 12283                                  
 12284                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 12285                                  
 12286                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 12287                                  	;cmp	al,[ss:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12288                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12289                                  
 12290                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 12291                                  
 12292                                  ;hkn; 	CANCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12293                                  
 12294 0000199E 2E3A06[700A]            	cmp	al,[cs:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12295 000019A3 7440                    	jz	short KILNEW
 12296                                  	
 12297                                  	;cmp	al,CANCEL ; 1Bh	; Retro DOS v3.0
 12298                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12299                                  
 12300                                  ; Otherwise, we save the input character.
 12301                                  
 12302                                  SAVCH:	
 12303 000019A5 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 12304 000019A7 7317                    	jnb	short BUFFUL		; buffer is full.
 12305 000019A9 AA                              stosb
 12306 000019AA FEC6                    	inc	dh                      ; increment count in buffer.
 12307 000019AC E8B702                  	call	BUFOUT			; Print control chars nicely
 12308                                  
 12309 000019AF 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 12310 000019B5 75C9                    	jnz	short GETCH		; insertmode => don't advance template
 12311 000019B7 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 12312 000019B9 73C5                            jnb	short GETCH		; no more characters in template
 12313 000019BB 46                              inc	si                      ; Skip to next char in template
 12314 000019BC FEC7                            inc	bh                      ; remember position in template
 12315 000019BE EBC0                            jmp	short GETCH
 12316                                  
 12317                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12318                                  ;BACKSPJ: 
 12319                                  	;jmp	short BACKSP
 12320                                  
 12321                                  BUFFUL: 
 12322 000019C0 B007                    	mov	al, 7			; Bell to signal full buffer
 12323 000019C2 E80D02                  	call	OUTT
 12324 000019C5 EBB9                    	jmp	short GETCH
 12325                                  
 12326                                  ESCAPE: 
 12327                                  	;transfer OEMFunctionKey
 12328 000019C7 E9D2F0                  	JMP	OEMFunctionKey		; let the OEM's handle the key dispatch
 12329                                  
 12330                                  ENDLIN:
 12331 000019CA AA                              stosb				; Put the CR in the buffer
 12332 000019CB E80402                  	call	OUTT                    ; Echo it
 12333 000019CE 5F                              pop	di                      ; Get start of user buffer
 12334 000019CF 8875FF                          mov	[di-1], dh		; Tell user how many bytes
 12335 000019D2 FEC6                            inc	dh			; DH is length including CR
 12336                                  
 12337                                  COPYNEW:
 12338                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 2.0, STRIN.ASM)
 12339                                  	;mov	bp, es
 12340                                  	;mov	bx, ds
 12341                                  	;mov	es, bx
 12342                                  	;mov	ds, bp
 12343                                  	;mov	si, INBUF
 12344                                  	;mov	cl, dh
 12345                                  	;rep	movsb
 12346                                  	;retn
 12347                                  
 12348                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0)
 12349                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 3.3, Offset 2061h) 
 12350                                  	;SAVE	<DS,ES>
 12351 000019D4 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 12352 000019D5 06                      	PUSH	ES
 12353                                  	;RESTORE <DS,ES>		; XCHG ES,DS
 12354 000019D6 1F                      	POP	DS
 12355 000019D7 07                      	POP	ES
 12356                                  
 12357                                  ;;hkn; INBUF is in DOSDATA
 12358 000019D8 BE[FB01]                        MOV     SI,INBUF
 12359 000019DB 88F1                            MOV     CL,DH                   ; set up count
 12360 000019DD F3A4                            REP     MOVSB                   ; Copy final line to user buffer
 12361                                  OLDBAK_RETN:
 12362 000019DF C3                              RETN
 12363                                  
 12364                                  ;	Output a CRLF to the user screen and do NOT store it into the buffer
 12365                                  
 12366                                  PHYCRLF:
 12367 000019E0 E81B01                  	CALL	CRLF
 12368 000019E3 EB9B                            JMP	short GETCH
 12369                                  
 12370                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3, IBMDOS.COM, 1987)
 12371                                  
 12372                                  ; DOSCODE:52CAh (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12373                                  
 12374                                  	; Note: Following routines were not used in IBMDOS.COM
 12375                                  	;	-CRTL+W, CRTL+U is not activated-
 12376                                  	;	but they were in the kernel code!?)
 12377                                  
 12378                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12379                                  	; DOSCODE:52B6h
 12380                                  
 12381                                  ;;;;;;;;
 12382                                  
 12383                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12384                                  %if 0
 12385                                  ;
 12386                                  ; Delete the previous line
 12387                                  ;
 12388                                  LineDel:
 12389                                  	OR      DH,DH
 12390                                  	JZ	short GETCH	 ; 06/12/2022
 12391                                  	Call    BackSpace
 12392                                  	JMP	short LineDel
 12393                                  
 12394                                  %endif
 12395                                  
 12396                                  ;
 12397                                  ; delete the previous word.
 12398                                  ;
 12399                                  WordDel:
 12400                                  WordLoop:
 12401                                  ;	Call    BackSpace               ; backspace the one spot
 12402                                  ;	OR      DH,DH
 12403                                  ;	JZ	short GetChj
 12404                                  ;	MOV     AL,[ES:DI-1]
 12405                                  ;	cmp     al,'0'
 12406                                  ;	jb	short GetChj
 12407                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'

 12409                                  ;	OR      AL,20h
 12410                                  ;	CMP     AL,'a'

 12412                                  ;	CMP     AL,'z'
 12413                                  ;	JBE	short WordLoop
 12414                                  ;GetChj: 
 12415                                  ;	JMP	GETCH
 12416                                  
 12417                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12418                                  %if 0
 12419                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12420                                  	; (Worddel is not called or jumped from anywhere!)
 12421                                  WordDel:
 12422                                  WordLoop:
 12423                                  	Call    BackSpace               ; backspace the one spot
 12424                                  	OR      DH,DH
 12425                                  	JZ	short GetChj
 12426                                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI-1]
 12427                                  	cmp     al,'0'

 12441                                  ;;;;;;;;
 12442                                  
 12443                                  ; DOSCODE:52F3h (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12444                                  
 12445                                  ; The user wants to throw away what he's typed in and wants to start over.
 12446                                  ; We print the backslash and then go to the next line and tab to the correct
 12447                                  ; spot to begin the buffered input.
 12448                                  
 12449                                  KILNEW:
 12450 000019E5 B05C                            mov	al,'\'
 12451 000019E7 E8E801                          call	OUTT            ;Print the CANCEL indicator
 12452 000019EA 5E                              pop	si		;Remember start of edit buffer
 12453                                  PUTNEW:
 12454 000019EB E81001                  	call	CRLF            ;Go to next line on screen
 12455 000019EE 36A0[FA01]              	mov	al,[SS:STARTPOS]
 12456 000019F2 E85102                  	call	TAB             ;Tab over
 12457 000019F5 E96CFF                          JMP     NEWLIN		;Start over again
 12458                                  
 12459                                  ;	Destructively back up one character position
 12460                                  
 12461                                  BACKSP:
 12462                                  	; 09/09/2018
 12463 000019F8 E80800                  	Call    BackSpace
 12464 000019FB EB83                    	JMP     short GETCH	; 15/01/2024
 12465                                  
 12466                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12467                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line
 12468                                  TWOESC:	
 12469 000019FD 2EA0[710A]              	mov	al,[cs:ESCCHAR] ; 10/06/2019
 12470 00001A01 EBA2                    	jmp	short SAVCH
 12471                                  
 12472                                  BackSpace:
 12473 00001A03 08F6                    	or	dh,dh
 12474 00001A05 7419                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;No chars in line, do nothing to line
 12475 00001A07 E85800                  	call	BACKUP          ;Do the backup
 12476 00001A0A 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]	;Get the deleted char
 12477 00001A0D 3C20                            cmp	al,20h	; ' '
 12478 00001A0F 730F                    	jnb	short OLDBAK	;Was a normal char
 12479 00001A11 3C09                            cmp	al,c_HT ; 9
 12480 00001A13 741B                    	jz	short BAKTAB	;Was a tab, fix up users display
 12481                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 12482 00001A15 3C15                    	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h ; ctrl-U is a section symbol not ^U
 12483 00001A17 7407                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 12484 00001A19 3C14                           	CMP     AL,"T"-"@" ; 14h ; ctrl-T is a paragraphs symbol not ^T

 13433                                  ;	$GET_FCB_POSITION
 13434                                  ;	$FCB_DELETE
 13435                                  ;	$GET_FCB_FILE_LENGTH

 13448                                  ;	Revision history:
 13449                                  ;
 13450                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983"
 13451                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 13452                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 13453                                  ;					  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 13454                                  ;					  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 13455                                  ;					  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 13456                                  ;			 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 13457                                  ;					  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
 13458                                  ;
 13459                                  ;		A000	 version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 13460                                  
 13461                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_Position - set random record fields to current pos>
 13462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13463                                  ;
 13464                                  ;   $Get_FCB_Position - look at an FCB, retrieve the current position from the
 13465                                  ;	extent and next record field and set the random record field to point
 13466                                  ;	to that record
 13467                                  ;
 13468                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 13469                                  ;   Outputs:	The random record field of the FCB is set to the current record
 13470                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13471                                  ;
 13472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13473                                  ;
 13474                                  
 13475                                  _$GET_FCB_POSITION:
 13476 00001CED E8FB04                  	call	GetExtended		; point to FCB
 13477 00001CF0 E8CC04                  	call	GetExtent		; DX:AX is current record
 13478                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13479 00001CF3 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX 	; drop in low order piece
 13480                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13481 00001CF6 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; drop in high order piece
 13482                                  	;cmp	word [si+0Eh],64
 13483 00001CF9 837C0E40                	CMP	word [SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],64
 13484 00001CFD 7303                    	JAE	short GetFCBBye
 13485                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh
 13486 00001CFF 887424                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2+1],DH	; Set 4th byte only if record size < 64
 13487                                  GoodPath:	; 16/12/2022
 13488                                  GetFCBBye:
 13489 00001D02 E982E9                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 13490                                  
 13491                                  ;Break <$FCB_Delete - remove several files that match the input FCB>
 13492                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13493                                  ;
 13494                                  ;**	$FCB_Delete - Delete from FCB Template
 13495                                  ;
 13496                                  ;	given an FCB, remove all directory entries in the current

 13737                                  ;
 13738                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 13739                                  ;
 13740                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames
 13741                                  ;	multiple files copying from the meta characters.
 13742                                  ;

 13744                                  ;		    name of the files to be renamed. Starting at offset 11h
 13745                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.

 13747                                  ;		AL = FF -> some files may have been renamed but:
 13748                                  ;			rename to existing file or source file not found

 13750                                  ;
 13751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13752                                  ;
 13753                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 13801                                  ;	Error -
 13802                                  ;
 13803                                  ;	(al) = error code
 13804                                  
 13805                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13806                                  ;fren90:	
 13807                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 13808                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13809                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 13810                                  
 13811                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 13812                                  ;
 13813                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 13814                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 13815                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 13816                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 13817                                  ;   usage.
 13818                                  ;
 13819                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 13820                                  ;
 13821                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 13822                                  ;
 13823                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13824                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 13825                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13826                                  ;	    }				    }
 13827                                  ;
 13828                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 13829                                  ;
 13830                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13831                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 13832                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13833                                  ;	    }				    }
 13834                                  ;
 13835                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 13836                                  ;
 13837                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13838                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 13839                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13840                                  ;
 13841                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 13842                                  ;
 13843                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13844                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 13845                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 13846                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13847                                  ;	    }
 13848                                  ;
 13849                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 13850                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 13851                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 13852                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 13853                                  ;   the local machine.
 13854                                  ;
 13855                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 13856                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 13857                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 13858                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 13859                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 13860                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 13861                                  ;
 13862                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 13863                                  ;
 13864                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 13865                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 13866                                  ;   regenerated.
 13867                                  ;
 13868                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 13869                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 13870                                  ;   information:
 13871                                  ;
 13872                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 13873                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 13874                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 13875                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 13876                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 13877                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 13878                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 13879                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 13880                                  ;
 13881                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 13882                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 13883                                  ;
 13884                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 13885                                  ;
 13886                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 13887                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 13888                                  ;
 13889                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 13890                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 13891                                  ;
 13892                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 13893                                  ;	always be present.
 13894                                  ;
 13895                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 13896                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 13897                                  ;
 13898                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 13899                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 13900                                  ;	proper OI record.
 13901                                  ;
 13902                                  ;   The test bits are:
 13903                                  ;
 13904                                  ;	00 -> local file
 13905                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 13906                                  ;	80 -> network
 13907                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 13908                                  
 13909                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 13910                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13911                                  ;
 13912                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 13913                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 13914                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 13915                                  ;
 13916                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 13917                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 13918                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 13919                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 13920                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 13921                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 13922                                  ;
 13923                                  ;
 13924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13925                                  ;
 13926                                  
 13927                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13928                                  	; 20/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13929                                  	
 13930                                  SaveFCBInfo:
 13931                                  
 13932 00001E09 36C43E[9E05]            	LES	DI,[SS:THISSFT]		; SS override
 13933 00001E0E E80EFA                  	call	IsSFTNet
 13934 00001E11 740B                    	JZ	short SaveLocal		; if not network then save local info
 13935                                  ;
 13936                                  ;----- In net support -----
 13937                                  ;
 13938                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13939                                  
 13940                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13941                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+1Dh]
 13942                                  	;mov	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_dirsec]
 13943                                  	;;mov	[si+1Ah],ax
 13944                                  	;mov	[si+fcb_net_handle],ax
 13945                                  	;push	es
 13946                                  	;push	di
 13947                                  	;;les	di,[es:di+19h]
 13948                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+sf_netid]
 13949                                  	;;mov	[si+1Ch],di
 13950                                  	;MOV	[SI+fcb_netID],DI	; save net ID
 13951                                  	;;mov 	[si+1Eh],es
 13952                                  	;MOV	[SI+fcb_netID+2],ES
 13953                                  	;pop	di
 13954                                  	;pop	es
 13955                                  
 13956                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13957                                  	;mov	ax,[es:di+0Bh]
 13958 00001E13 268B450B                	MOV	AX,[ES:DI+sf_serial_ID] ;AN000;;IFS. save IFS ID
 13959                                  	;mov	[si+1Ch],ax
 13960 00001E17 89441C                  	MOV	[SI+fcb_netID],ax	;AN000;;IFS.

 14138                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14140                                  ;
 14141                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14142                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14143                                  ;   at 0.
 14144                                  ;
 14145                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14146                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14147                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14148                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14149                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14150                                  ;
 14151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14152                                  ;
 14153                                  
 14154                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14155                                  ResetLRU:
 14156                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 14157                                  	; DOSDATA

 14161 00001EB7 57                      	push	di

 14164                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]

 14166                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]

 14168                                  ovScan:
 14169 00001EC4 262901                  	SUB	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; decrement lru count
