 14223                                  ;Break	<LRUFCB - perform LRU on FCB sfts>
 14224                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14225                                  ;
 14226                                  ;   LRUFCB - find LRU fcb in cache. Set ThisSFT and return it. We preserve
 14227                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 14228                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.
 14229                                  ;
 14230                                  ;   Inputs:	none
 14231                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point to SFT

 14238                                  ;
 14239                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 14240                                  ;IF 0	; rewritten this routine

 14243                                  ;	call	save_world

 14247                                  ; operate be scanning the list n times finding the least age that is greater

 14440                                  ;	call	restore_world
 14441                                  ;	LES     DI,[CS:THISSFT]
 14442                                  ;	jnc	short LRUFCB_retn
 14443                                  ;LRUFCB_err:
 14444                                  ;	; mov	al, 23h	
 14445                                  ;	MOV	AL,error_FCB_unavailable
 14446                                  ;LRUFCB_retn:	
 14447                                  ;	retn:
 14448                                  ;
 14449                                  ;ENDIF	; LRUFCB has been rewritten below.
 14450                                  
 14451                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14452                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14453                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14454                                  ;
 14455                                  ; LruFCB -- allocate the LRU SFT from the SFT Table. The LRU scheme
 14456                                  ; maintains separate counts for net/Share and local SFTs. We allocate a 
 14457                                  ; net/Share SFT only if we do not find a local SFT. This helps keep
 14458                                  ; net/Share SFTs which cannot be regenerated for as long as possible. We
 14459                                  ; optimize regeneration operations by keeping track of the current local
 14460                                  ; SFT. This avoids scanning of the SFTs as long as we have at least one 
 14461                                  ; local SFT in the SFT Block.
 14462                                  ;
 14463                                  ; Inputs: al = 0 => Regenerate SFT operation
 14464                                  ;	    = 1 => Allocate new SFT for Open/Create
 14465                                  ;
 14466                                  ; Outputs: Carry clear
 14467                                  ;	 	es:di = Address of allocated SFT
 14468                                  ;	  	ThisSFT = Address of allocated SFT
 14469                                  ;
 14470                                  ;	  carry set if closes of net/Share files failed 
 14471                                  ;		al = error_FCB_unavailable
 14472                                  ;
 14473                                  ; Registers affected: None
 14474                                  ;
 14475                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14476                                  
 14477                                  ;LruFCB	PROC	NEAR
 14478                                  LRUFCB:
 14479                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14480                                  	; DOSCODE:5805h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 14481                                  
 14482                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14483                                  	; DOSCODE:57F1h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 14484                                  
 14485                                  	; 20/01/2024 Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMMDOS.COM)
 14486                                  	; DOSCODE:5E7Ch (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 14487                                  
 14488 00001ED7 06                      	push	es	; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 14489                                  	
 14490 00001ED8 E87DE5                  	call	save_world
 14491                                  	
 14492                                  	;getdseg <ds>		;ds = DOSDATA
 14493 00001EDB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14494                                  
 14495 00001EE0 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Check if regenerate allocation
 14496 00001EE2 7516                    	jnz	short lru1	;Try to find SFT to use
 14497                                  
 14498                                  	; This is a regen call. If LocalSFT contains the address of a valid 
 14499                                  	; local SFT, just return that SFT to reuse
 14500                                  
 14501                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14502                                  	;mov	di,[LocalSFT]
 14503                                  	;or	di,[LocalSFT+2]	;is address == 0?
 14504                                  	;jz	short lru1	;invalid local SFT, find one
 14505                                  
 14506                                  	; We have found a valid local SFT. Recycle this SFT
 14507                                  
 14508 00001EE4 C43E[490F]              	les	di,[LocalSFT]
 14509                                  
 14510                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14511 00001EE8 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 14512 00001EEA 09F9                    	or	cx,di		; is address == 0?
 14513 00001EEC 740C                    	jz	short lru1	; invalid local SFT, find one
 14514                                  
 14515                                  gotlocalSFT:
 14516 00001EEE 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 14517 00001EF2 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 14518 00001EF6 F8                      	clc
 14519 00001EF7 E9A900                  	jmp	LRUDone		;clear up SFT and return
 14520                                  
 14521                                  lru1:
 14522 00001EFA C43E[4000]              	les	di,[SFTFCB]	;es:di = SF Table for FCBs
 14523                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14524 00001EFE 268B4D04                	mov	cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]	;cx = number of SFTs
 14525                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14526 00001F02 8D7D06                  	lea	di,[di+SFT.SFTable]	;es:di = first SFT
 14527                                  
 14528                                  	; We scan through all the SFTs scanning for a free one. It also 
 14529                                  	; remembers the LRU SFT for net/Share SFTs and local SFTs separately. 
 14530                                  	; bx = min. LRU for local SFTs
 14531                                  	; si = pos. of local SFT with min. LRU
 14532                                  	; dx = min. LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14533                                  	; bp = pos. of net/Share SFT with min. LRU
 14534                                  
 14535 00001F05 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,-1		; init. to 0xffff ( max. LRU value )
 14536 00001F08 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 14537 00001F0A 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 14538 00001F0C 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 14539                                  
 14540                                  findSFT:
 14541                                  	;See if this SFT is a free one. If so, return it
 14542 00001F0E 26830D00                	or	word [es:di],0
 14543                                  	;or	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ;reference count = 0 ?
 14544 00001F12 744C                    	jz	short gotSFT	;yes, SFT is free
 14545                                  	;;cmp	word [es:di],-1
 14546                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy ;Is it busy?
 14547 00001F14 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1 
 14548 00001F18 7446                    	jz	short gotSFT	;no, can use it
 14549                                  
 14550                                  	; Check if this SFT is local and store its address in LocalSFT. Can be 
 14551                                  	; used for a later regen.
 14552                                  
 14553                                  	; 16/12/2022
 14554                                  	; 08/11/2022
 14555                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 14556 00001F1A 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 14557                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 14558                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 14559                                  	;test	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; network SFT?
 14560 00001F1F 7531                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14561                                  
 14562                                  ;IF installed
 14563 00001F21 E89A61                  	call	CheckShare	;Share present?
 14564                                  ;ENDIF
 14565 00001F24 752C                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14566                                  
 14567                                  	;Local SFT, register its address
 14568                                  
 14569                                  	; !!HACK!!!
 14570                                  	; There is a slightly dirty hack out here in a desperate bid to save  
 14571                                  	; code space. There is similar code duplicated at label 'gotSFT'. We 
 14572                                  	; enter from there if al = 0, update the LocalSFT variable, and since 
 14573                                  	; al = 0, we jump out of the loop to the exit point. I have commented 
 14574                                  	; out the code that previously existed at label 'gotSFT'
 14575                                  
 14576                                  hackpoint:
 14577 00001F26 893E[490F]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14578 00001F2A 8C06[4B0F]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14579                                  
 14580 00001F2E 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Is operation = REGEN?
 14581 00001F30 74BC                    	jz	short gotlocalSFT ;yes, return this SFT for reuse
 14582                                  
 14583                                  	;Get LRU for local files
 14584                                  	
 14585                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 14586 00001F32 26395D15                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14587 00001F36 7306                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 14588                                  
 14589                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 14590 00001F38 268B5D15                	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14591 00001F3C 89FE                    	mov	si,di		;store SFT position
 14592                                  lru4:
 14593                                  	;add	di,59
 14594 00001F3E 83C73B                  	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size ;go to next SFT
 14595 00001F41 E2CB                    	loop	findSFT
 14596                                  	
 14597                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14598 00001F43 49                      	dec	cx ; -1
 14599                                  
 14600                                  	; Check whether we got a net/Share or local SFT. If local SFT
 14601                                  	; available, we will reuse it instead of net/Share LRU
 14602                                  
 14603 00001F44 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 14604                                  	;cmp	si,-1		;local SFT available?
 14605 00001F46 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx ; 20/01/2024
 14606 00001F48 7516                    	jnz	short gotSFT	;yes, return it
 14607                                  
 14608                                  	;No local SFT, see if we got a net/Share SFT
 14609                                  
 14610 00001F4A 89EF                    	mov	di,bp
 14611                                  
 14612 00001F4C 39CD                    	cmp	bp,cx ; -1 ; 20/01/2024
 14613                                  	;cmp	bp,-1		;net/Share SFT available?
 14614 00001F4E 752D                    	jnz	short gotnetSFT	;yes, return it
 14615                                  noSFT:
 14616                                  	; NB: This error should never occur. We always must have an LRU SFT.
 14617                                  	; This error can occur only if the SFT has been corrupted or the LRU
 14618                                  	; count is not maintained properly.
 14619                                  
 14620 00001F50 EB4E                    	jmp	short errorbadSFT ;error, no FCB available.
 14621                                  
 14622                                  	; Handle the LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14623                                  lru5:
 14624                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],dx
 14625 00001F52 26395515                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],dx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14626 00001F56 73E6                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip
 14627                                  
 14628                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+15h]
 14629 00001F58 268B5515                	mov	dx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14630                                  
 14631 00001F5C 89FD                    	mov	bp,di		;store SFT position
 14632 00001F5E EBDE                    	jmp	short lru4	;continue with next SFT
 14633                                  
 14634                                  gotSFT:
 14635 00001F60 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14636 00001F62 74C2                    	jz	short hackpoint	;save es:di in LocalSFT
 14637                                  
 14638                                  	; HACK!!!
 14639                                  	; The code here differs from the code at 'hackpoint' only in the 
 14640                                  	; order of the check for al. If al = 0, we can jump to 'hackpoint'
 14641                                  	; and then from there jump out to 'gotlocalSFT'. The original code
 14642                                  	; has been commented out below and replaced by the code just above.
 14643                                  
 14644                                  ;If regen, then this SFT can be registered as a local one ( even if free ).
 14645                                  ;
 14646                                  ;	or	al,al		  ;Regen?
 14647                                  ;	jnz	short notlocaluse ;yes, register it and return
 14648                                  ;
 14649                                  ;Register this SFT as a local one
 14650                                  ;
 14651                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14652                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es
 14653                                  ;	jmp	gotlocalSFT	;return to caller
 14654                                  ;
 14655                                  ;notlocaluse:
 14656                                  
 14657                                  	; The caller is probably going to use this SFT for a net/Share file.
 14658                                  	; We will come here only on a Open/Create when the caller($FCB_OPEN)
 14659                                  	; does not really know whether it is a local file or not. We
 14660                                  	; invalidate LocalSFT if the SFT we are going to use was previously
 14661                                  	; registered as a local SFT that can be recycled.
 14662                                  
 14663 00001F64 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 14664 00001F66 393E[490F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT],di		;Offset same?
 14665 00001F6A 750E                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14666 00001F6C 3906[4B0F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT+2],ax		;Segments same?
 14667                                  	;je	short zerolocalSFT	;no, no need to invalidate
 14668                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14669 00001F70 7508                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14670                                  zerolocalSFT:	
 14671 00001F72 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14672 00001F74 A3[490F]                	mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14673 00001F77 A3[4B0F]                	mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14674                                  	
 14675                                  notinvalid:
 14676 00001F7A E971FF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14677                                  
 14678                                  	; The SFT we are going to use was registered in the LocalSFT variable.
 14679                                  	; Invalidate this variable i.e LocalSFT = NULL
 14680                                  
 14681                                  ;zerolocalSFT:
 14682                                  	;xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14683                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14684                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14685                                  	;
 14686                                  	;jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14687                                  
 14688                                  gotnetSFT:
 14689                                  	; We have an SFT that is currently net/Share. If it is going to be
 14690                                  	; used for a regen, we know it has to be a local SFT. Update the
 14691                                  	; LocalSFT variable
 14692                                  
 14693 00001F7D 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14694 00001F7F 7508                    	jnz	short closenet
 14695                                  
 14696 00001F81 893E[490F]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14697 00001F85 8C06[4B0F]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14698                                  closenet:
 14699 00001F89 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di	; set thissft
 14700 00001F8D 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es	
 14701                                  
 14702                                  	; If we have sharing or thisSFT is a net sft, then close it until ref
 14703                                  	; count is 0.
 14704                                  	; NB: We come here only if it is a net/Share SFT that is going to be
 14705                                  	; recycled -- no need to check for this.
 14706                                  
 14707                                  LRUClose:
 14708 00001F91 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 14709                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; is ref count still <> 0?
 14710 00001F95 740C                    	jz	short LRUDone	; nope, all done
 14711                                  
 14712 00001F97 E87316                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 14713 00001F9A 73F5                    	jnc	short LRUClose	; no error => clean up
 14714                                  
 14715                                  	; Bugbug: I dont know why we are trying to close after we get an
 14716                                  	; error closing. Seems like we could have a potential infinite loop
 14717                                  	; here. This has to be verified.
 14718                                  
 14719 00001F9C 3C06                    	cmp	al,error_invalid_handle ; 6
 14720 00001F9E 74F1                    	je	short LRUClose
 14721                                  errorbadSFT:
 14722 00001FA0 F9                      	stc
 14723 00001FA1 EB05                    	JMP	short LRUDead
 14724                                  LRUDone:
 14725 00001FA3 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 14726 00001FA5 E81101                  	call	BlastSFT		; fill SFT with 0 (AL), 'C' cleared
 14727                                  
 14728                                  LRUDead:
 14729 00001FA8 E896E4                  	call	restore_world		; use macro
 14730                                  	
 14731 00001FAB 07                      	pop	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 14732                                  
 14733                                  	;getdseg <es>
 14734 00001FAC 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14735 00001FB1 26C43E[9E05]            	les	di,[es:THISSFT]		;es:di points at allocated SFT
 14736                                  
 14737                                  	;;retnc
 14738                                  	;jc	short LruFCB_err
 14739                                  	;retn
 14740                                  
 14741                                  	; 16/12/2022
 14742                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 14743 00001FB6 7302                    	jnc	short LruFCB_retn
 14744                                  	;jc	short LruFCB_err
 14745                                  	;retn
 14746                                  		
 14747                                  LruFCB_err:
 14748 00001FB8 B023                    	MOV	AL,error_FCB_unavailable ; 23h
 14749                                  LruFCB_retn:
 14750 00001FBA C3                      	retn
 14751                                  	
 14752                                  ;LruFCB	ENDP

 14759                                  %if 0
 14760                                  
 14761                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14762                                  ;**** RegenCopyName -- This function copies the filename from the FCB to
 14763                                  ; SFT and also to DOS local buffers. There was duplicate code in FCBRegen
 14764                                  ; to copy the name to different destinations
 14765                                  ;
 14766                                  ; Inputs: ds:si = source string
 14767                                  ;	 es:di = destination string
 14768                                  ;	 cx = length of string
 14769                                  ;
 14770                                  ; Outputs: String copied to destination
 14771                                  ;
 14772                                  ; Registers affected: cx,di,si
 14773                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14774                                  
 14775                                  RegenCopyName:
 14776                                  CopyName:
 14777                                  	lodsb			;load character
 14778                                  	call	UCase		; convert char to upper case
 14779                                  StuffChar2:

 14788                                  
 14789                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14790                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14791                                  
 14792                                  FCBRegen:
 14793                                  	; called from SFTFromFCB. SS already DOSDATA
 14794                                  
 14795                                  	; General data filling. Mode is sf_isFCB + open_for_both, date/time 
 14796                                  	; we do not fill, size we do no fill, position we do not fill,
 14797                                  	; bit 14 of flags = TRUE, other bits = FALSE
 14798                                  
 14799                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 14800 00001FBB 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 14801                                  
 14802                                  	; We discriminate based on the first two bits in the reserved field.
 14803                                  	
 14804                                  	;test	al,80h
 14805 00001FBE A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; check for no sharing test
 14806 00001FC0 741C                    	JZ	short RegenNoSharing	; yes, go regen from no sharing
 14807                                  
 14808                                  	; The FCB is for a network or a sharing based system. At this point 
 14809                                  	; we have already closed the SFT for this guy and reconnection is 
 14810                                  	; impossible.
 14811                                  	;
 14812                                  	; Remember that he may have given us a FCB with bogus information in
 14813                                  	; it. Check to see if sharing is present or if the redir is present.
 14814                                  	; If either is around, presume that we have cycled out the FCB and 
 14815                                  	; give the hard error. Otherwise, just return with carry set.
 14816                                  
 14817 00001FC2 E8F960                  	call	CheckShare		; test for sharer
 14818 00001FC5 7509                    	JNZ	short RegenFail		; yep, fail this.
 14819                                  	
 14820                                  	;mov	ax,1100h
 14821 00001FC7 B80011                  	MOV	AX,MultNET<<8		; install check on multnet
 14822 00001FCA CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - INSTALLATION CHECK
 14823                                  			; Return: AL = 00h  not installed, OK to install
 14824                                  			; 01h  not installed, not OK to install
 14825                                  			; FFh  installed
 14826 00001FCC 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; is it there?
 14827 00001FCE 740C                    	JZ	short RegenDead		; no, just fail the operation
 14828                                  RegenFail:
 14829                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14830                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]	; SS override
 14831 00001FD0 36A1[3A03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_IN_AX] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14832                                  
 14833                                  	;cmp	ah,10h
 14834 00001FD4 80FC10                  	cmp	AH,FCB_CLOSE
 14835 00001FD7 7403                    	jz	short RegenDead
 14836 00001FD9 E89801                  	call	FCBHardErr		; massive hard error.
 14837                                  RegenDead:
 14838 00001FDC F9                      	STC				; carry set
 14839                                  FCBRegen_retn:
 14840 00001FDD C3                      	retn
 14841                                  
 14842                                  	; Local FCB without sharing. Check to see if sharing is loaded. If 
 14843                                  	; so fail the operation.
 14844                                  
 14845                                  RegenNoSharing:
 14846 00001FDE E8DD60                  	call	CheckShare		; Sharing around?
 14847 00001FE1 75ED                    	JNZ	short RegenFail
 14848                                  	
 14849                                  	; Find an SFT for this guy.
 14850                                  	
 14851                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14852                                  
 14853                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 14854                                  	;call	LRUFCB
 14855                                  	;jc	short FCBRegen_retn
 14856                                  	
 14857                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 14858 00001FE3 50                      	push	ax
 14859 00001FE4 B000                    	mov	al,0			;indicate it is a regen operation
 14860 00001FE6 E8EEFE                  	call	LRUFCB
 14861 00001FE9 58                      	pop	ax
 14862 00001FEA 72F1                    	jc	short FCBRegen_retn
 14863                                  
 14864                                  	;mov	word [es:di+2],8002h
 14865 00001FEC 26C745020280            	MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB+open_for_both+SHARING_COMPAT
 14866 00001FF2 243F                    	AND	AL,3Fh			; get drive number for flags
 14867 00001FF4 98                      	CBW
 14868                                  	;or	ax,4000h
 14869 00001FF5 0D0040                  	OR	AX,sf_close_nodate	; normal FCB operation
 14870                                  
 14871                                  	; The bits field consists of the upper two bits (dirty and device) 
 14872                                  	; from the SFT and the low 4 bits from the open mode.
 14873                                  
 14874                                  	;mov	cl,[si+1Ah]
 14875 00001FF8 8A4C1A                  	MOV	CL,[SI+fcb_nsl_bits]	; stick in dirty bits.
 14876 00001FFB 88CD                    	MOV	CH,CL
 14877 00001FFD 80E5C0                  	AND	CH,0C0h 		; mask off the dirty/device bits
 14878 00002000 08E8                    	OR	AL,CH
 14879                                  	;and	cl,0Fh
 14880 00002002 80E10F                  	AND	CL,access_mask		; get the mode bits
 14881                                  	;mov	[es:di+2],cl
 14882 00002005 26884D02                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],CL
 14883                                  	;mov	[es:di+5],ax
 14884 00002009 26894505                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],AX ; initial flags
 14885                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 14886 0000200D 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[ss:PROC_ID] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14887                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 14888 00002011 26894531                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],AX
 14889 00002015 1E                      	push	ds
 14890 00002016 56                      	push	si
 14891 00002017 06                      	push	es
 14892 00002018 57                      	push	di
 14893 00002019 16                      	push	ss
 14894 0000201A 07                      	pop	es
 14895 0000201B BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1		; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 14896                                  
 14897 0000201E B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 14898 00002021 46                      	INC	SI			; Skip past drive byte to name in FCB
 14899                                  
 14900                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 14901                                  ;RegenCopyName:
 14902                                  	;lodsb
 14903                                  	;call	UCase
 14904                                  	;stosb

 15097                                  ;**	BlastSFT - FIll SFT with Garbage
 15098                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15099                                  ;	BlastSFT is used when an SFT is no longer needed; it's called with
 15100                                  ;	various garbage values to put into the SFT.  I don't know why,
 15101                                  ;	presumably to help with debugging (jgl).  We clear the few fields
 15102                                  ;	necessary to show that the SFT is free after filling it.
 15103                                  ;
 15104                                  ;	ENTRY	(es:di) = address of SFT
 15105                                  ;		(al) = fill character
 15106                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = -1
 15107                                  ;		'C' clear
 15108                                  ;	USES	AX, CX, Flags
 15109                                  
 15110                                  BlastSFT:
 15111                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15112                                  	;;;
 15113 000020B9 E8DF28                  	call	SFT_FREE
 15114                                  	;;;
 15115 000020BC 57                      	push	di
 15116                                  	;mov	cx,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 15117                                  	;mov	cx,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 15118 000020BD B93B00                  	mov	cx,SF_ENTRY.size
 15119 000020C0 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 15120 000020C2 5F                      	pop	di
 15121 000020C3 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax	; 0		; clear 'C'-----------------;
 15122 000020C5 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 15123                                  	;mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],ax ; set ref count    ;
 15124                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 15125 000020C8 26894515                	mov	[es:di+sf_LRU],ax	; set lru		    ;
 15126 000020CC 48                      	dec	ax	; -1					    ;
 15127                                  	;mov	[es:di+17h],ax ; 0FFFFh ; -1
 15128 000020CD 26894517                	mov	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax	; set open age to -1	    ;
 15129                                  BlastSFT_retn:
 15130 000020D1 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear     ;

 15132                                  ;Break	<CheckFCB - see if the SFT pointed to by the FCB is still OK>
 15133                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15134                                  ;
 15135                                  ;   CheckFCB - examine an FCB and its contents to see if it needs to be
 15136                                  ;   regenerated.
 15137                                  ;
 15138                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB (not extended)
 15139                                  ;		AL is SFT index
 15140                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - FCB needs to be regened
 15141                                  ;		Carry clear - FCB is OK. ES:DI point to SFT
 15142                                  ;   Registers modified: AX and BX

 15144                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------

 15358                                  ;Break	<SFTFromFCB - take a FCB and obtain a SFT from it>
 15359                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15360                                  ;
 15361                                  ;   SFTFromFCB - the workhorse of this compatability crap. Check to see if
 15362                                  ;	the SFT for the FCB is Good. If so, make ThisSFT point to it. If not
 15363                                  ;	good, get one from the cache and regenerate it. Overlay the LRU field
 15364                                  ;	with PID
 15365                                  ;
 15366                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15367                                  ;   Outputs:	ThisSFT point to appropriate SFT
 15368                                  ;		Carry clear -> OK ES:DI -> SFT
 15369                                  ;		Carry set -> error in ax
 15370                                  ;   Registers modified: ES,DI, AX
 15371                                  ;
 15372                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15373                                  
 15374                                  SFTFromFCB:
 15375                                  	; called from fcbio and $fcb_close. SS already set up to DOSDATA

 15470                                  ; 21/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15471                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15472                                  
 15473                                  ;**	FCBIO2.ASM - Ancient 1.0 1.1 FCB system calls
 15474                                  ;
 15475                                  ;	GetRR
 15476                                  ;	GetExtent
 15477                                  ;	SetExtent
 15478                                  ;	GetExtended
 15479                                  ;	GetRecSize
 15480                                  ;	FCBIO
 15481                                  ;	$FCB_OPEN
 15482                                  ;	$FCB_CREATE
 15483                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE_BLOCK
 15484                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_READ_BLOCK
 15485                                  ;	$FCB_SEQ_READ
 15486                                  ;	$FCB_SEQ_WRITE
 15487                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_READ
 15488                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE
 15489                                  ;
 15490                                  ;	Revision history:
 15491                                  ;
 15492                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 15493                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 15494                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 15495                                  ;				  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 15496                                  ;				  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 15497                                  ;				  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 15498                                  ;		 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 15499                                  ;				  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
 15500                                  ;
 15501                                  ;	    A000   version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 15502                                  
 15503                                  ; Defintions for FCBOp flags
 15504                                  
 15505                                  RANDOM	equ 2				; random operation
 15506                                  FCBREAD equ 4				; doing a read
 15507                                  BLOCK	equ 8				; doing a block I/O
 15508                                  
 15509                                  ;Break <GetRR - return the random record field in DX:AX>
 15510                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15511                                  ;
 15512                                  ;   GetRR - correctly load DX:AX with the random record field (3 or 4 bytes)
 15513                                  ;	from the FCB pointed to by DS:SI
 15514                                  ;
 15515                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to an FCB
 15516                                  ;		BX has record size
 15517                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15518                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15519                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15520                                  
 15521                                  GetRR:
 15522                                  	;mov	ax,[si+21h]
 15523 000021B1 8B4421                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR]	; get low order part
 15524                                  	;mov	dx,[si+23h]
 15525 000021B4 8B5423                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2]	; get high order part
 15526 000021B7 83FB40                  	CMP	BX,64			; ignore MSB of RR if recsiz > 64
 15527 000021BA 7202                    	JB	short GetRRBye
 15528                                  GetExtent_bye:	; 21/01/2024
 15529 000021BC 30F6                    	XOR	DH,DH
 15530                                  GetRRBye:
 15531 000021BE C3                      	retn
 15532                                  
 15533                                  ;Break <GetExtent - retrieve next location for sequential IO>
 15534                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15535                                  ;
 15536                                  ;   GetExtent - Construct the next record to perform I/O from the EXTENT and
 15537                                  ;	NR fields in the FCB.
 15538                                  ;
 15539                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - point to FCB
 15540                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15541                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15542                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15543                                  
 15544                                  GetExtent:
 15545                                  	;mov	al,[si+20h]
 15546 000021BF 8A4420                  	MOV	AL,[SI+SYS_FCB.NR]	; get low order piece
 15547                                  	;mov	dx,[si+0Ch]
 15548 000021C2 8B540C                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT]	; get high order piece
 15549 000021C5 D0E0                    	SHL	AL,1
 15550 000021C7 D1EA                    	SHR	DX,1
 15551 000021C9 D0D8                    	RCR	AL,1	; move low order bit of DL to high order of AH
 15552 000021CB 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15553 000021CD 88F2                    	MOV	DL,DH
 15554                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15555                                  	;XOR	DH,DH
 15556                                  	;retn
 15557 000021CF EBEB                    	jmp	short GetExtent_bye
 15558                                  
 15559                                  ;Break <SetExtent - update the extent/NR field>
 15560                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15561                                  ;
 15562                                  ;   SetExtent - change the position of an FCB by filling in the extent/NR
 15563                                  ;	fields
 15564                                  ;
 15565                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15566                                  ;		DX:AX is a record location in file
 15567                                  ;   Outputs:	Extent/NR fields are filled in
 15568                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 15569                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15570                                  
 15571                                  SetExtent:
 15572 000021D1 50                      	push	ax
 15573 000021D2 52                      	push	dx
 15574 000021D3 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 15575 000021D5 247F                    	AND	AL,7FH			; next rec field
 15576                                  	;mov	[si+20h],al
 15577 000021D7 884420                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.NR],AL
 15578 000021DA 80E180                  	AND	CL,80H			; save upper bit
 15579 000021DD D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
 15580 000021DF D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1			; move high bit of CX to low bit of DX
 15581 000021E1 88E8                    	MOV	AL,CH
 15582 000021E3 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15583                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch], ax
 15584 000021E5 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; all done
 15585 000021E8 5A                      	pop	dx
 15586 000021E9 58                      	pop	ax
 15587 000021EA C3                      	retn
 15588                                  
 15589                                  ;Break <GetExtended - find FCB in potential extended fcb>
 15590                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15591                                  ;
 15592                                  ;   GetExtended - Make DS:SI point to FCB from DS:DX
 15593                                  ;
 15594                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 15595                                  ;   Outputs:	DS:SI point to the FCB part
 15596                                  ;		zeroflag set if not extended fcb
 15597                                  ;   Registers modified: SI
 15598                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15599                                  
 15600                                  GetExtended:
 15601 000021EB 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; point to Something
 15602 000021ED 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; look for extention
 15603 000021F0 7503                    	JNZ	short GetBye		; not there
 15604 000021F2 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; point to FCB
 15605                                  GetBye:
 15606 000021F5 39D6                    	CMP	SI,DX			; set condition codes
 15607                                  getextd_retn:
 15608 000021F7 C3                      	retn
 15609                                  
 15610                                  ;Break <GetRecSize - return in BX the FCB record size>
 15611                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15612                                  ;
 15613                                  ;   GetRecSize - return in BX the record size from the FCB at DS:SI
 15614                                  ;
 15615                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to a non-extended FCB
 15616                                  ;   Outputs:	BX contains the record size
 15617                                  ;   Registers modified: None
 15618                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15619                                  
 15620                                  	; 22/01/2024
 15621                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15622                                  GetRecSize:
 15623                                  	;mov	bx,[si+0Eh]
 15624 000021F8 8B5C0E                  	MOV	BX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ]	; get his record size
 15625 000021FB 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX			; is it nul?
 15626                                  	;jz	short getextd_retn
 15627                                  	; 22/01/2024 (BugFix)
 15628 000021FD 75F8                    	jnz	short getextd_retn
 15629                                  	;MOV	BX,128			; use default size
 15630 000021FF B380                    	mov	bl,128	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15631                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],bx
 15632 00002201 895C0E                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],BX	; stuff it back
 15633 00002204 C3                      	retn

 15640                                  ;BREAK <$FCB_Random_write_Block - write a block of records to a file >
 15641                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15642                                  ;
 15643                                  ;   $FCB_Random_Write_Block - retrieve a location from the FCB, seek to it
 15644                                  ;	and write a number of blocks from it.
 15645                                  ;
 15646                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an FCB

 15648                                  ;		AL <> 0 Not enough room on disk for the output

 15740                                  ;BREAK <FCBIO - do internal FCB I/O>
 15741                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15742                                  ;
 15743                                  ;   FCBIO - look at FCBOP and merge all FCB operations into a single routine.
 15744                                  ;
 15745                                  ;   Inputs:	FCBOP flags which operations need to be performed
 15746                                  ;		DS:DX point to FCB
 15747                                  ;		CX may have count of number of records to xfer
 15748                                  ;   Outputs:	AL has error code
 15749                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 15750                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15751                                  
 15752                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15753                                  	; DOSCODE:5B17h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15754                                  
 15755                                  	; 23/01/2024
 15756                                  	; DOSCODE:5B2Bh (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 15757                                  
 15758                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15759                                  	; DOSCODE:61C9h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15760                                  
 15761                                  FCBIO:
 15762                                  
 15763                                  FEOF	EQU	1
 15764                                  FTRIM	EQU	2
 15765                                  
 15766                                  %define	FCBErr	byte [bp-1]  ; byte	
 15767                                  %define	cRec	word [bp-3]  ; word	
 15768                                  ;%define RecPos	word [bp-7]  ; dword
 15769                                  %define RecPosL	word [bp-7]  ; word
 15770                                  %define RecPosH	word [bp-5]  ; word
 15771                                  %define	RecSize	word [bp-9]  ; word
 15772                                  ;%define bPos	word [bp-13] ; dword
 15773                                  %define bPosL	word [bp-13] ; word
 15774                                  %define bPosH	word [bp-11] ; word
 15775                                  %define cByte	word [bp-15] ; word	
 15776                                  %define cResult word [bp-17] ; word	
 15777                                  %define	cRecRes	word [bp-19] ; word
 15778                                  %define	FCBOp	byte [bp-20] ; byte
 15779                                  ; 23/01/2024
 15780                                  %define bPos bp-13
 15781                                  
 15782                                  	;Enter
 15783                                  
 15784 0000221B 55                      	push	bp
 15785 0000221C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 15786 0000221E 83EC14                  	sub	sp,20
 15787                                  	;mov	[bp-20],al
 15788 00002221 8846EC                  	MOV	FCBOp,AL
 15789                                  	;mov	byte [bp-1],0
 15790 00002224 C646FF00                	MOV	FCBErr,0		;   FCBErr = 0;
 15791 00002228 E8C0FF                  	call	GetExtended		;   FCB = GetExtended ();
 15792                                  	;test	byte [bp-20],8
 15793 0000222B F646EC08                	TEST	FCBOp,BLOCK		;   if ((OP&BLOCK) == 0)
 15794 0000222F 7503                    	JNZ	short GetPos
 15795 00002231 B90100                  	MOV	CX,1			;	cRec = 1;
 15796                                  GetPos:
 15797                                  	;mov	[bp-3],cx
 15798 00002234 894EFD                  	MOV	cRec,CX 		;*Tail coalesce
 15799 00002237 E885FF                  	call	GetExtent		;   RecPos = GetExtent ();
 15800 0000223A E8BBFF                  	call	GetRecSize		;   RecSize = GetRecSize ();
 15801                                  	;mov	[bp-9],bx
 15802 0000223D 895EF7                  	MOV	RecSize,BX
 15803                                  	;test	byte [bp-20],2
 15804 00002240 F646EC02                	TEST	FCBOp,RANDOM		;   if ((OP&RANDOM) <> 0)
 15805 00002244 7403                    	JZ	short GetRec
 15806 00002246 E868FF                  	call	GetRR			;	RecPos = GetRR ();
 15807                                  GetRec:
 15808                                  	;mov	[bp-7],ax
 15809 00002249 8946F9                  	MOV	RecPosL,AX		;*Tail coalesce
 15810                                  	;mov	[bp-5],dx
 15811 0000224C 8956FB                  	MOV	RecPosH,DX
 15812 0000224F E87FFF                  	call	SetExtent		;   SetExtent (RecPos);
 15813                                  	;mov	ax,[bp-5]
 15814 00002252 8B46FB                  	MOV	AX,RecPosH		;   bPos = RecPos * RecSize;
 15815 00002255 F7E3                    	MUL	BX
 15816 00002257 89C7                    	MOV	DI,AX
 15817                                  	;mov	ax,[bp-7]
 15818 00002259 8B46F9                  	MOV	AX,RecPosL
 15819 0000225C F7E3                    	MUL	BX
 15820 0000225E 01FA                    	ADD	DX,DI
 15821                                  	;mov	[bp-13],ax
 15822 00002260 8946F3                  	MOV	bPosL,AX
 15823                                  	;mov	[bp-11],dx
 15824 00002263 8956F5                  	MOV	bPosH,DX
 15825                                  	;mov	ax,[bp-3]
 15826 00002266 8B46FD                  	MOV	AX,cRec 		;   cByte = cRec * RecSize;
 15827 00002269 F7E3                    	MUL	BX
 15828                                  	;mov	[bp-15],ax
 15829 0000226B 8946F1                  	MOV	cByte,AX
 15830                                  
 15831                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 15832 0000226E 360306[2C03]            	ADD	AX,[SS:DMAADD]		;   if (cByte+DMA > 64K) {
 15833 00002273 83D200                  	ADC	DX,0
 15834 00002276 7419                    	JZ	short DoOper
 15835                                  	;mov	byte [bp-1],2
 15836 00002278 C646FF02                	MOV	FCBErr,FTRIM		;	FCBErr = FTRIM;
 15837                                  
 15838                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 15839 0000227C 36A1[2C03]              	MOV	AX,[SS:DMAADD]		;	cRec = (64K-DMA)/RecSize;
 15840 00002280 F7D8                    	NEG	AX
 15841 00002282 7501                    	JNZ	short DoDiv
 15842 00002284 48                      	DEC	AX
 15843                                  DoDiv:
 15844 00002285 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 15845 00002287 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 15846                                  	;mov	[bp-3],ax
 15847 00002289 8946FD                  	MOV	cRec,AX
 15848 0000228C F7E3                    	MUL	BX			;	cByte = cRec * RecSize;
 15849                                  	;mov	[bp-15],ax
 15850 0000228E 8946F1                  	MOV	cByte,AX		;	}
 15851                                  DoOper:
 15852 00002291 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX

 16089                                  ;Break <$FCB_Open - open an old-style FCB>
 16090                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16091                                  ;
 16092                                  ;   $FCB_Open - CPM compatability file open. The user has formatted an FCB
 16093                                  ;	for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16094                                  ;
 16095                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB
 16096                                  ;   Outputs:	AL indicates status 0 is ok FF is error
 16097                                  ;		FCB has the following fields filled in:
 16098                                  ;		    Time/Date Extent/NR Size
 16099                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16100                                  
 16101                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16102                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6362h
 16103                                  
 16104                                  _$FCB_OPEN:			; System call 15
 16105                                  	
 16106                                  	;mov	ax,2 
 16107 000023B2 B80200                  	MOV	AX,SHARING_COMPAT+open_for_both
 16108                                  
 16109                                  ;hkn; DOS_Open is in DOSCODE
 16110 000023B5 B9[2A31]                	MOV	CX,DOS_OPEN
 16111                                  
 16112                                  ; The following is common code for Creation and openning of FCBs. AX is
 16113                                  ; either attributes (for create) or open mode (for open)... DS:DX points to
 16114                                  ; the FCB
 16115                                  
 16116                                  DoAccess:
 16117 000023B8 1E                      	push	ds
 16118 000023B9 52                      	push	dx
 16119 000023BA 51                      	push	cx

 16121

 16132 000023C8 E9BFE2                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR

 16280                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size] ; set sizes

 16282                                  	;MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ],AX
 16283                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+13h]
 16284                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size+2]
 16285                                  	;;mov	[si+12h],ax
 16286                                  	;MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ+2],AX
 16287                                  	;
 16288 0000245B 06                      	push	es
 16289                                  	;les	ax,[es:di+0Dh]
 16290 0000245C 26C4450D                	les	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_time]
 16291                                  	;mov	[si+16h],ax
 16292 00002460 894416                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FTIME],ax	; set time
 16293                                  	;mov	[si+14h],es
 16294 00002463 8C4414                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FDATE],es	; set date
 16295 00002466 07                      	pop	es
 16296 00002467 06                      	push	es
 16297                                  	;les	ax,[es:di+11h]
 16298 00002468 26C44511                	les	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_size] ; set size
 16299                                  	;mov	[si+10h],ax
 16300 0000246C 894410                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ],ax
 16301                                  	;mov	[si+12h],ax
 16302 0000246F 8C4412                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ+2],es
 16303 00002472 07                      	pop	es
 16304                                  	;;;
 16305                                  	
 16306 00002473 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; convenient zero
 16307                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch],ax
 16308 00002475 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; point to beginning of file
 16309                                  
 16310                                  ; We must scan the set of FCB SFTs for one that appears to match the current
 16311                                  ; one.	We cheat and use CheckFCB to match the FCBs.
 16312                                  
 16313                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 16314 00002478 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; get the pointer to head of the list
 16315                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+4]
 16316 0000247D 268A6504                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; get number of SFTs to scan
 16317                                  OpenScan:
 16318                                  	;cmp	al,[si+18h]
 16319 00002481 3A4418                  	CMP	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn]		; don't compare ourselves
 16320 00002484 7407                    	JZ	short SkipCheck
 16321 00002486 50                      	push	ax			; preserve count
 16322 00002487 E848FC                  	call	CheckFCB		; do they match
 16323 0000248A 58                      	pop	ax			; get count back
 16324 0000248B 7309                    	JNC	short OpenFound		; found a match!
 16325                                  SkipCheck:
 16326 0000248D FEC0                    	INC	AL			; advance to next FCB
 16327 0000248F 38E0                    	CMP	AL,AH			; table full?
 16328 00002491 75EE                    	JNZ	short OpenScan		; no, go for more
 16329                                  OpenDone:
 16330 00002493 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; return success
 16331 00002495 C3                      	retn
 16332                                  
 16333                                  ; The SFT at ES:DI is the one that is already in use for this FCB. We set the
 16334                                  ; FCB to use this one. We increment its ref count. We do NOT close it at all.
 16335                                  ; Consider:
 16336                                  ;
 16337                                  ;   open (foo)	delete (foo) open (bar)
 16338                                  ;
 16339                                  ; This causes us to recycle (potentially) bar through the same local SFT as
 16340                                  ; foo even though foo is no longer needed; this is due to the server closing
 16341                                  ; foo for us when we delete it. Unfortunately, we cannot see this closure.
 16342                                  ; If we were to CLOSE bar, the server would then close the only reference to
 16343                                  ; bar and subsequent I/O would be lost to the redirector.
 16344                                  ;
 16345                                  ; This gets solved by NOT closing the sft, but zeroing the ref count
 16346                                  ; (effectively freeing the SFT) and informing the sharer (if relevant) that
 16347                                  ; the SFT is no longer in use. Note that the SHARER MUST keep its ref counts
 16348                                  ; around. This will allow us to access the same file through multiple network
 16349                                  ; connections and NOT prematurely terminate when the ref count on one
 16350                                  ; connection goes to zero.
 16351                                  
 16352                                  OpenFound:
 16353                                  	;mov	[si+18h],al
 16354 00002496 884418                  	MOV	[SI+fcb_sfn],AL 	; assign with this
 16355 00002499 26FF05                  	inc	word [es:di]
 16356                                  	;INC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16357                                  					; remember this new invocation
 16358                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16359                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16360                                  	;;;
 16361 0000249C E82924                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry
 16362                                  	;;;
 16363                                  
 16364                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16365 0000249F 16                      	push	ss
 16366 000024A0 1F                      	pop	ds
 16367                                  	
 16368                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:FCBLRU]		; update LRU counts
 16369 000024A1 A1[1000]                	mov	ax,[FCBLRU] ; 24/01/2024
 16370                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 16371 000024A4 26894515                	MOV	[ES:DI+sf_LRU],AX
 16372                                  ;
 16373                                  ; We have an FCB sft that is now of no use. We release sharing info and then
 16374                                  ; blast it to prevent other reuse.
 16375                                  ;
 16376                                  	;push	ss
 16377                                  	;pop	ds
 16378                                  	
 16379 000024A8 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 16380 000024AC 26FF0D                  	dec	word [es:di]
 16381                                  	;DEC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16382                                  					; free the newly allocated SFT
 16383 000024AF E8565C                  	call	ShareEnd
 16384 000024B2 B043                    	MOV	AL,'C'	 ; 43h
 16385 000024B4 E802FC                  	call	BlastSFT
 16386 000024B7 EBDA                    	JMP	short OpenDone
 16387                                  
 16388                                  ;BREAK	<$FCB_Create - create a new directory entry>
 16389                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16390                                  ;
 16391                                  ;   $FCB_Create - CPM compatability file create. The user has formatted an
 16392                                  ;	FCB for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16393                                  ;
 16394                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB
 16395                                  ;   Outputs:	AL indicates status 0 is ok FF is error
 16396                                  ;		FCB has the following fields filled in:
 16397                                  ;		    Time/Date Extent/NR Size
 16398                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16399                                  
 16400                                  _$FCB_CREATE:		; System call 22
 16401                                  
 16402                                  ;hkn; DOS_Create is in DOSCODE
 16403 000024B9 B9[FC2F]                	MOV	CX,DOS_CREATE		; routine to call
 16404 000024BC 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; attributes to create
 16405 000024BE E82AFD                  	call	GetExtended		; get extended FCB
 16406 000024C1 7403                    	JZ	short DoAccessJ		; not an extended FCB
 16407 000024C3 8A44FF                  	MOV	AL,[SI-1]		; get attributes
 16408                                  DoAccessJ:
 16409 000024C6 E9EFFE                  	JMP	DoAccess		; do dirty work
 16410                                  
 16411                                  ;============================================================================
 16412                                  ; SEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 16413                                  ;============================================================================
 16414                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
