 16416                                  
 16417                                  ; DOSCODE:5DDFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16418                                  
 16419                                  ; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16420                                  ; DOSCODE:5DCBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16421                                  
 16422                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16423                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16424                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16425                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16426                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16427                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16428                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16429                                  ;
 16430                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16431                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16432                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16433                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16434                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16435                                  ;
 16436                                  ;	Modification history:
 16437                                  ;
 16438                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16439                                  
 16440                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16441                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16442                                  ;
 16443                                  ; Inputs:
 16444                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16445                                  ; Function:
 16446                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16447                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16448                                  ; Returns:
 16449                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16450                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16451                                  
 16452                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16453                                  	
 16454                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16455                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DCBh
 16456                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DDFh
 16457                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:647Bh
 16458                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:61E5h
 16459                                  
 16460                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16461 000024C9 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16462 000024CE 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16463 000024D3 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16464 000024D5 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16465 000024D8 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16466 000024DA 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16467                                  NORMFCB4:
 16468 000024DD FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16469                                  
 16470 000024DF 16                      	push	ss
 16471 000024E0 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16472                                  
 16473 000024E1 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16474 000024E4 E89953                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16475 000024E7 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16476 000024E9 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16477                                  
 16478                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16479                                  
 16480                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16481                                  dcf_errj:
 16482 000024EA E99DE1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16483                                  
 16484                                  SearchIt:
 16485 000024ED 16                      	push	ss
 16486 000024EE 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16487                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16488                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16489                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16490 000024EF C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16491 000024F3 57                      	push	di
 16492 000024F4 06                      	push	es
 16493 000024F5 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16494 000024FB 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16495                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 16496                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16497 000024FF E83A0F                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16498                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16499                                  	;call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16500 00002502 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16501 00002506 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16502 0000250A 735A                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16503 0000250C 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16504                                  
 16505                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16506                                  
 16507                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16508                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16509 0000250D EBDB                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16510                                  
 16511                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16512                                  ;
 16513                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16514                                  ;
 16515                                  ; Inputs:
 16516                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16517                                  ; Function:
 16518                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16519                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16520                                  ; Returns:
 16521                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16522                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16523                                  
 16524                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16525                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E5Fh
 16526                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E73h
 16527                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6517h
 16528                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6273h
 16529                                  
 16530                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16531 0000250F 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16532 00002514 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16533                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 16534                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16535                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16536 00002519 B000                    	mov	al,0
 16537 0000251B 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16538 0000251F 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16539                                  
 16540 00002523 16                      	push	ss
 16541 00002524 07                      	pop	es
 16542                                  
 16543 00002525 BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16544                                  
 16545 00002528 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16546 0000252A 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFh
 16547 0000252D 750D                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB6
 16548 0000252F 83C606                  	ADD	SI,6
 16549 00002532 AC                      	LODSB
 16550                                  
 16551 00002533 36A2[6D05]              	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],AL
 16552 00002537 36FE0E[6C05]            	DEC	byte [SS:EXTFCB]
 16553                                  NORMFCB6:
 16554 0000253C AC                      	LODSB				; Get original user drive byte
 16555 0000253D 50                      	push	ax			; Put it on stack
 16556 0000253E 8A4414                  	MOV	AL,[SI+20]		; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16557 00002541 AA                      	STOSB				; Put in correct place
 16558 00002542 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16559 00002545 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Transfer in rest of search contin info
 16560                                  
 16561 00002547 16                      	push	ss
 16562 00002548 1F                      	pop	ds
 16563                                  
 16564                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16565                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16566                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16567 00002549 C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16568 0000254D 57                      	push	di
 16569 0000254E 06                      	push	es
 16570 0000254F C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16571 00002555 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16572 00002559 E8A60F                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT 	; Find it
 16573 0000255C 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16574 00002560 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16575 00002564 7249                    	JC	short SearchNoMore
 16576                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16577                                  	;JMP	SearchSet		; Ok set return
 16578                                  
 16579                                  ;;;	; 24/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16580                                  
 16581                                  ; The search was successful (or the search-next). We store the information
 16582                                  ; into the user's FCB for continuation.
 16583                                  
 16584                                  SearchSet:
 16585 00002566 BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16586 00002569 C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]		; point to the FCB
 16587 0000256D F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16588 00002572 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB1
 16589 00002574 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16590                                  NORMFCB1:
 16591 00002577 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16592 00002578 08DB                    	OR	BL,BL
 16593 0000257A 7506                    	JNZ	short SearchDrv
 16594 0000257C 8A1E[3603]              	MOV	BL,[CURDRV]
 16595 00002580 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 16596                                  SearchDrv:
 16597 00002582 AC                      	LODSB				; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16598 00002583 86D8                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; Search byte to BL, user byte to AL
 16599 00002585 47                      	INC	DI
 16600                                  	;STOSB				; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16601                                  					;  at the start of the search info
 16602 00002586 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16603 00002589 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Rest of search cont info, SI -> entry
 16604 0000258B 86D8                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; User drive byte back to BL, search
 16605                                  					;   byte to AL
 16606 0000258D AA                      	STOSB				; Search contin drive byte at end of
 16607                                  					;   contin info
 16608 0000258E C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16609 00002592 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16610 00002597 740C                    	JZ	short NORMFCB2
 16611 00002599 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,0FFh
 16612 0000259B AA                      	STOSB
 16613 0000259C FEC0                    	INC	AL
 16614                                  	;MOV	CX,5
 16615                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16616                                  	;mov	cl,5
 16617                                  	;REP	STOSB
 16618                                  	; 03/07/2024
 16619 0000259E AB                      	stosw
 16620 0000259F AB                      	stosw
 16621 000025A0 AA                      	stosb
 16622 000025A1 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 16623 000025A4 AA                      	STOSB
 16624                                  NORMFCB2:
 16625 000025A5 88D8                    	MOV	AL,BL			; User Drive byte
 16626 000025A7 AA                      	STOSB
 16627                                  	;MOV	CX,16			; 32 / 2 words of dir entry
 16628                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16629 000025A8 B110                    	mov	cl,16
 16630 000025AA F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 16631 000025AC E9D8E0                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 16632                                  ;;;
 16633                                  
 16634                                  SearchNoMore:
 16635 000025AF C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]
 16636 000025B3 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16637 000025B8 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB8
 16638 000025BA 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16639                                  NORMFCB8:
 16640 000025BD 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16641 000025BE 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16642                                  					;  at the right spot
 16643                                  ; error code is in AX
 16644                                  
 16645 000025C1 E9C6E0                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16646                                  
 16647                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16648                                  
 16649                                  ; DOSCODE:5EE6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16650                                  
 16651                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16652                                  ;
 16653                                  ;   Procedure Name : $FIND_FIRST
 16654                                  ; 
 16655                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 16656                                  ;	    MOV AH, FindFirst
 16657                                  ;	    LDS DX, name
 16658                                  ;	    MOV CX, attr
 16659                                  ;	    INT 21h
 16660                                  ;	; DMA address has datablock
 16661                                  ;
 16662                                  ;   Error Returns:
 16663                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 16664                                  ;	       = error_no_more_files
 16665                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16666                                  
 16667                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16668                                  	; DOSCODE:5ED2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16669                                  
 16670                                  	; 24/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16671                                  	; DOSCODE:6594h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 16672                                  
 16673                                  _$FIND_FIRST:
 16674 000025C4 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 16675 000025C6 36880E[6D05]            	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],CL		; Search attribute to correct loc
 16676                                  
 16677 000025CB BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16678                                  
 16679 000025CE E81553                  	call	TransPathSet		; convert the path
 16680 000025D1 7305                    	JNC	short Find_it 		; no error, go and look
 16681                                  FindError:
 16682                                  	;mov	al,3
 16683 000025D3 B003                    	mov	al,error_path_not_found	; error and map into one.
 16684                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16685                                  FF_errj:
 16686 000025D5 E99DE0                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16687                                  Find_it:
 16688 000025D8 16                      	push	ss
 16689 000025D9 1F                      	pop	ds
 16690                                  
 16691                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16692                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16693                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16694 000025DA C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16695 000025DE 57                      	push	di
 16696 000025DF 06                      	push	es
 16697                                  	
 16698 000025E0 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16699 000025E6 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16700                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 16701                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16702 000025EA E84F0E                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16703                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16704                                  	;call	GET_FAST_SEARCH 	; search
 16705 000025ED 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16706 000025F1 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16707                                  	
 16708                                  	; 16/12/2022
 16709                                  	;JNC	short FindSet 		; no error, transfer info
 16710 000025F5 72DE                    	jc	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16711                                  	;
 16712                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16713                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16714                                  ;FFF_errj:
 16715                                  	;jmp	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16716                                  
 16717                                  FindSet:
 16718 000025F7 BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16719 000025FA C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16720 000025FE B91500                  	MOV	CX,21
 16721 00002601 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB
 16722 00002603 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Save pointer to start of entry
 16723                                  	;mov	al,[si+0Bh]
 16724 00002604 8A440B                  	MOV	AL,[SI+dir_entry.dir_attr]
 16725 00002607 AA                      	STOSB
 16726                                  	;add	si,16h ; 22
 16727 00002608 83C616                  	ADD	SI,dir_entry.dir_time
 16728 0000260B A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_time
 16729 0000260C A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_date
 16730 0000260D 46                      	INC	SI
 16731 0000260E 46                      	INC	SI			; Skip dir_first
 16732 0000260F A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_size (2 words)
 16733 00002610 A5                      	MOVSW
 16734 00002611 5E                      	POP	SI			; Point back to dir_name
 16735 00002612 E83300                   	CALL	PackName
 16736 00002615 E953E0                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; bye with no errors
 16737                                  
 16738                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16739                                  ;
 16740                                  ;   Procedure Name : $FIND_NEXT
 16741                                  ;
 16742                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 16743                                  ;	; dma points at area returned by find_first
 16744                                  ;	    MOV AH, findnext
 16745                                  ;	    INT 21h
 16746                                  ;	; next entry is at dma
 16747                                  ;
 16748                                  ;   Error Returns:

 16857                                  ;**	Directory related system calls. These will be passed direct text of the
 16858                                  ;	pathname from the user. They will need to be passed through the macro
 16859                                  ;	expander prior to being sent through the low-level stuff. I/O specs are
 16860                                  ;	defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16861                                  ;

 17046                                  ;		User tries to delete a current directory

 17132                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17133                                  
 17134                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17135                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17136                                  ;
 17137                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17138                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17139                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17140                                  ;
 17141                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17142                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17143                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17144                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17145                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17146                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17147                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17148                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17149                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17150                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17151                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17152                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17153                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17154                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17155                                  ;
 17156                                  ; Inputs:
 17157                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17158                                  ; Returns:
 17159                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17160                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17161                                  ;
 17162                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17163                                  	
 17164                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17165                                  	
 17166                                  _$CHDIR:
 17167                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17168                                  	;;;
 17169 0000272D 36C606[1011]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17170                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17171                                  	;;;
 17172 00002733 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17173 00002736 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 17174 00002738 E8A751                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 17175 0000273B 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17176                                  ChDirErrP:
 17177                                  	;mov	al,3
 17178 0000273D B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 17179                                  ChDirErr:
 17180                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!
 17181                                  	; 10/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17182 0000273F EBAF                    	jmp	short chdir_errj
 17183                                  
 17184                                  ChDirCrack:
 17185 00002741 803E[7A05]FF            	CMP	byte [CMETA],-1		; No meta chars allowed.
 17186 00002746 75F5                    	JNZ	short ChDirErrP
 17187                                  
 17188                                  ; We cannot do a ChDir (yet) on a raw CDS. This is treated as a path not
 17189                                  ; found.
 17190                                  
 17191 00002748 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 17192 0000274C 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1			; if (ThisCDS == NULL)
 17193 0000274F 74EC                    	JZ	short ChDirErrP		;    error ();
 17194                                  
 17195                                  ; Find out if the directory exists.
 17196                                  
 17197 00002751 E8C111                  	call	DOS_CHDIR
 17198                                  	;Jc	short ChDirErr
 17199                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17200 00002754 729A                    	jc	short chdir_errj
 17201                                  ;
 17202                                  ; Get back CDS to see if a join as seen. Set the currency pointer (only if
 17203                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text
 17204                                  ;
 17205                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS V5.0
 17206 00002756 FF36[DC0A]              	push	word [DIRSTART_HW] ; *
 17207                                  
 17208 0000275A C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 17209                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],2000h
 17210                                  	; 17/12/2022
 17211 0000275E 26F6454420              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_splice>>8
 17212                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 17213                                  
 17214                                  	; 25/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 17215                                  	;mov	dx,[DIRSTART_HW]
 17216                                  
 17217 00002763 742B                    	JZ	short GotCDS
 17218                                  
 17219                                  ; The CDS was joined. Let's go back and grab the logical CDS.

 17426                                  ;============================================================================
 17427                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17428                                  ;============================================================================
 17429                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17430                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17431                                  
 17432                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17433                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17434                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17435                                  ;
 17436                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17437                                  ;
 17438                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17439                                  ;
 17440                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17441                                  ;
 17442                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17443                                  ;
 17444                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17445                                  ;
 17446                                  
 17447                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17448                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17449                                  ;
 17450                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17451                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17452                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17453                                  ;
 17454                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17455                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17456                                  ;
 17457                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17458                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17459                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17460                                  ;
 17461                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17462                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17463                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17464                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17465                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17466                                  ;	    in BX.
 17467                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17468                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17469                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17470                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17471                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17472                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17473                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17474                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17475                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17476                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17477                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17478                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17479                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17480                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17481                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17482                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17483                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17484                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17485                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17486                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17487                                  ;
 17488                                  ;   Error returns:
 17489                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17490                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17491                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17492                                  ;
 17493                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17494                                  ;
 17495                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17496                                  ;   than the above
 17497                                  ;
 17498                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17499                                  ;
 17500                                  ;
 17501                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17502                                  ;
 17503                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17504                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17505                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17506                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17507                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17508                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17509                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17510                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17511                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17512                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17513                                  ;
 17514                                  ;
 17515                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17516                                  ;
 17517                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17518                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17519                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17520                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17521                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17522                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17523                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17524                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17525                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17526                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17527                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17528                                  ;
 17529                                  ;
 17530                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17531                                  ;
 17532                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17533                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17534                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17535                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17536                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17537                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17538                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17539                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17540                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17541                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17542                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17543                                  ;
 17544                                  ;
 17545                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17546                                  ;
 17547                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17548                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17549                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17550                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17551                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17552                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17553                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17554                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17555                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17556                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17557                                  ;
 17558                                  ;
 17559                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17560                                  ;
 17561                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17562                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17563                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17564                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17565                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17566                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17567                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17568                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17569                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17570                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17571                                  ;
 17572                                  ;
 17573                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17574                                  ;
 17575                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17576                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17577                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17578                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17579                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17580                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17581                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17582                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17583                                  ;
 17584                                  ;
 17585                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17586                                  ;
 17587                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17588                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17589                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17590                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17591                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17592                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17593                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17594                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17595                                  ;
 17596                                  ;
 17597                                  ;   =================================================================
 17598                                  ;
 17599                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17600                                  ;
 17601                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17602                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17603                                  ;
 17604                                  ;   =================================================================
 17605                                  ;
 17606                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17607                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17608                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17609                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17610                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17611                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17612                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17613                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17614                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17615                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17616                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17617                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17618                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17619                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17620                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17621                                  ;
 17622                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17623                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17624                                  ;
 17625                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17626                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17627                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17628                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17629                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17630                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17631                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17632                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17633                                  ;
 17634                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17635                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17636                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17637                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17638                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17639                                  ;
 17640                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17641                                  	
 17642                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17643                                  	; DOSCODE:611Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17644                                  
 17645                                  	; 11/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17646                                  	; DOSCODE:610Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17647                                  
 17648                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17649                                  	; DOSCODE:67F7h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17650                                  
 17651                                  IOCTLJMPTABLE:	;label	word

 17670                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 17672 00002823 [D528]                  	dw	query_device_support	; 11h
 17673

 17675                                  _$IOCTL:
 17676 00002825 8CDE                    	MOV	SI,DS			; Stash DS for calls 2,3,4 and 5
 17677 00002827 16                      	push	ss
 17678 00002828 1F                      	pop	ds			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 17679

 17681                                  	;cmp	al,0Fh 
 17682                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 17684 0000282B 770D                    	ja	short ioctl_bad_funj2	; if not bad function #
 17685                                  
 17686                                  	; 14/01/2024
 17687                                  	; 28/05/2019
 17688                                  	;push	AX	; 14/01/2024	; Need to save AL for generic IOCTL
 17689 0000282D 89C7                    	mov	di,ax			; di NOT a PARM
 17690 0000282F 81E7FF00                	and	di,0FFh			; di = al
 17691 00002833 D1E7                    	shl	di,1			; di = index into jmp table
 17692                                  	;pop	AX			; Restore AL for generic IOCTL
 17693                                  
 17694 00002835 2EFFA5[0128]            	jmp	word [CS:DI+IOCTLJMPTABLE]
 17695                                  
 17696                                  ioctl_bad_funj2:
 17697 0000283A E90401                  	JMP	ioctl_bad_fun  ; 10/08/2018
 17698                                  
 17699                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17700                                  ;
 17701                                  ; IOCTL: AL = 0,1
 17702                                  ;
 17703                                  ; ENTRY: DS = DOSDATA
 17704                                  ;
 17705                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17706                                  
 17707                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17708                                  ioctl_getset_data:
 17709                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17710 0000283D E8174B                  	call	SFFromHandle		; ES:DI -> SFT
 17711 00002840 7305                    	JNC	short ioctl_check_permissions ; have valid handle
 17712                                  ioctl_bad_handle:
 17713                                  	;mov	al,6
 17714 00002842 B006                    	mov	al,error_invalid_handle
 17715                                  ioctl_error:

 17843                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17844                                  ;
 17845                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 17846                                  ;
 17847                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 17848                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 17849                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 17850                                  ;
 17851                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 17852                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 17853                                  ;	call.
 17854                                  ;
 17855                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 17856                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 17857                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 17858                                  ;
 17859                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17860                                  
 17861                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17862                                  
 17863                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 17864                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 17865 000028BB E8994A                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 17866 000028BE 727E                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 17867                                  
 17868                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 17869                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 17870                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 17871 000028C0 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 17872 000028C5 757A                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 17873                                  
 17874                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17875                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17876                                  	;;;
 17877 000028C7 E8FEE9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17878                                  	;;;
 17879                                  
 17880                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 17881 000028CA 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 17882                                  	;;;
 17883                                  	; 29/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 17884 000028CE C606[B103]FF            	mov	byte [IOCTL_drvnum],0FFh	; invalidate drive number
 17885                                  					; (for extended -lock/unlock- functions)
 17886                                  	;;;
 17887 000028D3 EB16                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 17888                                  
 17889                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17890                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:68DAh
 17891                                  	; (WINME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6612h)
 17892                                  
 17893                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 17894                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 17895                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2

 17899 000028D8 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category (extended, disk lock/unlock)
 17900 000028DB 7405                    	je      short GenIOCTL_chk_net	; extended (MSDOS/PCDOS 7)
 17901                                  	;;;
 17902                                  
 17903 000028DD 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 17904 000028E0 755F                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 17905                                  
 17906                                  	; 29/01/2024 
 17907                                  	;;;
 17908                                  GenIOCTL_chk_net:

 17910                                  	;;;
 17911                                  
 17912 000028E6 E8C801                  	CALL	Check_If_Net		; ES:DI := Get_hdr_block of device in BL
 17913 000028E9 7556                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 17914

 17917                                  	;;;

 18128                                  	; jnz = net drive (current dir is net)
 18129                                  	; jz = local drive
 18130                                  
 18131                                  	; 03/07/2024
 18132                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18133                                  	; 30/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

 18136                                  				; bit 11 - open/close/remmedia calls supported
 18137                                  				; bit 8 - (new type driver)
 18138                                  				; bit 6 - Generic IOCTL call supported
 18139                                  				; bit 1 - driver supports 32-bit sector addressing
 18140 000029D1 7504                    	jnz     short ioctl_drive_attr2 ; NET device
 18141                                  			; 30/01/2024
 18142                                  			; NOTE: 'jnz' condition is correct for Windows ME
 18143                                  			; 'Get_Driver_BL ' because it tests bit 0 of [drive_flags]
 18144                                  			; but in PCDOS 7.1 'Get_Driver_BL', this flag

 18358                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18359                                  ; Proc name : Get_Driver_BL
 18360                                  ;
 18361                                  ;	DS is DOSDATA
 18362                                  ;	BL is drive number (0=default)
 18363                                  ;	Returns pointer to device in ES:DI, unit number in BL if carry clear
 18364                                  ;	No regs modified
 18365                                  ;
 18366                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18367                                  
 18368                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18369                                  
 18370                                  Get_Driver_BL:
 18371 00002A86 50                      	PUSH	AX
 18372 00002A87 88D8                    	MOV	AL,BL			; Drive
 18373 00002A89 E8854D                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 18374 00002A8C 7221                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_drv
 18375 00002A8E 30DB                    	XOR	BL,BL			; Unit zero on Net device
 18376 00002A90 C606[2303]03            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Net ; 3
 18377 00002A95 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18378                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18379                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18380                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18381 00002A99 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18382                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 18383 00002A9E 26C47D45                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; ES:DI -> Dpb or net dev
 18384 00002AA2 750B                    	JNZ	short got_dev_ptr	 ; Is net
 18385                                  	;;;
 18386                                  	; 30/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 18387                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 18388 00002AA4 E81CE8                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 18389                                  	;;;
 18390                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+1]
 18391 00002AA7 268A5D01                	MOV	BL,[ES:DI+DPB.UNIT]	; Unit number
 18392                                  	;les	di,[es:di+13h]
 18393 00002AAB 26C47D13                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; Driver addr
 18394                                  got_dev_ptr:
 18395                                  	; 30/01/2024
 18396                                  	; cf=0
 18397                                  	;CLC
 18398                                  ioctl_bad_drv:
 18399 00002AAF 58                      	POP	AX
 18400 00002AB0 C3                      	retn

 18402                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18403                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 18404                                  ;
 18405                                  ;
 18406                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 18407                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 18408                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 18409                                  ;
 18410                                  ; On Entry:
 18411                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 18412                                  ;
 18413                                  ; On Exit:
 18414                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 18415                                  ;		- reset if net device
 18416                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 18417                                  ;
 18418                                  ;
 18419                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 18420                                  ;
 18421                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 18422                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 18423                                  ;
 18424                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18425                                  
 18426                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18427                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:639Ch
 18428                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6A91h
 18429                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:68E1h
 18430                                  
 18431                                  Check_If_Net:
 18432                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18433 00002AB1 E8D2FF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 18434 00002AB4 7201                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 18435                                  
 18436                                  ; 30/01/2024 ('Get_Driver_BL' returns with
 18437                                  ;	      'curdir_isnet' condition/ZF, no need to a second test)
 18438                                  %if 0
 18439                                  	;;;
 18440                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, Windows ME IO.SYS)
 18441                                  	PUSH	ES
 18442                                  	PUSH	DI
 18443                                  	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18444                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18445                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18446                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18447                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18448                                  	POP	DI
 18449                                  	POP	ES
 18450                                  	;;;
 18451                                  %endif
 18452 00002AB6 C3                      	retn
 18453                                  
 18454                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 18455 00002AB7 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 18456 00002AB8 E951FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 18457                                  
 18458                                  ioctl_bad_funj3:
 18459 00002ABB E983FE                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_fun
 18460                                  
 18461                                  ioctl_string_errj:
 18462 00002ABE EBB2                    	jmp	short ioctl_string_err  ; 25/05/2019
 18463

 18472                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 18473                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.

 18478                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 18480 00002AC3 75F6                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_funj3 	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18481                                  					;   certainly don't know how to do this
 18482                                  					;   call.
 18483                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320	; See if device can handle this
 18484                                  	; 09/09/2018
 18485                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],40h
 18486 00002AC5 26F6450440              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 ; 0040h
 18487 00002ACA 74EF                    	JZ	short ioctl_bad_funj3 	; NO
 18488                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],23
 18489 00002ACC C606[7E03]17            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVGETOWN	; default to get owner
 18490 00002AD1 3C0E                    	cmp	al,0Eh			; Get Owner ?
 18491 00002AD3 7405                    	jz	short GetOwner
 18492                                  SetOwner:
 18493 00002AD5 C606[7E03]18            	MOV	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVSETOWN ; 24
 18494                                  GetOwner:
 18495 00002ADA B00D                    	MOV	AL,OWNHL ; 13
 18496 00002ADC 88DC                    	MOV	AH,BL			; Unit number
 18497 00002ADE A3[7C03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQLEN],AX
 18498 00002AE1 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 18499 00002AE3 A3[7F03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQSTAT],AX
 18500 00002AE6 06                      	PUSH	ES
 18501 00002AE7 1F                      	POP	DS
 18502 00002AE8 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; DS:SI -> driver
 18503 00002AEA 16                      	PUSH	SS
 18504 00002AEB 07                      	POP	ES
 18505 00002AEC BB[7C03]                	MOV	BX,IOCALL		; ES:BX -> Call header
 18506 00002AEF 1E                      	push	ds
 18507 00002AF0 56                      	push	si
 18508 00002AF1 E88324                  	call	DEVIOCALL2

 18511                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18512                                  	;TEST	word [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT],STERR ;Error?
 18513                                  	;test	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],80h
 18514 00002AF6 36F606[8003]80          	TEST	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],(STERR>>8)
 18515 00002AFC 75C0                    	jnz	short ioctl_string_errj
 18516 00002AFE 36A0[7D03]              	MOV	AL,[SS:IOCALL_REQUNIT]	; Get owner returned by device
 18517                                  					; owner returned is 1-based.

 18526                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_DELETE - Internal DELETE call for MS-DOS
 18527                                  ;	NAME	DOS_DELETE
 18528                                  
 18529                                  ;
 18530                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 18531                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 18532                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 18533                                  ;
 18534                                  
 18535                                  ;**	DELETE.ASM - Low level routine for deleting files
 18536                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18537                                  ;		DOS_DELETE
 18538                                  ;		REN_DEL_Check
 18539                                  ;		FastOpen_Delete	       ; DOS 3.3
 18540                                  ;		FastOpen_Update	       ; DOS 3.3
 18541                                  
 18542                                  ;   Revision history:
 18543                                  ;
 18544                                  ;   A000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 18545                                  ;   A001  Fastopen Rename fix	April 1989
 18546                                  
 18547                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 18548                                  
 18549                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 18550                                  ;	i_need	Creating,BYTE
 18551                                  ;	i_need	DELALL,BYTE
 18552                                  ;	i_need	THISDPB,DWORD
 18553                                  ;	i_need	THISSFT,DWORD
 18554                                  ;	i_need	THISCDS,DWORD
 18555                                  ;	i_need	CURBUF,DWORD
 18556                                  ;	i_need	ATTRIB,BYTE
 18557                                  ;	i_need	SATTRIB,BYTE
 18558                                  ;	i_need	WFP_START,WORD
 18559                                  ;	i_need	REN_WFP,WORD			 ;BN001
 18560                                  ;	i_need	NAME1,BYTE			 ;BN001
 18561                                  ;	i_need	FoundDel,BYTE
 18562                                  ;	i_need	AUXSTACK,BYTE
 18563                                  ;	i_need	VOLCHNG_FLAG,BYTE
 18564                                  ;	i_need	JShare,DWORD
 18565                                  ;	i_need	FastOpenTable,BYTE		  ; DOS 3.3
 18566                                  ;	i_need	FastTable,BYTE			  ; DOS 4.00
 18567                                  ;
 18568                                  ;	i_need	Del_ExtCluster,WORD		  ; DOS 4.00
 18569                                  ;
 18570                                  ;	i_need	SAVE_BX,WORD			  ; DOS 4.00
 18571                                  ;	i_need	DMAADD,DWORD
 18572                                  ;	i_need	RENAMEDMA,BYTE
 18573                                  
 18574                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18575                                  ;
 18576                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_DELETE
 18577                                  ;
 18578                                  ; Inputs:
 18579                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 18580                                  ;		terminated)
 18581                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 18582                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 18583                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 18584                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 18585                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 18586                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 18587                                  ; Function:
 18588                                  ;	Delete the specified file(s)
 18589                                  ; Outputs:
 18590                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 18591                                  ;		OK
 18592                                  ;	CARRY SET
 18593                                  ;	    AX is error code
 18594                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 18595                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 18596                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 18597                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 18598                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 18599                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 18600                                  ;		error_access_denied
 18601                                  ;			Attempt to delete device or directory
 18602                                  ;		***error_sharing_violation***
 18603                                  ;			Deny both access required, generates an INT 24.
 18604                                  ;			This error is NOT returned. The INT 24H is generated,
 18605                                  ;			  and the file is ignored (not deleted). Delete will
 18606                                  ;			  simply continue on looking for more files.
 18607                                  ;			  Carry will NOT be set in this case.
 18608                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 18609                                  ;
 18610                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18611                                  
 18612                                  FILEFOUND   equ 01h
 18613                                  FILEDELETED equ 10h
 18614                                  
 18615                                  	; 12/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 18616                                  	; DOSCODE:63E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 18617                                  
 18618                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IBMDOS.COM)
 18619                                  	; DOSCODE:6B11h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 18620                                  
 18621                                  DOS_DELETE:
 18622                                  
 18623                                  ;hkn; DOS_Delete is called from file.asm and fcbio.asm. DS has been set up 
 18624                                  ;hkn; appropriately at this point.
 18625                                  
 18626 00002B05 E8FEEC                  	call	TestNet
 18627 00002B08 7306                    	JNC	short LOCAL_DELETE
 18628                                  
 18629                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 18630                                  ;	transfer NET_DELETE
 18631                                  ;ELSE

 18909                                  ;Break	<REN_DEL_Check - check for access for rename and delete>
 18910                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18911                                  ; Procedure Name : REN_DEL_Check
 18912                                  ;
 18913                                  ; Inputs:
 18914                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 18915                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX points to entry
 18916                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI points to firclus field of entry
 18917                                  ;	[WFP_Start] points to name
 18918                                  ; Function:
 18919                                  ;	Check for Exclusive access on given file.
 18920                                  ;	  Used by RENAME, SET_FILE_INFO, and DELETE.
 18921                                  ; Outputs:
 18922                                  ;	ES:BP = [THISDPB]
 18923                                  ;	NOTE: The WFP string pointed to by [WFP_Start] Will be Modified. The
 18924                                  ;		last element will be loaded from the directory entry. This is
 18925                                  ;		so the name given to the sharer doesn't have any meta chars in
 18926                                  ;		it.
 18927                                  ;	Carry set if sharing violation, INT 24H generated
 18928                                  ;	    NOTE THAT AX IS NOT error_sharing_violation.
 18929                                  ;		This is because input AX is preserved.
 18930                                  ;		Caller must set the error if needed.
 18931                                  ;	Carry clear
 18932                                  ;		OK
 18933                                  ; AX,DS,BX,SI,DI preserved
 18934                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18935                                  
 18936                                  	; 31/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18937                                  	
 18938                                  REN_DEL_Check:
 18939                                  
 18940 00002C5F 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 18941 00002C60 57                      	PUSH	DI
 18942 00002C61 50                      	PUSH	AX
 18943 00002C62 53                      	PUSH	BX
 18944 00002C63 56                      	PUSH	SI		; Save CURBUF pointers
 18945                                  	
 18946 00002C64 16                      	push	ss
 18947 00002C65 07                      	pop	es
 18948                                  
 18949                                  ;hkn; context ES will assume ES to DOSDATA
 18950                                  ;hkn; ASSUME	ES:DOSGROUP
 18951                                  
 18952                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18953 00002C66 368B3E[B205]            	MOV	DI,[SS:WFP_START] ; ES:DI -> WFP
 18954 00002C6B 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX
 18955                                  
 18956                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18957 00002C6D 368E1E[E405]            	MOV	DS,[SS:CURBUF+2] ; DS:SI -> entry (FCB style name)
 18958 00002C72 89FB                    	MOV	BX,DI		; Set backup limit for skipback
 18959                                  	;ADD	BX,2		; Skip over d: to point to leading '\'
 18960                                  	; 31/01/2024
 18961 00002C74 43                      	inc	bx
 18962 00002C75 43                      	inc	bx
 18963 00002C76 E82DEB                  	call	StrLen		; CX is length of ES:DI including NUL
 18964 00002C79 49                      	DEC	CX		; Don't include nul in count
 18965 00002C7A 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX		; Point to NUL at end of string
 18966 00002C7C E8444E                  	call	SkipBack	; Back up one element
 18967 00002C7F 47                      	INC	DI		; Point to start of last element
 18968                                  
 18969                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18970                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18971                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 18973                                  	;

 18975 00002C88 5E                      	POP	SI		; Get back entry pointers
 18976 00002C89 5B                      	POP	BX

 18978 00002C8B 56                      	PUSH	SI		; Back on stack
 18979                                  	
 18980 00002C8C 16                      	push	ss
 18981 00002C8D 1F                      	pop	ds
 18982                                  
 18983                                  ;hkn; context DS will assume ES to DOSDATA
 18984                                  ;hkn; ASSUME	DS:DOSGROUP
 18985

 18987                                  	;push	es              ; (not necessary) ; 31/01/2024
 18988                                  	;push	di
 18989                                  
 18990                                  ; Close the file if possible by us.
 18991                                  ;
 18992                                  ;if installed
 18993 00002C8E FF1E[C400]              	Call	far [JShare+(13*4)] ; 13 = ShCloseFile
 18994                                  ;else
 18995                                  ;	Call	ShCloseFile
 18996                                  ;endif
 18997                                  	;;;
 18998                                  	; 31/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18999                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 19000 00002C92 803E[0303]FF            	cmp	byte [fShare],0FFh
 19001 00002C97 750A                    	jne	short rdc_1
 19002 00002C99 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 19003 00002C9D 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 19004 00002CA1 EB0A                    	jmp	short rdc_2
 19005                                  rdc_1:
 19006                                  	;;;
 19007 00002CA3 8C1E[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],DS
 19008

 19014                                  	;pop	di
 19015                                  	;pop	es
 19016                                  	;

 19022                                  				; requires exclusive access

 19029 00002CCA 26C7050000              	mov	word [ES:DI],0	; Pretend closed and free
 19030                                  	
 19031 00002CCF E83654                  	call	ShareEnd	; Tell sharer we're done with THISSFT
 19032 00002CD2 F8                      	CLC
 19033                                  CheckDone:
 19034 00002CD3 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 19035 00002CD7 5E                      	POP	SI
 19036 00002CD8 5B                      	POP	BX

 19038 00002CDA 5F                      	POP	DI
 19039 00002CDB 1F                      	POP	DS

 19047                                  
 19048                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_RENAME - Internal RENAME call for MS-DOS
 19049                                  ;	NAME	DOS_RENAME
 19050                                  
 19051                                  ;**	Low level routine for renaming files
 19052                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19053                                  ;	DOS_RENAME
 19054                                  ;
 19055                                  ;	Modification history:
 19056                                  ;
 19057                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 19058                                  
 19059                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19060                                  ;
 19061                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_RENAME
 19062                                  ;
 19063                                  ; Inputs:
 19064                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to SOURCE WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3
 19065                                  ;		chars, NUL terminated)
 19066                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string [SOURCE]
 19067                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 19068                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 19069                                  ;	[REN_WFP] Points to DEST WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3
 19070                                  ;		chars, NUL terminated)
 19071                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 19072                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 19073                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 19074                                  ; Function:
 19075                                  ;	Rename the specified file(s)
 19076                                  ;	NOTE: This routine uses most of AUXSTACK as a temp buffer.

 19078                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 19079                                  ;	    OK
 19080                                  ;	CARRY SET
 19081                                  ;	    AX is error code
 19082                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 19083                                  ;			No match for source, or dest path invalid
 19084                                  ;		error_not_same_device
 19085                                  ;			Source and dest are on different devices
 19086                                  ;		error_access_denied
 19087                                  ;			Directory specified (not simple rename),
 19088                                  ;			Device name given, Destination exists.
 19089                                  ;			NOTE: In third case some renames may have
 19090                                  ;			 been done if metas.
 19091                                  ;		error_path_not_found
