 28113 00004837 732F                    	jnc	short UNP_OK

 28115 00004839 5E                      	pop	si
 28116 0000483A C3                      	retn
 28117                                  
 28118                                  SETROOTSRCH:
 28119 0000483B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 28120                                  SETROOTSRCH2:
 28121 0000483D A3[EE0A]                	mov	[ROOTCLUST_HW],ax ;0

 28333 0000493F 07                      	pop	es

 28336 00004941 26034F04                	add	cx,[es:bx+4]	; SFT.SFCount ; number of entries in the table

 28437                                  ;============================================================================
 28438                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28439                                  ;============================================================================
 28440                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28441                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28442                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28443                                  
 28444                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28445                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28446                                  
 28447                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28448                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28449                                  ;
 28450                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28451                                  ;
 28452                                  ; Inputs:
 28453                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28454                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28455                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28456                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28457                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28458                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28459                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28460                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28461                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28462                                  ; Function:
 28463                                  ;	Crack the path
 28464                                  ; Outputs:
 28465                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28466                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28467                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28468                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28469                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28470                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28471                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28472                                  ;	   Zero set
 28473                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28474                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28475                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28476                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28477                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28478                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28479                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28480                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28481                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28482                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28483                                  ;	ELSE
 28484                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28485                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28486                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28487                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28488                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28489                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28490                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28491                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28492                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28493                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28494                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28495                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28496                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28497                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28498                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28499                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28500                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28501                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28502                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28503                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28504                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28505                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28506                                  
 28507                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28508                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28509                                  
 28510                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28511                                  
 28512                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28513                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28514                                  
 28515                                  GETPATH:
 28516                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28517 000049C3 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28518                                  
 28519                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28520                                  
 28521                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28522                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28523                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28524                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28525                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28526 000049C9 E8F7C8                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28527                                  	;
 28528 000049CC C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28529                                  
 28530                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28531                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28532                                  
 28533 000049D2 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28534                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28535                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28536 000049D6 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28537 000049DB 7435                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28538                                  
 28539                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28540                                  
 28541 000049DD 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28542                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28543                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28544                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28545                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28546                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 28547 000049E0 E87300                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 28548 000049E3 722B                    	JC	short InternalError
 28549                                  
 28550                                  Build_devJ:
 28551 000049E5 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28552 000049E8 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28553                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28554                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 28555                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 28556                                  					; "finding" a char device
 28557                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 28558                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 28559                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 28560                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28561 000049EB E8CCC8                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk
 28562                                  
 28563                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 28564                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 28565                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 28566                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 28567                                  ;
 28568                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 28569                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 28570                                  
 28571                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 28572 000049EE 16                      	push	ss
 28573 000049EF 07                      	pop	es
 28574                                  
 28575                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28576 000049F0 BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 28577 000049F3 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 28578 000049F7 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28579 000049F9 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 28580                                  MoveLoop:
 28581 000049FC AC                      	lodsb
 28582 000049FD AA                      	stosb
 28583 000049FE 3C20                    	cmp	al," "
 28584 00004A00 7402                    	jz	short NoSave
 28585                                  
 28586 00004A02 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28587                                  NoSave:
 28588 00004A04 E2F6                    	loop	MoveLoop
 28589                                  
 28590                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 28591                                  ; at this point.
 28592                                  
 28593 00004A06 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 28594                                  	;mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 28595                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28596 00004A08 880D                    	mov	[di],cl ; 0
 28597 00004A0A E84B02                  	call	Build_device_ent	; Clears carry sets zero
 28598 00004A0D FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 28599 00004A0F C3                      	retn
 28600                                  
 28601                                  InternalError:
 28602                                  InternalError_loop:
 28603 00004A10 EBFE                    	JMP	short InternalError_loop ; freeze
 28604                                  
 28605                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 28606                                  
 28607                                  CrackIt:
 28608                                  ; 15/02/2024
 28609                                  %if 0
 28610                                  	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 28611                                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?
 28612                                  	JNZ	short LOOK_SING		; Yes, use it.
 28613                                  	LEA	SI,[DI+3]		; skip D:\.

 28615                                  %endif

 28617 00004A12 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_directory+attr_system+attr_hidden
 28618                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 28619 00004A17 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28620 00004A1B B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 28621                                  	;;;
 28622                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28623                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+4Bh]
 28624 00004A1E 268B5D4B                	mov	bx,[es:di+curdir.ID+2]
 28625 00004A22 891E[EE0A]              	mov	[ROOTCLUST_HW],bx
 28626                                  	;;;
 28627                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+73]
 28628 00004A26 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 28629 00004A2A 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28630                                  
 28631                                  ; AX = -1
 28632                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. This number is -1 if the media
 28633                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 28634                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 28635                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 28636                                  
 28637 00004A2E 39C6                    	CMP	SI,AX			; if Current directory is not part
 28638 00004A30 740A                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 28639                                  	;;;
 28640                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28641 00004A32 3906[EE0A]              	cmp	[ROOTCLUST_HW],ax ; 0FFFFh
 28642                                  	;jnz	short CrackIt2
 28643                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 28644 00004A36 7511                    	jne	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER
 28645                                  	;;;
 28646 00004A38 39C3                    	CMP	BX,AX			; is the current directory cluster valid
 28647                                  
 28648                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28649                                  	;JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack from the root
 28650                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 28651 00004A3A 750D                    	jne	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER
 28652                                  
 28653                                  ; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 28654                                  %if 0
 28655                                  
 28656                                  CrackIt2:	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28657                                  
 28658                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 28659                                  	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ; for fastopen ?
 28660                                  	JZ	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER	; no
 28661                                  
 28662                                  	PUSH	ES			; save registers
 28663                                  	PUSH	DI

 28665                                  	PUSH	word [SI-1]		; save \ and 1st char of next element
 28666                                  	PUSH	SI
 28667                                  	PUSH	BX
 28668                                  	;;; 15/02/2024
 28669                                  	push	word [ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28670                                  	;;;

 28672                                  	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]

 28678                                  	;mov	al,1

 28684                                  	JC	short GO_Chk_end1 	;fastopen not installed, or wrong drive.
 28685                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster
 28686                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28687                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0		;fastopen has current dir info?
 28688                                  	;JE	short GO_Chk_end	;yes. Go to got_search_cluster
 28689                                  	;stc

 28692                                  	cmp	byte [si],1
 28693                                  GO_Chk_end1:	; 29/12/2022
 28694                                  	cmc 
 28695                                  	; [si] = 0 -> cf = 0
 28696                                  	; [si] > 0 -> cf = 1
 28697                                  
 28698                                  ;GO_Chk_end1:
 28699                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28700                                  	;clc
 28701

 28703                                  	;;; 15/02/2024
 28704                                  	pop	word [ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28705                                  	;;;

 28707                                  	POP	SI
 28708                                  	POP	word [SI-1]
 28709                                  	POP	CX
 28710                                  	POP	DI
 28711                                  	POP	ES
 28712                                  	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 28713                                  %endif

 28715                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28716                                  ;
 28717                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 28718                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 28719                                  
 28720                                  NO_CURR_D:
 28721 00004A3C 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 28722                                  	;LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 28723                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28724 00004A40 83C603                  	add	si,3
 28725 00004A43 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 28726 00004A47 EB37                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 28727                                  
 28728                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 28729                                  ; of specified cluster.
 28730                                  
 28731                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 28732 00004A49 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 28733 00004A4D E8C6FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 28734                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 28735                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 28736                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28737 00004A50 733E                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 28738                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28739                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 28740                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 28741                                  SETFERR:
 28742 00004A52 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 28743 00004A54 F9                      	STC
 28744 00004A55 C3                      	retn
 28745                                  
 28746                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28747                                  ;
 28748                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 28749                                  ;
 28750                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 28751                                  ;   device.
 28752                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 28753                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28754                                  
 28755                                  CHKDEV:
 28756 00004A56 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 28757                                  	;MOV	DI,SS
 28758                                  	;MOV	ES,DI
 28759                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28760 00004A58 16                      	push	ss
 28761 00004A59 07                      	pop	es
 28762                                  
 28763 00004A5A BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28764 00004A5D B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 28765                                  TESTLOOP:
 28766 00004A60 E8D80F                  	call	GETLET
 28767                                  
 28768 00004A63 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 28769 00004A65 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 28770 00004A67 E82510                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 28771 00004A6A 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 28772 00004A6C 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28773 00004A6E 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 28774                                  
 28775 00004A70 AA                      	STOSB
 28776 00004A71 E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 28777                                  NOTDEV:
 28778 00004A73 F9                      	STC
 28779 00004A74 C3                      	retn
 28780                                  
 28781                                  TESTDEVICE:
 28782                                  	;ADD	CX,2
 28783                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28784 00004A75 41                      	inc	cx
 28785 00004A76 41                      	inc	cx
 28786 00004A77 B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 28787 00004A79 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28788                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28789                                  	;MOV	DS,AX
 28790                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28791 00004A7B 16                      	push	ss
 28792 00004A7C 1F                      	pop	ds
 28793                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 28794                                  	;retn
 28795                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28796 00004A7D E97A01                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 28797                                  
 28798                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 28799                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28800                                  ;
 28801                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 28802                                  ;
 28803                                  ; Inputs:
 28804                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 28805                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 28806                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 28807                                  ; Function:
 28808                                  ;	Search from root for path
 28809                                  ; Outputs:
 28810                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 28811                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 28812                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 28813                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28814                                  
 28815                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28816                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28817                                  
 28818                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28819                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8C9Dh
 28820                                  
 28821                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:7F82h)
 28822                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:829Eh)
 28823                                  
 28824                                  ROOTPATH:
 28825 00004A80 E8B8FD                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 28826                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28827 00004A83 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 28828                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 28829 00004A85 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 28830 00004A87 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 28831                                  
 28832                                  	;;;
 28833                                  	;; 15/02/2024
 28834                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:82A6h
 28835                                  	;mov	word [CURBUF],0FFFFh
 28836                                  	;;;
 28837                                  
 28838                                  ; Root dir specified
 28839 00004A89 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28840 00004A8C A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28841                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28842                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 28843                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 28844 00004A8F C3                      	retn
 28845                                  
 28846                                  ; Inputs:
 28847                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 28848                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 28849                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28850                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 28851                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 28852                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 28853                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 28854                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 28855                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28856                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28857                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28858                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28859                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28860                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 28861                                  ; Function:
 28862                                  ;	Parse path name
 28863                                  ; Outputs:
 28864                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28865                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28866                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28867                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 28868                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28869                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28870                                  ;	   Zero set
 28871                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28872                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28873                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28874                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28875                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28876                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28877                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28878                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28879                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 28880                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28881                                  ;	ELSE
 28882                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28883                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28884                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 28885                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28886                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28887                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28888                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28889                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28890                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28891                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28892                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 28893                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28894                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28895                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28896                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28897                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28898                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28899                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28900                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28901                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 28902                                  
 28903                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28904                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28905                                  
 28906                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28907                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8CAEh
 28908                                  
 28909                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 28910                                  FINDPATH:
 28911 00004A90 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 28912 00004A91 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28913 00004A92 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 28914 00004A94 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 28915 00004A98 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 28916 00004A9D 7415                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 28917 00004A9F 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28918 00004AA3 750F                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 28919 00004AA5 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28920                                  	;;;
 28921                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28922 00004AA9 A1[DC0A]                	mov	ax,[DIRSTART_HW]
 28923                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 28924 00004AAC 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax
 28925                                  	;;;
 28926                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 28927 00004AB0 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory cluster
 28928                                  NOIDS:
 28929                                  
 28930                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 28931                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 28932                                  ;
 28933                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 28934                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 28935                                  ;
 28936                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 28937                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 28938                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 28939                                  
 28940                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28941                                  	;MOV	ES,AX
 28942                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28943 00004AB4 16                      	push	ss
 28944 00004AB5 07                      	pop	es
 28945                                  
 28946                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28947 00004AB6 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28948 00004AB9 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 28949 00004ABC AA                      	STOSB
 28950 00004ABD AB                      	STOSW
 28951 00004ABE AB                      	STOSW
 28952 00004ABF AB                      	STOSW
 28953 00004AC0 AB                      	STOSW
 28954 00004AC1 AB                      	STOSW
 28955                                  
 28956                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28957 00004AC2 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28958 00004AC5 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 28959                                  GetNam:
 28960                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28961                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 28962                                  
 28963                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28964                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28965                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !
 28966                                  	
 28967 00004AC7 AC                      	LODSB
 28968 00004AC8 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 28969 00004ACA 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 28970 00004ACC 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28971 00004ACE 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28972 00004AD0 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 28973 00004AD2 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28974 00004AD4 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 28975 00004AD6 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 28976 00004AD8 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 28977                                  StoNam: 
 28978 00004ADB AA                      	STOSB
 28979 00004ADC EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 28980                                  _SetExt:
 28981 00004ADE BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 28982                                  GetExt:
 28983 00004AE1 AC                      	LODSB
 28984 00004AE2 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28985 00004AE4 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28986 00004AE6 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 28987 00004AE8 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28988 00004AEA 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 28989 00004AEC 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 28990 00004AEE 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 28991                                  StoExt: 
 28992 00004AF1 AA                      	STOSB
 28993 00004AF2 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 28994                                  _GetDone:
 28995 00004AF4 4E                      	DEC	SI
 28996 00004AF5 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 28997 00004AF7 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 28998 00004AFA 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 28999 00004AFB 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29000 00004AFC 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 29001 00004AFE 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 29002 00004B00 E9B700                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 29003                                  check_device:
 29004 00004B03 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 29005                                  	;MOV	AL,[SI]
 29006                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29007 00004B04 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29008                                  	; 23/09/2023
 29009                                  	;cmp	byte [si],0
 29010 00004B06 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 29011                                  
 29012                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 29013                                  
 29014 00004B08 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 29015 00004B0C 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 29016                                  
 29017                                  NOT_LAST:
 29018                                  
 29019                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 29020                                  
 29021 00004B10 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29022                                  
 29023                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29024                                  	;context ES
 29025 00004B11 16                      	push	ss
 29026 00004B12 07                      	pop	es
 29027 00004B13 E8E400                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 29028 00004B16 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29029 00004B17 7208                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 29030 00004B19 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 29031                                  	;JZ	short GO_BDEV
 29032                                  	;JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 29033                                  	; 27/06/2024
 29034 00004B1B 7528                    	jnz	short FILEINPATH_j
 29035                                  
 29036                                  GO_BDEV:
 29037 00004B1D 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path
 29038 00004B1E E9C4FE                  	JMP	Build_devJ
 29039                                  
 29040                                  FindFile:

 29282                                  ;

 29343                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>
 29344                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29345                                  ;
 29346                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 29347                                  ;
 29348                                  ; Inputs:
 29349                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA
 29350                                  ;	Filename in NAME1
 29351                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 29352                                  ; Function:
 29353                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29354                                  ; Outputs:
 29355                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29356                                  ;	ELSE
 29357                                  ;	Zero flag set
 29358                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)
 29359                                  ;	     bits 0-4 set from low byte of attribute word
 29360                                  ;	DEVPT = DWORD pointer to Device header of device
 29361                                  ; BX destroyed, others preserved
 29362                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29363

 29375 00004C02 803E[4B05]05            	CMP	byte [NAME1],5
 29376 00004C07 7505                    	JNZ	short NOKTR
 29377 00004C09 C606[4B05]E5            	MOV	byte [NAME1],0E5h

 29391 00004C18 F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVTYP>>8)

 29393                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVTYP
 29394 00004C1C 7410                    	JZ	short SKIPDEV 		; Skip block devices (NET and LOCAL)

 29435                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 29436                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29437                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 29438                                  ;
 29439                                  ; Inputs:
 29440                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 29441                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29442                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29443                                  ; Function:
 29444                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 29445                                  ; Outputs:
 29446                                  ;	BX points to DEVFCB
 29447                                  ;	SI points to dir_first field
 29448                                  ;	AH = input BH
 29449                                  ;	AL = 0
 29450                                  ;	dir_first = DEVPT
 29451                                  ;	Zero Set, Carry Clear
 29452                                  ; DS,ES,BP preserved, others destroyed
 29453                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29454                                  
 29455                                  Build_device_ent:
 29456 00004C58 B82020                  	MOV	AX,"  " ; 2020h
 29457                                  
 29458                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA

 29460                                  
 29461                                  ;	Fill dir_ext  BUGBUG - use ERRNZs for this stuff!
 29462                                  
 29463 00004C5E AB                      	STOSW
 29464 00004C5F AA                      	STOSB				; Blank out extent field
 29465                                  	;mov	al,40h
 29466 00004C60 B040                    	MOV	AL,attr_device
 29467                                  
 29468                                  ;	Fill Dir_attr
 29469                                  
 29470 00004C62 AA                      	STOSB				; Set attribute field
 29471 00004C63 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 29472 00004C65 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,10
 29473                                  
 29474                                  ; Fill dir_pad
 29475                                  
 29476 00004C68 F3AB                    	REP	STOSW			; Fill rest with zeros
 29477 00004C6A E8D0BE                  	call	DATE16
 29478                                  
 29479                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA
 29480 00004C6D BF[6105]                	MOV	DI,DEVFCB+dir_entry.dir_time ; 09/08/2018
 29481 00004C70 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 29482                                  
 29483                                  ; Fill dir_time
 29484                                  
 29485 00004C71 AB                      	STOSW
 29486 00004C72 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 29487                                  
 29488                                  ; Fill dir_date
 29489                                  
 29490 00004C73 AB                      	STOSW
 29491 00004C74 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; SI points to dir_first field
 29492 00004C76 A1[9A05]                	MOV	AX,[DEVPT]
 29493

 29495

 29497 00004C7A A1[9C05]                	MOV	AX,[DEVPT+2]
 29498                                  ;
 29499                                  ; Fill dir_size_l
 29500                                  ;
 29501 00004C7D AB                      	STOSW
 29502 00004C7E 88FC                    	MOV	AH,BH			; Put device atts in AH
 29503                                  
 29504                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA

 29507 00004C85 C3                      	retn

 29509                                  ;Break	<ValidateCDS - given a CDS, validate the media and the current directory>
 29510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29511                                  ;
 29512                                  ;   ValidateCDS - Get current CDS. Splice it. Call FatReadCDS to check
 29513                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
 29514                                  ;   If invalid, reset original CDS to root.
 29515                                  ;
 29516                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisCDS points to CDS of interest
 29517                                  ;		SS:DI points to temp buffer
 29518                                  ;   Outputs:	The current directory string is validated on the appropriate
 29519                                  ;		    drive
 29520                                  ;		ThisDPB changed
 29521                                  ;		ES:DI point to CDS
 29522                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 29523                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 29524                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29525

 29707                                  ; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29708                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - offset 43BDh
 29709                                  
 29710                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 29711                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29712                                  ;
 29713                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 29714                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 29715                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 29716                                  ;
 29717                                  ;	[path]device
 29718                                  ;
 29719                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 29720                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 29721                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 29722                                  ;
 29723                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29724                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 29725                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29726                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 29727                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 29728                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 29729                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 29730                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29731                                  
 29732                                  CheckThisDevice:
 29733 00004D53 57                      	push	di
 29734 00004D54 56                      	push	si
 29735 00004D55 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 29736                                  
 29737                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 29738                                  
 29739 00004D57 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 29740 00004D59 E8330D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 29741 00004D5C 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 29742 00004D5E 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 29743                                  
 29744                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 29745                                  
 29746 00004D5F AD                      	LODSW
 29747 00004D60 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 29748 00004D63 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 29749                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 29750 00004D66 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 29751 00004D68 AC                      	LODSB
 29752 00004D69 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 29753 00004D6B 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 29754 00004D6D 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 29755 00004D6F AC                      	LODSB
 29756 00004D70 E81C0D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 29757 00004D73 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 29758                                  
 29759                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 29760                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 29761                                  
 29762                                  ParseDev:
 29763 00004D75 1E                      	push	ds
 29764 00004D76 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 29765 00004D77 E8590C                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 29766 00004D7A 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 29767 00004D7D F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 29768 00004D7E 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 29769                                  
 29770                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29771 00004D80 16                      	push	ss
 29772 00004D81 1F                      	pop	ds
 29773                                  
 29774                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 29775                                  ;
 29776                                  ; SR;
 29777                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 29778                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 29779                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 29780                                  
 29781 00004D82 A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 29782 00004D85 A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 29783                                  
 29784                                  ; M026 - end
 29785                                  
 29786 00004D88 E86FFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 29787                                  
 29788                                  SkipSearch:
 29789 00004D8B 5E                      	pop	si
 29790 00004D8C 1F                      	pop	ds
 29791                                  
 29792                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 29793                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 29794                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 29795                                  
 29796                                  CheckReturn:
 29797 00004D8D 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 29798 00004D8E 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 29799 00004D90 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 29800                                  Check_Done:
 29801 00004D92 5F                      	pop	di
 29802 00004D93 F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 29803 00004D94 C3                      	retn
 29804                                  NotDevice:
 29805 00004D95 F9                      	STC
 29806 00004D96 EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn
 29807

 29857                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 29858                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29859                                  ;
 29860                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 29861                                  ;
 29862                                  ; Inputs:
 29863                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 29864                                  ;	AH is function code
 29865                                  ;		= 0 Input
 29866                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 29867                                  ;		= 2 Output
 29868                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 29869                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 29870                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 29871                                  ;				   present.
 29872                                  ;	AL = character if output
 29873                                  ; Function:
 29874                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 29875                                  ; Outputs:
 29876                                  ;	AL is character if input
 29877                                  ;	If a status call
 29878                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 29879                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 29880                                  ; For regular files:
 29881                                  ;	Input Status
 29882                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 29883                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 29884                                  ;	Input
 29885                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 29886                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 29887                                  ;	Output Status
 29888                                  ;		Always ready
 29889                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 29890                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29891                                  
 29892                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 30428 00004FD9 36A3[7803]              	MOV	[SS:CALLDEVAD],AX
 30429 00004FDD 36FF1E[7803]            	CALL	far [SS:CALLDEVAD]
 30430                                  
 30431                                  	;;;
 30432                                  	; 22/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 30433 00004FE2 36FE0E[B912]            	dec	byte [ss:DEVIO_IN_PROGRESS] ; unlock (deviocall completed)
 30434                                  	;;;

 30440                                  	JC	short chardev2		;AN000;LB. bad sector or exceeds max sec
 30441                                  %endif

 30451                                  ; 22/11/2022

 30454                                  ;Break	<SETREAD, SETWRITE -- SET UP HEADER BLOCK>
 30455                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30456                                  ;
 30457                                  ; Procedure Name : SETREAD, SETWRITE
 30458                                  ;
 30459                                  ; Inputs:
 30460                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer Address
 30461                                  ;	CX = Record Count
 30462                                  ;	DX = Starting Record
 30463                                  ;	AH = Media Byte
 30464                                  ;	AL = Unit Code
 30465                                  ; Function:
 30466                                  ;	Set up the device call header at DEVCALL
 30467                                  ; Output:
 30468                                  ;	ES:BX Points to DEVCALL
 30469                                  ; No other registers effected
 30470                                  ;
 30471                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30472                                  
 30473                                  SETREAD_XJ:
 30474                                  	;;;
 30475                                  	; 07/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 30476 00004FEA 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 30477 00004FEC EB07                    	jmp	short SETREAD_X
 30478                                  	;;;
 30479                                  
 30480                                  SETREAD_XT:
 30481                                  	;;;
 30482                                  	; 07/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 30483 00004FEE BB[B603]                	mov	bx,TIMEBUF
 30484 00004FF1 53                      	push	bx
 30485                                  SETREAD_XTC:
 30486 00004FF2 B90600                  	mov	cx,6
 30487                                  	;;;
 30488                                  SETREAD_X:
 30489                                  	;;;

 30491 00004FF5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 30493 00004FF7 99                      	cwd
 30494                                  	;;;
 30495
