 35013                                  
 35014                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35015                                  ;
 35016                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35017                                  ;
 35018                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35019                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35020                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35021                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35022                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35023                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35024                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35025                                  ; is simulated.
 35026                                  ;
 35027                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35028                                  
 35029                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35030                                  
 35031                                  CNTCHAND:
 35032                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35033                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35034                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35035                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35036                                  
 35037                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35038                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35039 00005BE4 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35040 00005BEA 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35041                                  
 35042 00005BEC B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35043 00005BEE E875C0                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35044 00005BF1 E80ABF                          CALL	CRLF
 35045                                  around_deadlock:
 35046 00005BF4 16                              PUSH    SS
 35047 00005BF5 1F                              POP     DS
 35048 00005BF6 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35049 00005BFB 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35050 00005BFD E82DDE                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35051                                  NOSWAP:
 35052 00005C00 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35053 00005C01 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35054 00005C05 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35055 00005C09 E835A8                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35056                                  
 35057                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35058                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35059                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35060                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35061                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35062                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35063                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35064                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35065                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35066                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35067                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35068                                  			; else
 35069                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35070                                  
 35071                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35072                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35073                                  
 35074                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35075                                  	
 35076 00005C0C 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35077                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35078 00005C0D 1E                      	push	ds
 35079                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35080 00005C0E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35081 00005C13 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35082                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35083                                  	;;;
 35084 00005C18 C606[B812]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35085                                  	;;;
 35086 00005C1D C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35087 00005C22 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35088                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35089 00005C26 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35090                                  
 35091 00005C2B 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35092 00005C30 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35093 00005C31 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35094 00005C33 F8                      	CLC				
 35095 00005C34 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35096 00005C36 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35097                                  
 35098                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35099                                  do_low_int23:
 35100 00005C38 F8                      	clc
 35101 00005C39 2EFF1E[9C5A]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35102                                  
 35103                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35104                                  
 35105                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35106                                  
 35107                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35108                                  ;
 35109                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35110                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35111                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35112                                  ;
 35113                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35114                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35115                                  
 35116                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35117                                  
 35118 00005C3E FA                      	CLI
 35119                                  
 35120                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35121                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35122                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35123                                  	;POP	AX
 35124                                  
 35125                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35127                                  
 35128                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35129                                  
 35130 00005C3F 50                      	push	ax
 35131 00005C40 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35132                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35133 00005C42 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35134 00005C47 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35135 00005C4A 58                      	pop	ax
 35136 00005C4B A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35137 00005C4E 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35138 00005C4F 58                      	pop	ax
 35139                                  
 35140                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35141                                  
 35142                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35143                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35144                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35145                                  
 35146                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35147 00005C50 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 35148 00005C54 750A                    	JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35149                                  
 35150                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 35151                                  
 35152                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 35153                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35154                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 35155                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35156                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35157 00005C56 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]
 35158 00005C59 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 35159                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 35160                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 35161                                  COMMANDJ:
 35162 00005C5D E991A6                  	JMP	COMMAND
 35163                                  
 35164                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 35165                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 35166                                  
 35167                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 35168                                  	; 29/02/2024
 35169                                  	;ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 35170                                  	;
 35171                                  	;;test	ax,1
 35172                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 35173 00005C60 A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 35174                                  	;
 35175                                  	; 29/02/2024
 35176 00005C62 58                      	pop	ax  ;  (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35177                                  	;
 35178 00005C63 74F1                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 35179                                  
 35180                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35181 00005C65 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 35182                                  
 35183                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 35184                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 35185                                  
 35186                                  ctrlc_abort:

 35380                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35381                                  ;
 35382                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 35383                                  ;
 35384                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 35385                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 35386                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 35387                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 35388                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 35389                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 35390                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 35391                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 35392                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 35393                                  ; Output:
 35394                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 35395                                  ;
 35396                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35397                                  
 35398                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35399                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35400                                  HARDERR:
 35401                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35402                                  	; 30/07/2018
 35403                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35404 00005CF9 97                      	XCHG	AX,DI		  	; Error code in DI, count in AX
 35405                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 35406 00005CFA 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; And off status bits
 35407                                  	;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 35408                                  	;cmp	di,0
 35409 00005CFE 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?

 35411 00005D03 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35412                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35413                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 35414                                  	;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]
 35415                                  	; 15/12/2022
 35416 00005D04 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 35417                                  		; 15/03/2018
 35418 00005D08 36A2[2203]              	MOV	[SS:WPERR],AL		; Flag drive with WP error
 35419 00005D0C 58                      	POP	AX
 35420                                  NOSETWRPERR:

 35422 00005D0F 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX		  ; First sector number to retry
 35423                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35424                                  	;;;

 35440                                  	;;;

 35442 00005D28 263B5606                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]

 35444

 35447                                  
 35448                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35449                                  	;;;

 35451 00005D30 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0

 35453 00005D37 52                      	push	dx
 35454 00005D38 368B16[0706]            	mov	dx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 35455                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 35456 00005D3D 263B562B                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 35457 00005D41 5A                      	pop	dx
 35458 00005D42 7504                    	jnz	short TESTDIR1	; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace

 35524                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the

 35539                                  ;
 35540                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 35541                                  ;
 35542                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 35543                                  ;
 35544                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 35545                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.
 35546                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------
 35547                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 35548                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 35549                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 35550 00005D9F 36803E[2003]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24
 35551 00005DA5 7404                    	JZ	SHORT NoSetFail
 35552 00005DA7 B003                    	MOV	AL,3
 35553 00005DA9 EB74                    	JMP	short FailRet
 35554                                  NoSetFail:

 35556 00005DB0 16                      	PUSH	SS
 35557 00005DB1 07                      	POP	ES
 35558                                      
 35559                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 35560                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may
 35561                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then
 35562                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 35563                                  
 35564 00005DB2 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1 ; 0FFFFh
 35565 00005DB8 740C                    	JZ	short _NoFree
 35566 00005DBA 1E                      	push	ds

 35569 00005DC1 C604FF                  	MOV	BYTE [SI],0FFH

 35571 00005DC5 1F                      	pop	ds

 35575                                  					; Prepare to play with stack

 35580                                  	;;;

 35591                                  faili24:				; AN000;

 35593 00005DE0 EB27                    	JMP	short passi24 		; AN000;IFS.exit
 35594                                  i24yes: 				; AN000;
 35595                                  	;; Extended Open hooks
 35596                                  
 35597 00005DE2 368E16[8605]            	MOV	SS,[SS:USER_SS]

 35599

 35601                                  	;IN	int_fatal_abort		; Fatal error interrupt vector,

 35627                                  	;;;

 35635                                  	
 35636                                  	; 08/07/2018
 35637                                  
 35638                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 35639                                  
 35640 00005E24 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 35641 00005E26 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore
 35642 00005E28 7445                    	JZ	short CheckRetry	; 1 => retry
 35643 00005E2A 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; 3 => fail
 35644 00005E2C 7549                    	JNZ	short DoAbort 		; 2, invalid => abort
 35645                                  
 35646                                  	; The reply was fail. See if we are allowed to fail.
 35647                                  
 35648                                  					; SS override for ALLOWED, EXTOPEN_ON,
 35649                                  					; ALLOWED, FAILERR, WPERR, SFN, pJFN
 35650                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8
 35651 00005E2E 36F606[4B03]08          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; Can we?
 35652 00005E34 7441                    	jz	short DoAbort		; No, do abort
 35653                                  DoFail:
 35654 00005E36 B003                    	MOV	AL,3			; just in case...
 35655                                  					; AN000;EO. I24 error disabled
 35656                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35657                                  	;(MSDOS 6.0, MSCTRLC.ASM, 1991)
 35658 00005E38 36F606[F605]02          	test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF ; 2
 35659 00005E3E 7505                    	jnz	short CleanUp 		; AN000;EO. no
 35660

 35662                                  CleanUp:
 35663 00005E45 36C606[2203]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:WPERR],-1
 35664 00005E4B 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1
 35665                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35666                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2
 35667                                  	;retn
 35668                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35669 00005E51 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35670                                  CleanUp2:
 35671 00005E53 1E                      	push	ds
 35672 00005E54 56                      	push	si
 35673 00005E55 50                      	push	ax
 35674 00005E56 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]
 35675 00005E5A 36C536[AE05]            	LDS	SI,[ss:PJFN]
 35676 00005E5F 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL
 35677 00005E61 58                      	pop	ax
 35678 00005E62 5E                      	pop	si
 35679 00005E63 1F                      	pop	ds
 35680                                  Cleanup_retn:
 35681 00005E64 C3                      	retn
 35682                                  
 35683                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 35684                                  
 35685                                  CheckIgnore:
 35686                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 35687 00005E65 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 35688                                  CheckRI:	; 29/02/2024
 35689 00005E6B 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 35690 00005E6D EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 35691                                  
 35692                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 35693                                  
 35694                                  CheckRetry:
 35695                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],10h
 35696 00005E6F 36F606[4B03]10          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY	; Can we?
 35697                                  	;jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 35698                                  	;JMP	short CleanUp
 35699                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35700 00005E75 EBF4                    	jmp	short CheckRI
 35701                                  	
 35702                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 35703                                  DoAbort:
 35704 00005E77 16                      	push	ss
 35705 00005E78 1F                      	pop	ds
 35706                                  
 35707 00005E79 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 35708 00005E7E 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 35709 00005E80 E8AADB                  	call	SWAPBACK
 35710                                  NOSWAP2:
 35711                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 35712                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 35713                                  
 35714                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 35715                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 35716                                  
 35717 00005E83 803E[5903]00            	cmp	byte [fAborting],0
 35718 00005E88 75AC                    	JNZ	short DoFail
 35719                                  
 35720                                  	; Set return code
 35721                                  
 35722 00005E8A C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 35723 00005E8F 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 35724                                  
 35725                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 35726                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 35727                                  
 35728 00005E91 E95410                  	jmp	exit_inner
 35729                                  
 35730                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35731                                  ;
 35732                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35733                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35734                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35735                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35736                                  ;
 35737                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35738                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35739                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35740                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35741                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35742                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35743                                  ;
 35744                                  ; output:   none.
 35745                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35746                                  
 35747                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35748                                  	
 35749                                  reset_environment:
 35750                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35751                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35752                                  
 35753                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35754                                  
 35755 00005E94 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 35756                                  
 35757                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35758                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35759                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35760                                  
 35761 00005E95 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 35762                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 35763                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 35764 00005E97 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 35765                                  
 35766                                  					; SS override
 35767 00005E99 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 35768                                  
 35769                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 35770                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 35771                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35772                                  					; On process exit.
 35773 00005E9F B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 35774 00005EA2 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 35775                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 35776                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 35777 00005EA4 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 35778 00005EA6 E89DB0                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 35779                                  
 35780 00005EA9 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 35781 00005EAA 06                      	push	es
 35782 00005EAB 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 35783                                  
 35784 00005EAC 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 35785 00005EB1 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 35786 00005EB3 A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 35787                                  
 35788                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 35789                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 35790                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 35791                                  	
 35792 00005EB6 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 35793 00005EB8 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 35794 00005EBA 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 35795 00005EBC 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 35796 00005EBE 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 35797                                  
 35798                                  					; SS override
 35799                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 35800 00005EBF 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 35801 00005EC5 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 35802                                  
 35803                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 35804                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 35805                                  
 35806                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 35807 00005EC7 E85D10                  	call	arena_free_process
 35808                                  
 35809                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 35810                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 35811                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 35812                                  
 35813                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 35814 00005ECA E8C8D6                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 35815                                  
 35816                                  reset_to_parent:
 35817                                  					; SS override
 35818 00005ECD 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 35819                                  
 35820                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 35821                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 35822 00005ED2 16                      	push	ss
 35823 00005ED3 1F                      	pop	ds	
 35824                                  
 35825 00005ED4 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 35826                                  
 35827                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 35828                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 35829                                  
 35830                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 35831 00005ED6 E8AAB9                  	call	ECritDisk
 35832                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 35833 00005ED9 E86108                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 35834                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 35835 00005EDC E8D1B9                  	call	LCritDisk

 35841

 35843                                  %endif
 35844                                  
 35845 00005EDF FA                      	CLI
 35846 00005EE0 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35847

 35849                                  	;;;

 35851                                  	;;;

 35855 00005EF4 8F06[8005]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD]

 35859

 35864 00005F08 E836A5                  	call	restore_world
 35865

 35867 00005F0B 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 35868                                  
 35869                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35870 00005F0C 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG
 35871 00005F0D 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.

 35875 00005F17 58                      	pop	ax

 35881 00005F1C 58                      	POP	AX

 35890 00005F1E 9F                      	LAHF

 35893 00005F23 B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h

 35898 00005F25 50                      	PUSH	AX

 35901                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 35902                                  	
 35903                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35904 00005F26 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]

 35912                                  
 35913 00005F35 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 35914                                  
 35915                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35916                                  ;
 35917                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35918                                  ;
 35919                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 35920                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 35921                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35922                                  ;
 35923                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35924                                  
 35925                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35926 00005F36 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35927                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35928 00005F37 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35929 00005F3A 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35930                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35931                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35932                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35933                                  	
 35934                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35935 00005F3D 1E                      	push	ds
 35936                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 35937 00005F3E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35938                                  
 35939                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 35940                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35941                                  
 35942 00005F43 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35943 00005F45 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35944 00005F47 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35945                                  
 35946                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35947 00005F49 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35948 00005F4D 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 35949                                  NoTrans:

 35951 00005F4F A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 35952 00005F52 1F                      	pop	ds
 35953                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 35954 00005F53 58                      	POP	AX
 35955

 35957                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 35958                                  
 35959 00005F54 56                      	PUSH	SI
 35960                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 35961 00005F55 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 35962 00005F58 E853A7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 35963 00005F5B 5E                      	POP	SI

 35966                                  ;============================================================================
 35967                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35968                                  ;============================================================================
 35969                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35970                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35971                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35972                                  
 35973                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 35974                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 35975                                  
 35976                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 35977                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35978                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 35979                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 35980                                  ;
 35981                                  ;	IsEof
 35982                                  ;	UNPACK
 35983                                  ;	PACK
 35984                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 35985                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 35986                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 35987                                  ;	FAT_operation
 35988                                  ;
 35989                                  ;	Revision history:
 35990                                  ;
 35991                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 35992                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 35993                                  ;
 35994                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 35995                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 35996                                  
 35997                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35998                                  
 35999                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36000                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36001                                  
 36002                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36003                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36004                                  ;
 36005                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36006                                  ;
 36007                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36008                                  ;
 36009                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36010                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36011                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36012                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36013                                  ;
 36014                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36015                                  
 36016                                  IsEOF:
 36017                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36018                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36019                                  	;;;
 36020 00005F5D E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36021 00005F60 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36022                                  
 36023                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36024 00005F62 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36025 00005F69 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36026 00005F6B 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36027                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36028 00005F6E C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36029                                  
 36030                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36031                                  	;;;
 36032                                  
 36033                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36034 00005F6F 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36035 00005F75 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36036                                  
 36037                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36038                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36039                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36040                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36041                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36042                                  
 36043 00005F77 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36044 00005F7B 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36045                                  
 36046 00005F7D 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36047                                  IsEOF_other:
 36048 00005F81 C3                      	retn
 36049                                  EOF16:
 36050 00005F82 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36051 00005F85 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36052                                  
 36053                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36054                                  
 36055                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36056                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36057                                  ;
 36058                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36059                                  ;
 36060                                  ; Inputs:
 36061                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36062                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36063                                  ; Outputs:
 36064                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36065                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36066                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36067                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36068                                  ;
 36069                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36070                                  ;
 36071                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36072                                  
 36073                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36074                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36075                                  	;
 36076                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36077                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36078                                  
 36079                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36080                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36081                                  
 36082                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36083                                  UNPACK:
 36084                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36085 00005F86 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36086 00005F88 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36087                                  
 36088                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36089                                  %if 0
 36090                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36091                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36092                                  	retn				; done
 36093                                  %else
 36094                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36095                                  	;;;
 36096                                  up_1:
 36097 00005F8A 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36098 00005F8E 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36099 00005F90 8B3E[370F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36100 00005F94 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36101 00005F96 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36102 00005F9A 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]
 36103 00005F9E 7502                    	jnz	short unpack_retn
 36104 00005FA0 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36105                                  unpack_retn:
 36106 00005FA2 C3                      	retn	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36107                                  	;;;	
 36108                                  
 36109                                  %endif
 36110                                  
 36111                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 36112                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36113                                  	;;;
 36114                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 36115 00005FA3 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 36116 00005FA8 7510                    	jnz	short up_fat		; not FAT32
 36117                                  	; FAT32
 36118                                  	;mov	si,[es:bp+2Fh]

 36271                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36272                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36273                                  ;
 36274                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36275                                  ;
 36276                                  ; Inputs:
 36277                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36278                                  ;	DX = Data
 36279                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36280                                  ; Outputs:
 36281                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36282                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36283                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36284                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36285                                  ;
 36286                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36287                                  ;
 36288                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36289                                  
 36290                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36291                                  
 36292                                  	; INPUT:
 36293                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36294                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36295                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36296                                  
 36297                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36298                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36299                                  PACK:
 36300                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 36301 00006035 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 36302 00006037 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36303                                  
 36304                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36305                                  %if 0
 36306                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36307                                  	retn				; done
 36308                                  %else
 36309                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36310                                  	;;;
 36311 00006039 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36312 0000603D 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 36313                                  
 36314                                  	;push	ax
 36315                                  	;mov	ax,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; Cluster Data/Content (High Word)
 36316                                  	;mov	[CL0FATENTRY_HW],ax
 36317                                  	;pop	ax
 36318 0000603F FF36[EA0A]              	push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 36319 00006043 8F06[370F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36320                                  
 36321 00006047 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 36322 0000604B C3                      	retn
 36323                                  	;;;
 36324                                  %endif
 36325                                  
 36326                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 36327                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 36329 0000604F 72B4                    	JC	short _DoContext
 36330 00006051 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 36331 00006053 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 36332 00006055 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 36333 00006056 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 36334 00006058 D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 36335 0000605A 59                      	POP	CX
 36336 0000605B 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 36337 0000605E EB2B                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 36338                                  
 36339                                  ALIGNED:
 36340                                  
 36341                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36342                                  	;;;
 36343 00006060 E89500                  	call	IsFAT32
 36344 00006063 7313                    	jnb	short p_fat
 36345                                  
 36346 00006065 368B36[EA0A]            	mov	si,[ss:CLUSDATA_HW]
 36347 0000606A 337502                  	xor	si,[di+2]		; hw of cluster number
 36348                                  					; offset CLUSSAVE+2
 36349 0000606D 81E6FF0F                	and	si,0FFFh
 36350 00006071 317502                  	xor	[di+2],si
 36351 00006074 8915                    	mov	[di],dx
 36352 00006076 EB17                    	jmp	short PACKIN2
 36353                                  p_fat:
 36354                                  	;;;
 36355                                  
 36356                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36357 00006078 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 36358 0000607E 7309                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 36359 00006080 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 36360                                  	;AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 36361                                  	; 01/07/2024
 36362 00006084 80E60F                  	and	dh,0Fh

 36470                                  IsFAT32:

 36486                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36487                                  
 36488                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36489                                  
 36490                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36491                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36492                                  ;
 36493                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36494                                  ;
 36495                                  ; Inputs:
 36496                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36497                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36498                                  ; Function:
 36499                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36500                                  ; Outputs:
 36501                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36502                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36503                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36504                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36505                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36506                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36507                                  ;
 36508                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36509                                  
 36510                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36511                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36512                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36513                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36514                                  
 36515                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36516                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36517                                  
 36518                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36519                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36520 0000610D C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36521                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36522 00006112 50                      	push	ax
 36523 00006113 53                      	push	bx
 36524 00006114 51                      	push	cx
 36525 00006115 52                      	push	dx
 36526                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36527                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36528                                  
 36529                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36530                                  	;;;
 36531                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36532 00006116 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36533 00006118 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36534                                  	;
 36535 0000611C 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36536                                  	;
 36537 0000611D 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36538 0000611F E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36539 00006122 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36540                                  	; FAT32
 36541 00006124 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36542 00006126 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36543 00006128 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36544 0000612A D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36545 0000612C D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36546 0000612E D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36547                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36548 00006130 EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36549                                  mapcl1:
 36550                                  	;;;
 36551 00006132 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36552                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36553                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36554                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36555                                  	;
 36556                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36557                                  	;;;
 36558 00006138 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36559                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36560 0000613A D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36561 0000613C D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36562                                  mapcl2:
 36563 0000613E 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36564 00006140 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36565 00006144 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36566                                  	;;;
 36567                                  Map16:	
 36568                                  
 36569                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36570                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36571                                  %if 0
 36572                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36573                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36574                                  	
 36575                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36576                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36577                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36578                                  %endif
 36579                                  
 36580 00006146 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36581                                  
 36582                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36583                                  ;
 36584                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36585                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36586                                  ;
 36587                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36588                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36589                                  ;
 36590                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36591

 36807                                  ;
 36808                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36809                                  ;
 36810                                  ; Inputs:
 36811                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36812                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36813                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36814                                  ; Function:
 36815                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36816                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36817                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36818                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36819                                  ; Outputs:
 36820                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36821                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36822                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36823                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36824                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36825                                  ;
 36826                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36827                                  
 36828                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36829 000061EF 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36830                                  
 36831                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36832                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36833                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36834                                  	; 15/12/2022

 36840 000061FD E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB

 36842                                  	;retn

 36844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36845                                  ;
 36846                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36847                                  ;
 36848                                  ; Inputs:
 36849                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36850                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36851                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36852                                  ; Function:
 36853                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36854                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36855                                  ; Outputs:
 36856                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36857                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36858                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36859                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36860                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36861                                  ;
 36862                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36863                                  
 36864                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36865                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36866                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36867                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36868                                  
 36869                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36870                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h

 36872                                  
 36873                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36874 00006200 06                      	PUSH	ES

 36918                                  ;

 37020                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 37023                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37024                                  
 37025                                  FAT_operation:
 37026                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37027                                  FATERR:
 37028                                  
 37029                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37030                                  %if 0
 37031                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37032                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37033                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37034                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37035                                  %else
 37036                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37037                                  	;;;
 37038 0000627E E8D6FF                  	call    chk_set_first_access
 37039                                  	;;;
 37040                                  %endif
 37041                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 37042 00006281 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 37043                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 37044 00006285 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 37045                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 37046 0000628A B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 37047 0000628C A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 37048 0000628F E8F2FA                  	call	FATAL1
 37049 00006292 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37050 00006296 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 37051 00006298 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 37052                                  
 37053                                  FATERR_fail:	; 03/03/2024
 37054 0000629A F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 37055 0000629B C3                      	retn
 37056                                  
 37057                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 37058                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37059 0000629C 16                      	push	ss

 37587 000064EC 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx

 37711                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
