 37713                                  ;
 37714                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37715                                  ;
 37716                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37717                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37718                                  ;
 37719                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37720                                  ;
 37721                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37722                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37723                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37724                                  ;; Inputs:
 37725                                  ;;      None
 37726                                  ;; Function:
 37727                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37728                                  ;; Outputs:
 37729                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37730                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37731                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37732                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37733                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37734                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37735                                  ;
 37736                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37737                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37738                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37739                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37740                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37741                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37742                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37743                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37744                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37745                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37746                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37747                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37748                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37749                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37750                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37751                                  ;       RETN
 37752                                  ;
 37753                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37754                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37755                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37756                                  ;
 37757                                  ;; Inputs:
 37758                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37759                                  ;; Function:
 37760                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37761                                  ;; Outputs:
 37762                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37763                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37764                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37765                                  ;
 37766                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37767                                  ;       ;retz
 37768                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37769                                  ;
 37770                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37771                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37772                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37773                                  ;
 37774                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37775                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37776                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37777                                  ;	
 37778                                  ;	push	ax
 37779                                  ;	or	al,1
 37780                                  ;	pop	ax
 37781                                  ;	retn	
 37782                                  ;
 37783                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37784                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37785                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
 37786                                  
 37787                                  ;============================================================================
 37788                                  ; BUF.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37789                                  ;============================================================================
 37790                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37791                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37792                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37793                                  
 37794                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37795                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37796                                  
 37797                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37798                                  ;
 37799                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37800                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37801                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37802                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37803                                  ;	PointComp
 37804                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37805                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37806                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37807                                  ;	BufWrite
 37808                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37809                                  ;
 37810                                  ;	Revision history:
 37811                                  ;
 37812                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37813                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37814                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37815                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37816                                  
 37817                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37818                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37819                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37820                                  ; Inputs:
 37821                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37822                                  ; Function:
 37823                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37824                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37825                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37826                                  ; Outputs:
 37827                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37828                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37829                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37830                                  ; No other registers altered
 37831                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37832                                  
 37833                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37834                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37835                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37836                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37837                                  
 37838                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37839                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37840                                  
 37841                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37842 0000655E 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37843 00006563 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37844 0000656A 36893E[1B11]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37845 0000656F C3                      	retn
 37846                                  
 37847                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37849                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37850                                  ; Inputs:
 37851                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37852                                  ; Function:
 37853                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37854                                  ; Outputs:
 37855                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37856                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37858                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37859                                  
 37860                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37861                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37862                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37863                                  ;	push	es
 37864                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37865                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37866                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37867                                  ;	push	es
 37868                                  ;	pop	ds
 37869                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37870                                  ;	pop	es
 37871                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37872                                  ;	retn	
 37873                                  	
 37874                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37875                                  SCANPLACE:
 37876 00006570 FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37877                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37878 00006572 E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37879 00006575 5F                      	pop	di
 37880 00006576 C3                      	retn
 37881                                  
 37882                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37883                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37884                                  ; Input:
 37885                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37886                                  ; Function:
 37887                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37888                                  ; NO registers altered
 37889                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37890                                  
 37891                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37892                                  
 37893                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37894                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37895                                  PLACEBUF:
 37896                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37897                                  
 37898                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37899 00006577 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37900 00006578 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37901                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37902                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37903                                  	
 37904 00006579 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37905                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37906 0000657B 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37907                                  	
 37908 00006580 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37909 00006582 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37910 00006584 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37911 00006586 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37912 00006588 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37913 0000658C EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37914                                  not_first:
 37915                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37916 0000658E 56                      	push	si
 37917                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37918 0000658F 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37919 00006592 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 37920                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 37921 00006594 96                      	xchg	si,ax
 37922                                  	;mov	[si+2],ax
 37923 00006595 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 37924                                  	
 37925 00006598 8B7702                  	mov	SI,[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;SI-> last buffer	;AN000;
 37926 0000659B 893C                    	mov	[si],di
 37927                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],DI	;Add Buf to end of list ;AN000;
 37928 0000659D 897F02                  	mov	[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],DI				;AN000;
 37929 000065A0 897502                  	mov	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],SI	;Update link in Buf too	;AN000;
 37930 000065A3 891D                    	mov	[di],bx
 37931                                  	;mov	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],BX				;AN000;
 37932                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37933 000065A5 5E                      	pop	si
 37934                                  nret:	
 37935                                  	; 23/09/2023							;AN000;
 37936                                  	;pop	SI							;AN000;
 37937 000065A6 5B                      	pop	BX							;AN000;
 37938 000065A7 58                      	pop	AX							;AN000;
 37939                                  									;AN000;
 37940                                  	;cmp	byte [di+4],0FFh
 37941 000065A8 807D04FF                	cmp	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],-1	; Buffer FREE?		;AN000;
 37942 000065AC 7505                            jne	short pbx			; M039: -no, jump.
 37943 000065AE 36893E[6D00]            	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],di		; M039: -yes, make it LRU.
 37944                                  pbx:	
 37945 000065B3 C3                      	retn								;AN000;

 38073                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38075                                  ;
 38076                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38077                                  ; Inputs:
 38078                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38079                                  ; Function:
 38080                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38081                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38082                                  ;	   same segment
 38083                                  ;
 38084                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38085                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38086                                  ; No Registers altered
 38087                                  ;
 38088                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38089                                  
 38090                                  POINTCOMP:
 38091                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38092                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38093 000065B4 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38094 000065B6 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38095                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38096 000065B8 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38097 000065B9 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38098 000065BA 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38099 000065BC 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38100 000065BE 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38101 000065C0 5A                      	POP	DX
 38102 000065C1 59                      	POP	CX
 38103                                  _ret_label:
 38104 000065C2 C3                      	retn

 38106                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38107                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38108                                  
 38109                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38110                                  
 38111                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38112                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38113                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38114                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38115                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38116                                  ; 
 38117                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38118                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38119                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38120                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38121                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38122                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38123                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38124                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38125                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38126                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38127                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38128                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38129                                  
 38130                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38131                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38132                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38133                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38134                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38135                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38136                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38137                                  ; 
 38138                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38139                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38140                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38141                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38142                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38143                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38144                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38145                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38146                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38147                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38148                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38149                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38151                                  
 38152                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 38826                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38827                                  ;
 38828                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38829                                  ;

 39032                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 39033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39034                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 39035                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 39036                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 39037                                  ;	code and time
 39038                                  ;

 39040                                  ;
 39041                                  ;	EXIT	[SC_SECTOR_SIZE]= drive sector size
 39042                                  ;		[SC_DRIVE]= drive #
 39043                                  ;
 39044                                  ;	USES	Flags
 39045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39046

 39048                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 39050                                  SET_RQ_SC_PARMS:
 39051                                  ;hkn; SS override for all variables used in this procedure.
 39052                                  	push	ax

 39055                                  	MOV	[ss:SC_SECTOR_SIZE],ax

 39062                                  	pop	ax

 39131                                  ;============================================================================
 39132                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39133                                  ;============================================================================
 39134                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39135                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39136                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39137                                  
 39138                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39139                                  
 39140                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39141                                  
 39142                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39143                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39144                                  
 39145                                  ; =========================================================================
 39146                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39147                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39148                                  ;
 39149                                  ;	$WAIT
 39150                                  ;	$EXEC
 39151                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39152                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39153                                  ;	$EXIT
 39154                                  ;	$ABORT
 39155                                  ;	abort_inner
 39156                                  ;
 39157                                  ;	Modification history:
 39158                                  ;
 39159                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39160                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39161                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39162                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39163                                  ;
 39164                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39165                                  ;
 39166                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39167                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39168                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39169                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39170                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39171                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39172                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39173                                  ;
 39174                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39175                                  ;
 39176                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39177                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39178                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39179                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39180                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39181                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39182                                  ;
 39183                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39184                                  ;
 39185                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39186                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39187                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39188                                  ;
 39189                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39190                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39191                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39192                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39193                                  ;
 39194                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39195                                  ;
 39196                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39197                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39198                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39199                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39200                                  ;
 39201                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39202                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39203                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39204                                  ;
 39205                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39206                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39207                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39208                                  ;
 39209                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39210                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39211                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39212                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39213                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39214                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39215                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39216                                  ;
 39217                                  ; =========================================================================
 39218                                  
 39219                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39220                                  
 39221                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39222                                  ; =========================================================================
 39223                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39224                                  ;
 39225                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39226                                  ;
 39227                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39228                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39229                                  ;
 39230                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39231                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39232                                  ;	USES	all
 39233                                  ; =========================================================================
 39234                                  
 39235                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39236                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39237                                  
 39238                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39239                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39240                                  
 39241                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39242                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39243                                  
 39244                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39245                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39246                                  
 39247                                  _$WAIT:
 39248                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39249                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39250                                  
 39251 00006883 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39252 00006885 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39253 0000688A E9DE9D                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 39255                                  ; =========================================================================
 39256                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39257                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39258                                  ;
 39259                                  ;
 39260                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39261                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39262                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39263                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39264                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39265                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39266                                  ;
 39267                                  ;	AL  Function
 39268                                  ;	--  --------
 39269                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39270                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39271                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39272                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39273                                  ;
 39274                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39275                                  ;
 39276                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39277                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39278                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39279                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39280                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39281                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39282                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39283                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39284                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39285                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39286                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39287                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39288                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39289                                  ;
 39290                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39291                                  ;
 39292                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39293                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39294                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39295                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39296                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39297                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39298                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39299                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39300                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39301                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39302                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39303                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39304                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39305                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39306                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39307                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39308                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39309                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39310                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39311                                  ;
 39312                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39313                                  ;
 39314                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39315                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39316                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39317                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39318                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39319                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39320                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39321                                  ;
 39322                                  ; Returns:
 39323                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39324                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39325                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39326                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39327                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39328                                  ; =========================================================================
 39329                                  ;
 39330                                  ;   Revision history:
 39331                                  ;
 39332                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39333                                  ;
 39334                                  ; =========================================================================
 39335                                  
 39336                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39337                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39338

 39416                                  	; ==================================================================
 39417                                  		      	
 39418                                  	; M068 - Start
 39419                                  	;
 39420                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39421                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39422                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39423                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39424                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39425                                  
 39426                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39427 0000688D 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39428                                  
 39429                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39430                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39431                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39432

 39434                                  	;jne	short @f
 39435 00006895 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39436                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39437 00006897 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39438 00006898 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39439 0000689B 51                      	push	cx
 39440                                  ;@@:

 39872                                  	; 09/09/2018
 39873                                  
 39874                                  	; M005 - START
 39875                                  	; If there is no STACK segment for this exe file and if this
 39876                                  	; not an overlay and the resident size is less than 64K - 
 39877                                  	; 256 bytes we shall add 256 bytes to the programs

 41024                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41025                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41026                                  ;
 41027                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41028                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41029                                  ;
 41030                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41031                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41032                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41033                                  ;
 41034                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41035                                  
 41036                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41037                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41038

 41040                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41041                                  
 41042                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41043                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41044                                  
 41045                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41046 00006E99 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41047                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41048 00006E9A 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41049 00006EA0 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41050 00006EA5 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41051 00006EA8 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41052                                  
 41053 00006EAA BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41054                                  
 41055                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41056 00006EAD 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41057 00006EAF 53                      	push	BX
 41058 00006EB0 06                      	push	ES
 41059 00006EB1 E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41060 00006EB4 1F                      	pop	DS
 41061 00006EB5 5B                      	pop	BX
 41062 00006EB6 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41063                                  
 41064 00006EB8 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41065 00006EBA 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41066                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41067 00006EBC A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41068

 41127                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41128                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41129                                  ; Inputs:
 41130                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41131                                  ; Function:
 41132                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41133                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41134                                  ; Returns:
 41135                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41136                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 41138                                  _$ABORT:
 41139 00006EF5 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41140                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0

 41142 00006EF7 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41143                                  
 41144                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41145                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41146                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41147                                  
 41148                                  abort_inner:

 41364                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 41381                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41382                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41383                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41384                                  ;		(di) = 0

 41407                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41408 00006F6F C3                      	RETN
 41409                                  
 41410                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41411                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41412                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41413                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41414                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41415                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41416                                  ;
 41417                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41418                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41419                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41420                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41421                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41422                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41423                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41425                                          
 41426                                  Coalesce:
 41427                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41428 00006F70 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41429                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41430                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41431 00006F73 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41432 00006F75 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41433                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41434 00006F78 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41435                                  
 41436                                  coalesce_check:
 41437                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di

 41439                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return

 41441                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41442 00006F81 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41443 00006F86 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)

 41446 00006F8B 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41447 00006F8E 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL

 41450                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41451                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41452                                  
 41453                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41454                                  
 41455                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41456                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41457                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41458                                  ;
 41459                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41460                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41461                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41462                                  ;
 41463                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41464                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41465                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41466                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41467                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41468                                  ;
 41469                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41470                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41471                                  ;
 41472                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41473                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41474                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41475                                  ;           INT     21h
 41476                                  ;
 41477                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41478                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41479                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41480                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41481                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41482                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41483                                  ;
 41484                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41485                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41486                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41487                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41488                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41489                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41490                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41491                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41492                                  ;	USES	All
 41493                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41494                                  
 41495                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41496                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41497                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41498                                  ;
 41499                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41500                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41501                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41502                                  ;           INT     21h
 41503                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41504                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41505                                  ;
 41506                                  ;   Description:
 41507                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41508                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41509                                  ;
 41510                                  ;   Error return:
 41511                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41512                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41514                                  
 41515                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41516                                  
 41517                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41518                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 41853                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41854                                  
 41855                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41856                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41857                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41858                                  ;
 41859                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41860                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41861                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41862                                  ;
 41863                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41864                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41865                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41866                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41867                                  ;
 41868                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41869                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41870                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41871                                  ;		code.
 41872                                  ;
 41873                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41874                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41875                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41876                                  ;
 41877                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41878                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41879                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41880                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41881                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41882                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41883                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41884                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41885                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41886                                  
 41887                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41889                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41890                                  ;
 41891                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41892                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41893                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41894                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41895                                  ;           INT     21h
 41896                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41897                                  ;         size possible
 41898                                  ;   Error return:
 41899                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41900                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41901                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41902                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41904                                  
 41905                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41906                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41907                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41908 000070E3 E89DA7                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41909                                  
 41910 000070E6 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 41911 000070E9 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 41912 000070EB 48                              DEC     AX
 41913 000070EC E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 41914 000070EF 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 41915                                  
 41916                                  setblock_bad:
 41917 000070F1 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 41918                                  
 41919                                  setblock_grab:
 41920 000070F4 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 41921 000070F6 E877FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 41922 000070F9 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad

 41927 00007104 E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 42000                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42001                                  
 42002                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42003                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42004                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42005                                  ;
 42006                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42007                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42008                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42009                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42010                                  ;           INT     21h
 42011                                  ;
 42012                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42013                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42014                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42015                                  ;
 42016                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42017                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42018                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42019                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42020                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42021                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42022                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42023                                  ;
 42024                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42025                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42026                                  ;
 42027                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42028                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42029                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42030                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42031                                  ;
 42032                                  ;
 42033                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42034                                  ;
 42035                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42036                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42037                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42038                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42039                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42040                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42041                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42042                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42043                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42044                                  ;
 42045                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42046                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42047                                  ;
 42048                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42049                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42050                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42051                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42052                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42054                                  
 42055                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42056                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42057                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42058                                  ;
 42059                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42060                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42061                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42062                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42063                                  ;           INT     21h
 42064                                  ;
 42065                                  ;   Error return:
 42066                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42067                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42068

 42232                                  	jc	short AllocArenaError	; M009: arena trashed
 42233                                  %else

 42235                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42236                                  	;;;

 42239 00007185 740E                    	jz	short unlinked	; Y: return

 42242                                  %endif

 42288                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42289                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42290                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42291                                  ;
 42292                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42293                                  ;
 42294                                  ;
 42295                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42296                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42297                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42298                                  ;		   else
 42299                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42300                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42301                                  ;
 42302                                  ;		   CY if error
 42303                                  ;
 42304                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42305                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42306                                  
 42307                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42308                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42309                                  
 42310                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42311                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42312                                  
 42313                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42314                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42315                                  
 42316                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42317                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42318                                  
 42319                                  GetLastArena:
 42320 000071AC 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42321                                  
 42322 000071AD 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42323 000071B1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42324 000071B3 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42325                                  
 42326 000071B5 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42327                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42328 000071B9 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42329                                  
 42330                                  GLA_next:
 42331 000071BB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42332 000071BD E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42333                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42334                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42335                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42336 000071C0 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42337                                  
 42338                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42339                                  %if 0
 42340                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42341                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42342                                  					;    umb_head
 42343                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42344                                  %else
 42345                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42346                                  	;;;
 42347 000071C2 E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42348 000071C5 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42349                                  	;;;
 42350                                  %endif
 42351 000071C7 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42352                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42353 000071CB EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42354                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42355 000071CD 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42356                                  GLA_@f:
 42357 000071CF 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42358                                  
 42359                                  GLA_done:
 42360                                  
 42361                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42362                                  %if 0
 42363                                  					; M061 - Start
 42364                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42365                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42366                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42367                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42368                                  %else
 42369                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42370                                  	;;;
 42371 000071D1 E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42372 000071D4 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42373                                  	;;;
 42374                                  %endif
 42375 000071D6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42376 000071D8 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42377                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42378 000071DB 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42379 000071DD 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42380 000071DF 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42381                                  					; M061 - End
 42382                                  GLA_ret:
 42383                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42384                                  	;clc
 42385                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42386                                  	;clc
 42387 000071E1 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42388 000071E2 C3                      	retn				; M061
 42389                                  
 42390                                  GLA_err:
 42391 000071E3 F9                      	stc				; M061
 42392                                  GLA_err2:
 42393 000071E4 58                      	pop	ax
 42394                                  
 42395                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42396                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42397                                  	;;;
 42398 000071E5 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42399 000071E6 E8E4A0                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42400 000071E9 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42401                                  	;;;
 42402                                  
 42403                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42404                                  	;retn

 42472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42473                                  ;
 42474                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42475                                  ;
 42476                                  ; Inputs:
 42477                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42478                                  ; Function:
 42479                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42480                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42481                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42482                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42483                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42484                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42485                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42486                                  ;			CX User Index
 42487                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42488                                  ;			BX = UID
 42489                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42490                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42491                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42492                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42493                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42494                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42495                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42496                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42497                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42498                                  ;
 42499                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42500                                  
 42501                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42502                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42503                                  
 42504                                  _$ServerCall:
 42505                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42553                                  servercall_error:

 42557 0000723F C3                      	retn
 42558                                  
 42559                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 42560                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 42561                                  
 42562                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42563                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 42564 00007240 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 42565 00007242 16                      	push	ss
 42566 00007243 1F                      	pop	ds
 42567 00007244 E83CA6                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 42568                                  CommitLoop:

 42572 0000724D 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 42573                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 42574                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)

 42585                                  					;      doesn't deadlock
