 42825                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42826                                  
 42827                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42828                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42829                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42830                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42831                                  ;
 42832                                  ;	NOTE:
 42833                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42834                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42835                                  ;
 42836                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42837                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42838                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42839                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42840                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42841                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42842                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42843                                  
 42844                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42845                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42846                                  
 42847                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42848                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42849                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42850 0000733A 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42851                                  	
 42852                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42853 0000733F 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42854                                  
 42855                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42856 00007344 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42857 00007349 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42858                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42859                                  	;mov	al,6
 42860 0000734B B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42861                                  ReturnCarry:
 42862 0000734D F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42863 0000734E C3                      	retn				; go back
 42864                                  pjfn10: 
 42865                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42866 0000734F 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42867 00007354 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42868                                  	;clc
 42869                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42870 00007356 C3                      	retn
 42871                                  
 42872                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42873                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42874                                  ;
 42875                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42876                                  ;
 42877                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42878                                  ;
 42879                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42880                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42881                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42882                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42883                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42884                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42885                                  ; NOTE:
 42886                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42887                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42888                                  ;
 42889                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42890                                  
 42891                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42892                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42893                                  
 42894                                  SFFromHandle:
 42895 00007357 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42896                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42897 0000735A 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42898 0000735C 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42899                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42900                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42901                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42902                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42903                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42904                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42905 00007360 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42906                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42907                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42908                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42909                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42910                                  GetSF:
 42911 00007362 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42912 00007363 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42913 00007366 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42914 00007368 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42915 0000736B 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42916 0000736C C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42917                                  
 42918                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42919                                  
 42920                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42921                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42922                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42923                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42924                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42925                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42926                                  ;
 42927                                  ;   NOTE:
 42928                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42929                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42930                                  ;
 42931                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42932                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42933                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42934                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42935                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42937                                  
 42938                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42939                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42940                                  
 42941                                  SFFromSFN:
 42942                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42943                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42944 0000736D 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42945                                  
 42946                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42947 00007372 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42948                                  sfsfn5:	
 42949                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42950 00007377 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42951 0000737B 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42952                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42953 0000737D 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42954 00007381 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42955                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42956 00007384 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42957 00007387 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 42958 00007389 F9                      	STC
 42959 0000738A C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 42960                                  sfsfn7:
 42961 0000738B 50                      	push	ax
 42962                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 42963                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 42964                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 42965                                  	
 42966                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42967 0000738C B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 42968                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42969                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 42970                                  	
 42971 0000738E F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 42972 00007390 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 42973 00007392 58                      	pop	ax
 42974                                  	;add	di,6
 42975 00007393 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 42976 00007396 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 42977                                  
 42978                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 42979                                  
 42980                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 42981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42982                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 42983                                  ;
 42984                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 42985                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42986                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 42987                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 42988                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42989                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 42990                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 42991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42992                                  
 42993                                  JFNFree:
 42994 00007397 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 42995                                  jfnf1:	
 42996 00007399 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 42997 0000739C 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 42998 0000739E 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 42999 000073A2 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43000 000073A4 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43001 000073A5 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43002                                  
 43003                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43004                                  jfnf5:	
 43005                                  	;mov	al,4
 43006 000073A7 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43007                                  jfnfx:	
 43008 000073A9 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43009                                  
 43010                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43011                                  
 43012                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43013                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43014                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43015                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43016                                  ;
 43017                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43018                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43019                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43020                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43021                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43022                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43023                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43024                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43025                                  ;
 43026                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43027                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43028                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43029                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43030                                  ;
 43031                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43032                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43033                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43034                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43035                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43036                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43037                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43038                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43039                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43040                                  
 43041                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43042                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43043                                  
 43044                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43045                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43046                                  
 43047                                  SFNFree:
 43048                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43049                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43050                                  	;
 43051                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43052 000073AA 50                      	push	ax
 43053 000073AB 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43054                                  sfnf5:	
 43055 000073AD 53                      	push	bx
 43056 000073AE E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43057 000073B1 5B                      	pop	bx
 43058 000073B2 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43059 000073B4 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43060                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43061 000073B8 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43062                                  	
 43063                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43064 000073BA 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43065                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43066 000073BE 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43067                                  sfnf7:	
 43068 000073C0 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43069 000073C1 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43070                                  
 43071                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43072                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43073                                  ;
 43074                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43075                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43076                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43077                                  
 43078                                  sfnf10:	
 43079 000073C3 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43080                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43081 000073C7 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43082 000073CB 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43083 000073CD 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43084                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43085 000073D1 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43086 000073D5 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43087                                  
 43088                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43089                                  ;
 43090                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43091                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43092                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43093                                  
 43094                                  sfnf20:
 43095                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43096                                  
 43097                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43098 000073D7 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43099                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43100                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43101                                  
 43102 000073DC 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43103                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43104 000073E0 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43105 000073E4 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43106                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43107 000073E8 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43108                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43109                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43110                                  	;pop	ax
 43111                                  	;;clc
 43112                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43113                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43114 000073EC 58                      	pop	ax
 43115                                  	;clc
 43116 000073ED C3                      	retn
 43117                                  
 43118                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43119                                  ;
 43120                                  ;	'C' set
 43121                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43122                                  
 43123                                  sfnf95: 
 43124 000073EE 58                      	pop	ax
 43125                                  
 43126                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43127                                  %if 0
 43128                                  	;mov	al,4
 43129                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43130                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43131                                  %else
 43132                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43133                                  	;;;
 43134 000073EF EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43135                                  	;;;
 43136                                  %endif

 43138                                  ;============================================================================
 43139                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 43140                                  ;============================================================================
 43141                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43142                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43143                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 43144                                  
 43145                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43146                                  
 43147                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43148                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43149                                  ;
 43150                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43151                                  ;
 43152                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43153                                  ;		path
 43154                                  ;
 43155                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43156                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43157                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43158                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43159                                  ;
 43160                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43161                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43162                                  ;	USES	all
 43163                                  ;
 43164                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43165                                  
 43166                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43167                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43168                                  
 43169                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43170                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43171                                  
 43172                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43173                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43174                                  
 43175                                  _$CLOSE:
 43176                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43177                                  
 43178 000073F1 E8F602                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43179 000073F4 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43180 000073F6 16                      	push	ss
 43181 000073F7 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43182 000073F8 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43183 000073FC 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43184                                  
 43185                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43186                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43187                                  ;
 43188                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43189                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.

 43662                                  ; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43663                                  Align_Buffer:
 43664                                  	MOV	BX,DX			; copy offset
 43665                                  	push	cx			; don't stomp on count
 43666                                  	MOV	CL,4			; bits to shift bytes->para
 43667                                  	SHR	BX,CL			; get number of paragraphs
 43668                                  	pop	cx			; get count back
 43669                                  	MOV	AX,DS			; get original segment
 43670                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; get new segment
 43671                                  	MOV	DS,AX			; in seg register
 43672                                  	AND	DX,0Fh			; normalize offset
 43673                                  	MOV	[ss:DMAADD],DX		; use user DX as offset	;smr;SS Override
 43674                                  	MOV	[ss:DMAADD+2],DS 	; use user DS as segment for DMA
 43675                                  						;smr;SS Override
 43676                                  	retn

 44278                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44280                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44281                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44282                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44283                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44284                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44285                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44286                                  ;
 44287                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44288                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44289                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44290                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44291                                  ;	USES	none
 44292                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44293                                  
 44294                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44295                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44296                                  CheckOwner:
 44297                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44298

 44300 000076ED 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44301                                  
 44302 000076EF 50                      	push	ax
 44303                                  
 44304                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44305

 44307                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 44343                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44344                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44345                                  
 44346                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44347                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44348                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44349                                  
 44350                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44351                                  ;
 44352                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44353                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44354                                  ;	InitCDS
 44355                                  ;	$UserOper
 44356                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44357                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44358                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44359                                  ;
 44360                                  ;   Revision history:
 44361                                  ;
 44362                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44363                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44364                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44365                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44366                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44367                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44368                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44369                                  ;
 44370                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44371                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44372                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44373                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44374                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44375                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44376                                  ;
 44377                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44378                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44379                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44380                                  ;
 44381                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44382                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44383                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44384                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44385                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44386                                  ;
 44387                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44388                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44389                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44390                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44391                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44392                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44393                                  ;
 44394                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44395                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44396                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44397                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44398                                  ;   number.
 44399                                  ;
 44400                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44401                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44402                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44403                                  ;   TransPath.
 44404                                  ;
 44405                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44406                                  
 44407                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44408                                  
 44409                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44410                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44411                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44412                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44413                                  ;					; current drive)
 44414                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44415                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44416                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44417                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44418                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44419                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44420                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44421                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44422                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 44424                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44425                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44426                                  ; Inputs:
 44427                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44428                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44429                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44430                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44431                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44432                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44433                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44434                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44435                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44436                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44437                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44438                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44439                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44440                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44441                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44442                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44443                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44444                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44445                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44446                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,

 44448                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44449                                  ; Returns:
 44450                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return

 44561                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS
 44562                                  ;		'C' set if no DPB associated with drive
 44563                                  ;	USES	AH,ES,DI, Flags
 44564                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44565                                  
 44566                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44567                                  ; DOSCODE:A9FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44568

 44570                                  ; DOSCODE:A99Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44571

 44574

 44624                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44625                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44626                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44627                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44628                                  ;
 44629                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44630                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44631                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44632                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44633                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44634                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44635                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44636                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44637                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 44638                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 44639                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 44640                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44641                                  
 44642                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 44936                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44937                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44938                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44939                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44940                                  ;
 44941                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44942                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44943                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44944                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44945                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44946                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44947                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44948                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44949                                  
 44950                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44951                                  TransFCB:
 44952                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44953                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44954                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44955                                  	;ENTER
 44956 00007880 55                      	push	bp
 44957 00007881 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 44958                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 44959 00007883 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 44960 00007886 16                      	push	ss
 44961 00007887 07                      	pop	es
 44962 00007888 06                      	push	es
 44963 00007889 57                      	push	di
 44964                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44965                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 44966 0000788A 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 44967 0000788D 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 44968 00007893 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44969 00007899 E84FA9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 44970                                  	; 06/12/2022
 44971 0000789C 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 44972 0000789E 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 44973 000078A1 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44974 000078A5 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 44975                                  GetDrive:
 44976 000078AB AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 44977 000078AC E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 44978 000078AF 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 44979 000078B1 E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 44980                                  
 44981                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 44982                                  
 44983                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 44984 000078B4 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 44985 000078B7 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 44986                                  FCBScan:
 44987 000078B8 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 44988                                  	
 44989                                  	; 09/08/2018
 44990                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 44991                                  	;es	xlat
 44992                                  
 44993                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 44994 000078B9 E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 44995                                  
 44996                                  	;test	al,8	
 44997 000078BC A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 44998 000078BE 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 44999                                  NextCh: 
 45000 000078C0 E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 45001 000078C2 5E                      	pop	si
 45002 000078C3 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45003 000078C5 E880AD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45004 000078C8 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45005 000078C9 07                      	pop	es
 45006 000078CA 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45007 000078CB 1F                      	pop	ds
 45008                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45009                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 45010 000078CC 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 45011 000078CF 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45012 000078D2 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 45013 000078D4 55                      	push	bp
 45014 000078D5 E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 45015 000078D8 5D                      	pop	bp
 45016 000078D9 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 45017                                  BadPack:
 45018 000078DB F9                      	STC
 45019                                  	;mov	al,3
 45020 000078DC B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 45021                                  FCBRet: 
 45022                                  	;LEAVE
 45023 000078DE 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 45024 000078E0 5D                      	pop	bp
 45025                                  TransPath_retn:
 45026 000078E1 C3                      	retn
 45027                                  
 45028                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45029                                  
 45030                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45032                                  ;
 45033                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45034                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45035                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45036                                  ;       exactly.
 45037                                  ;
 45038                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45039                                  ;       matches splice.
 45040                                  ;
 45041                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45042                                  ;
 45043                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45044                                  ;
 45045                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45046                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45047                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45048                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45049                                  ;
 45050                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45051                                  ;
 45052                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45053                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45054                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45055                                  ;
 45056                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45057                                  ;
 45058                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45059                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45060                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45061                                  ;           splice
 45062                                  ;           fatRead
 45063                                  ;           return
 45064                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45065                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45066                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45067                                  ;           return
 45068                                  ;       if device then
 45069                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45070                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45071                                  ;           return
 45072                                  ;       if file then
 45073                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45074                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45075                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45076                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45077                                  ;           splice
 45078                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45079                                  ;           if local then
 45080                                  ;               fatread
 45081                                  ;           return
 45082                                  ;
 45083                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45084                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45085                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45086                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45087                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45088                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45089                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45090                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45091                                  ;
 45092                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45093                                  
 45094                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45095                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45096                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45097                                  
 45098                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45099                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45100                                  
 45101                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45102                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45103                                  
 45104                                  TransPath:
 45105 000078E2 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45106 000078E4 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45107                                  TransPathSet:
 45108 000078E6 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45109                                  SetSplice:
 45110 000078E8 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45111 000078EC B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45112                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45113 000078EE 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45114 000078F2 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45115 000078F8 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45116 000078FD 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45117 00007904 16                      	push	ss
 45118 00007905 07                      	pop	es
 45119                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45120 00007906 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45121                                  ;
 45122                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45123                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45124                                  ;
 45125                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45126                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45127                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45128                                  	;;;
 45129 0000790A 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45130 00007910 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45131                                  	;;;
 45132                                  ;
 45133                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45134                                  ;
 45135 00007912 E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45136 00007915 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45137 00007918 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45138 0000791A E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45139 0000791D 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45140 00007920 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45141 00007923 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45142                                  ;
 45143                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45144                                  ;
 45145 00007925 16                      	push	ss
 45146 00007926 1F                      	pop	ds
 45147 00007927 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45148 0000792B F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45149 00007930 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45150 00007932 E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45151                                  NoServerSplice:
 45152 00007935 16                      	push	ss
 45153 00007936 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45154 00007937 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45155 0000793B E8459F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45156 0000793E E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45157 00007941 E86C9F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45158                                  NoPath:
 45159                                  	;mov	al,3
 45160 00007944 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45161 00007946 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45162                                  
 45163                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45164                                  ; the name if so.
 45165                                  
 45166                                  CheckUNC:
 45167 00007947 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45168                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45169 0000794E B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45170 00007951 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45171                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45172                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45173                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45174 00007953 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45175                                  
 45176                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45177                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45178                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45179                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45180                                  
 45181                                  NO_CHECK:
 45182 00007955 E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45183 00007958 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45184 00007959 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45185 0000795B E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45186 0000795E 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45187 00007960 E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45188 00007963 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45189 00007965 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45190 00007967 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45191                                  
 45192                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45193                                  ; local machine root path
 45194                                  
 45195 00007969 58                      	POP     AX
 45196 0000796A A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45197                                  UNCCpy:
 45198 0000796B AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45199 0000796C E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45200 0000796F 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45201 00007971 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45202 00007973 E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45203 00007976 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45204 00007978 AA                      	STOSB
 45205 00007979 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45206 0000797B E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45207                                  UNCDone:
 45208 0000797E 16                      	push	ss
 45209 0000797F 1F                      	pop	ds
 45210 00007980 C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45211                                  UNCTerm:
 45212 00007981 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45213 00007982 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45214                                  
 45215                                  CheckDevice:
 45216                                  
 45217                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45218                                  
 45219 00007984 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45220 00007985 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45221 00007988 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45222                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45223 0000798A B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45224 0000798C F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45225 0000798D C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45226                                  CheckPath:
 45227 0000798E 50                      	push	ax
 45228 0000798F 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45229                                  
 45230                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45231                                  %if 0
 45232                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45233                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45234                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45235                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45236                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45237                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45238                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45239                                  ;;;
 45240                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45241                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45242                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45243                                  ;;;
 45244                                  ;;;More info:
 45245                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45246                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45247                                  ;;;
 45248                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45249                                  start5Dhack:
 45250                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45251                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45252                                  
 45253                                  %endif
 45254                                  
 45255                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45256                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45257                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45258                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45259                                  %if 0
 45260                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45261                                  %else
 45262                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45263                                  
 45264                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45265                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45266 00007990 E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45267                                  %endif
 45268 00007993 5D                      	pop	bp
 45269 00007994 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45270 00007995 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45271                                  
 45272                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45273                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45274                                  ; call.
 45275                                  
 45276 00007997 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45277 0000799D E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45278 000079A0 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45279                                  
 45280                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45281                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45282                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45283                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45284                                  ; a device.
 45285                                  
 45286 000079A6 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45287 000079A9 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45288 000079AB AA                      	STOSB
 45289 000079AC E8DF9D                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45290                                  
 45291 000079AF F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45292 000079B0 16                      	push	ss
 45293 000079B1 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45294                                  DoFile_retn:
 45295 000079B2 C3                      	retn
 45296                                  
 45297                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45298                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45299                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45300                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45301                                  ;%if 1
 45302                                  
 45303                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45304                                  %if 0
 45305                                  
 45306                                  no5Dshere:
 45307                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45308                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45309                                  %endif
 45310                                  
 45311                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45312                                  
 45313                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45314                                  
 45315                                  DoFile:
 45316                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45317                                  
 45318 000079B3 E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45319                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45320 000079B6 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45321 000079B8 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45322                                  
 45323                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45324                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45325                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45326                                  
 45327                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45328 000079BA 1E                      	push	ds
 45329 000079BB 56                      	push	si
 45330 000079BC 06                      	push	es
 45331 000079BD 57                      	push	di
 45332 000079BE E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45333                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45334 000079C1 5F                      	pop	di
 45335 000079C2 07                      	pop	es
 45336 000079C3 5E                      	pop	si
 45337 000079C4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45338                                  	;mov	al,3
 45339 000079C5 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45340                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45341 000079C7 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45342                                  
 45343                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45344                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45345                                  
 45346 000079C9 1E                      	push	ds
 45347 000079CA 56                      	push	si
 45348 000079CB 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45349 000079D0 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45350                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45351 000079D2 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45352                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45353 000079D5 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45354                                  					;AN000;
 45355 000079D9 E8C19D                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45356 000079DC 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45357                                  
 45358                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45359                                  
 45360 000079DD B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45361 000079DF 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45362 000079E3 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45363 000079E5 AA                      	STOSB
 45364                                  
 45365                                  ; Now get original string.
 45366                                  
 45367                                  GetOrig:
 45368 000079E6 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45369 000079E7 5E                      	pop	si
 45370 000079E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 45371                                  
 45372                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45373                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45374                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45376 000079E9 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45377 000079EC 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45378 000079EE 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45379 000079F0 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45380                                  ;
 45381                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45382                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45383                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45384                                  ;
 45385 000079F2 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45386                                  SkipPath:
 45387 000079F4 AC                      	LODSB
 45388 000079F5 E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45389 000079F8 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45390 000079FA 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45391 000079FB 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45392 000079FD 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45393                                  
 45394                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45395                                  ; for yucks.
 45396                                  
 45397                                  PathAssure:
 45398 000079FF B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45399 00007A01 AA                      	STOSB
 45400                                  
 45401                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45402                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45403                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45404                                  
 45405                                  DoCanon:
 45406 00007A02 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45407                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45408 00007A05 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45409                                  
 45410                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45411                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45412                                  ; buffer.
 45413                                  
 45414 00007A07 16                      	push	ss
 45415 00007A08 1F                      	pop	ds
 45416 00007A09 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45417 00007A0D C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45418 00007A11 E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45419 00007A14 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45420                                  
 45421                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45422                                  
 45423 00007A16 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45424 00007A19 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45425 00007A1C 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45426                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45427 00007A1E 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45428 00007A22 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45429 00007A24 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45430 00007A25 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45431                                  
 45432                                  ; Splice the result.
 45433                                  
 45434                                  DoSplice:
 45435 00007A2A 16                      	push	ss
 45436 00007A2B 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45437 00007A2C 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45438 00007A30 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45439 00007A32 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45440 00007A37 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45441 00007A39 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45442                                  SkipSplice:
 45443                                  
 45444                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45445                                  ; device.
 45446                                  
 45447 00007A3C 16                      	push	ss
 45448 00007A3D 1F                      	pop	ds
 45449 00007A3E C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45450                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45451                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45452                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 45453 00007A42 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 45454                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 45455 00007A47 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 45456 00007A49 E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 45457 00007A4B E8359E                  	call	ECritDisk
 45458 00007A4E E8AFE7                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45459 00007A51 E85C9E                  	call	LCritDisk
 45460                                  	;mov	al, 3
 45461 00007A54 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45462                                  Done:   
 45463 00007A56 C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 45464                                  
 45465                                  ; 13/07/2018
 45466                                  
 45467                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45468                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45469                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45470                                  ;
 45471                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45472                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45473                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45474                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45475                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45476                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45477                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45478                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45479                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45480                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45481                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45482                                  
 45483                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
