 45487                                  Canonicalize:
 45488                                  
 45489                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45490                                  
 45491 00007A57 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45492 00007A58 E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45493 00007A5B 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 45494 00007A5D 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45495 00007A5F 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45496 00007A61 AA                      	STOSB
 45497 00007A62 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 45498                                  CanonDec:
 45499 00007A64 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45500                                  
 45501                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45502                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45503                                  ; buffer.
 45504                                  
 45505                                  CanonLoop:
 45506                                  
 45507                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45508                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45509                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45510

 45512 00007A67 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 45513 00007A69 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 45514 00007A6B 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 45515 00007A70 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 45516 00007A72 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 45517 00007A74 AA                      	STOSB
 45518 00007A75 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 45519                                  DoTerminate:

 45522 00007A79 C3                      	retn
 45523

 45536                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 45537                                  ; it to 8.3

 45541 00007A88 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 45542                                  
 45543                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 45544

 45561

 45592                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45593                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 45594                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 45595                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 45596                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL

 45613                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45614                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 45616                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)
 45617                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI backed up to point to a path char

 45619                                  ;               Carry set if illegal backup

 45644                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45645                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI

 45761                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45762                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45763                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45764                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45765                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45766                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45767                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45768                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45769                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45770                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45771                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45772                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45773                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45774                                  ;                   left alone
 45775                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45776                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45778                                  
 45779                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 45858                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45859                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45860                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45861                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45862                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45863                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45864                                  ;
 45865                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45866                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45867                                  ;   Outputs:
 45868                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45869                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45870                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45871                                  ;       Carry Set
 45872                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45873                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45875                                  
 45876                                  _$NameTrans:
 45877 00007BE8 1E                      	push	ds
 45878 00007BE9 56                      	push	si
 45879 00007BEA 06                      	push	es
 45880 00007BEB 57                      	push	di
 45881 00007BEC 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45882                                  	
 45883                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45884                                  ; M027 - Start
 45885                                  ;
 45886                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45887                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45888                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45889                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45890                                  ; and restore CX.
 45891                                  
 45892                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45893 00007BED B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45894 00007BEF E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45895                                  
 45896                                  ; M027 - End
 45897                                  
 45898                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45899 00007BF2 BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45900 00007BF5 E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45901 00007BF8 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45902 00007BF9 5F                      	pop     di
 45903 00007BFA 07                      	pop	es
 45904 00007BFB 5E                      	pop     si
 45905 00007BFC 1F                      	pop     ds
 45906 00007BFD 7303                    	JNC	short TransOK
 45907 00007BFF E9738A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 45908                                  TransOK:
 45909 00007C02 BE[BE03]                	MOV     SI,OPENBUF
 45910 00007C05 16                      	push	ss
 45911 00007C06 1F                      	pop	ds
 45912                                  ;GotText:
 45913 00007C07 E8939B                  	call	FStrCpy
 45914 00007C0A E95E8A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 45916                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 45917                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45918                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45919                                  ;   pointer.
 45920                                  ;
 45921                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string
 45922                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number
 45923                                  ;               DS:SI advanced
 45924                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,SI.

 45945                                  ;Break   <TextFromDrive - convert a drive number to a text string>
 45946                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45947                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 45948                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45949                                  ;
 45950                                  ;   Inputs:     AL has 0-based drive number
 45951                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI advanced
 45952                                  ;   Registers modified: AX
 45953                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45957                                  TextFromDrive1:

 45961 00007C29 AB                      	STOSW

 45965                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 45966                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45967                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 45968                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 45969                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 45970                                  ;
 45971                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 45972                                  ;               ES:DI string
 45973                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 45974                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 45975                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 45976                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 45977                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45978                                  
 45979                                  PathPref:
 45980 00007C2B E8869B                  	call	DStrLen                 ; get length
 45981 00007C2E 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 45982 00007C2F F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 45983 00007C31 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 45984 00007C33 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 45985 00007C34 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 45986 00007C37 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 45987 00007C3A 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 45988                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 45989 00007C3C 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 45990 00007C3F E87AFE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 45991                                  Prefix:
 45992 00007C42 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 45993 00007C43 C3                      	retn
 45994                                  
 45995                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 45996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45997                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for
 45998                                  ;     a path separator.
 45999                                  ;
 46000                                  ;     Input:    DS:SI target string (null terminated)
 46001                                  ;     Output:   Zero set => path separator encountered in string
 46002                                  ;               Zero clear => null encountered

 46029                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>

 46031                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46032                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46033                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46034                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46035                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46036                                  ;
 46037                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46038                                  ;       ------          --------
 46039                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46040                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46041                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46042                                  ;
 46043                                  ;   Error returns:
 46044                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46045                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46046                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46047                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files

 46055                                  ;
 46056                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46057                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46058                                  ;
 46059                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46060                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46061                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK

 46063                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46064                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46065                                  ;	USES	all
 46066                                  ;
 46067                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46068

 46350                                  ;	    MOV     AL,func (0=get, 1=set)

 46352                                  ;   Error returns:
 46353                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found

 46358                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46359                                  
 46360                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46361                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch
 46362                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AFF4h)
 46363                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 46364                                  
 46365                                  _$CHMOD:
 46366                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46367                                  	;;;
 46368 00007D32 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh		; MS-DOS 7.20 (Win98) - EXTENDED-LENGTH FILENAME OPERATIONS
 46369                                  				; AX = 43FFh
 46370                                  				; BP = 5053h ('PS')
 46371                                  				; CL = function
 46372                                  				; 39h "mkdir" create directory
 46373                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ pathname
 46374                                  				; 56h rename file
 46375                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ filename of existing file (no wildcards)
 46376                                  				; ES:DI -> ASCIZ new filename (no wildcards)
 46377                                  				;
 46378                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
 46379 00007D34 7520                    	jnz	short std_chmod
 46380 00007D36 81FD5350                	cmp	bp,5053h
 46381 00007D3A 7515                    	jnz	short chmod_x_2
 46382 00007D3C 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 46383                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128
 46384 00007D3E 36C606[1011]80          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 46385 00007D44 80F939                  	cmp	cl,39h
 46386 00007D47 7503                    	jne	short chmod_x_1
 46387 00007D49 E977AA                  	jmp	mkdir_x
 46388                                  chmod_x_1:
 46389 00007D4C 80F956                  	cmp	cl,56h
 46390 00007D4F 7472                    	je	short rename_x
 46391                                  chmod_x_2:
 46392 00007D51 B001                    	mov	al,1
 46393                                  	;jmp	short NORERR
 46394                                  	; 15/03/2024
 46395                                  NORERR: 
 46396 00007D53 E91F89                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 46397                                  
 46398                                  std_chmod:
 46399                                  	;;;

 46485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46486                                  ;
 46487                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46488                                  ;
 46489                                  ;
 46490                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46491                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46492                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 46493                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 46494                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46495                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46496                                  ;
 46497                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46498                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46499                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46500                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46501                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46502                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46503                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46504                                  ;
 46505                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46506                                  
 46507                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46508                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 46509

 46512 00007D98 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 46513 00007D9A BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46514 00007D9D E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 46515 00007DA0 59                      	pop	cx
 46516 00007DA1 7216                    	JC	short ChModErr		; badly formed path
 46517 00007DA3 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 46518 00007DA9 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 46519 00007DAB 16                      	push	ss
 46520 00007DAC 1F                      	pop	ds
 46521                                  	;mov	ch,6
 46522 00007DAD B506                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system ; unlink appropriate files
 46523 00007DAF E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib

 46525                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46526                                  	; 17/12/2022

 46672                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46674                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46675                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46676                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46677                                  ;
 46678                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46679                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46680                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46681                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46682                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46683                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46684                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46686                                  
 46687                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46688 00007E31 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 46689 00007E32 B9[C030]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 46690 00007E35 E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46691                                  
 46692                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46693                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46694                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46695                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46696                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46697                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46698                                  ;
 46699                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46700                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46701                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46702                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46704                                  
 46705                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46706                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46707                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46708                                  ;bta5:
 46709                                  ;	push    cx
 46710                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46711                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46712                                  ;	push    ax
 46713                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46714                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46715                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46716                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46717                                  ;	add     al,7
 46718                                  ;bta6: 
 46719                                  ;	stosb
 46720                                  ;	pop     ax
 46721                                  ;	pop     cx
 46722                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46723                                  ;	retn
 46724                                  
 46725                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46726                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46727                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46728                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46729                                  %if 0
 46730                                  
 46731                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46732                                  BinToAscii:
 46733                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46734                                  bta5:	
 46735                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46736                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46737                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46738                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46739                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46740                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46741                                  	dec	ch
 46742                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46743                                  	retn
 46744                                  %else
 46745                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46746                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46747                                  
 46748                                  BinToAscii:
 46749 00007E38 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46750 00007E39 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46751                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46752 00007E3B D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46753 00007E3D 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46754 00007E40 AB                      	stosw
 46755 00007E41 58                      	pop	ax
 46756                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46757 00007E42 D410                    	aam	10h
 46758 00007E44 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46759 00007E47 AB                      	stosw
 46760 00007E48 C3                      	retn	
 46761                                  %endif

 46763                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46764                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46765                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46766                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46767                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46768                                  ;
 46769                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46770                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46771                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46772                                  ;		AX has handle
 46773                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46774                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46775                                  
 46776                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46777                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46778                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46779                                  
 46780                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46781                                  	;Enter
 46782 00007E49 55                      	push	bp
 46783 00007E4A 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46784                                  
 46785                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46786                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46787                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46788                                  
 46789 00007E4C 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46790                                  
 46791                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46792 00007E4F F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46793 00007E53 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46794                                  
 46795                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46796                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46797                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46798                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46799                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46800                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46801                                  
 46802                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46803 00007E55 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46804 00007E58 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46805                                  
 46806                                  OKatts:
 46807                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46808 00007E5A 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46809                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46810 00007E5D 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46811                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46812 00007E60 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46813                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46814 00007E63 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46815 00007E66 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46816 00007E67 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46817 00007E68 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46818 00007E6A 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46819 00007E6C F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46820                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46821 00007E6E 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46822 00007E70 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46823                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46824                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46825                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46826 00007E72 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46827                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46828                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46829 00007E73 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46830 00007E75 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46831                                  					;AN000;
 46832 00007E77 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 46833 00007E78 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 46834 00007E7C E810DC                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 46835 00007E7F 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 46836                                  STOREPTH:
 46837 00007E81 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 46838 00007E83 AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 46839                                  SETENDPTR:
 46840                                  	; 10/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 46841                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 46842                                  	; 09/07/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix - Erdogan Tan - Istanbul)
 46843                                  	; (Note: I find this Retro DOS v4 Kernel bug while searching the reason
 46844                                  	;  of the AutoCAD R12 running/startup problem. Now it is solved here.)
 46845                                  	;mov	[bp-4],dl ; (Retro DOS v4 !Bug!)
 46846 00007E84 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-4],di ; !Fix!
 46847                                  CreateLoop:
 46848 00007E87 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 46849 00007E88 1F                      	pop	ds
 46850 00007E89 55                      	push	bp
 46851 00007E8A E8DA8C                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46852 00007E8D 5D                      	pop	bp
 46853                                  ;
 46854                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46855                                  ;
 46856                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46857 00007E8E C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 46858 00007E91 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 46859 00007E93 E8A2FF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store upper word
 46860 00007E96 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx

 46862 00007E9B 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 46863 00007E9D AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 46864                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name

 46866                                  	;MOV	CX,Attr 		; get attr
 46867 00007EA1 8B4EF6                  	mov	cx,[bp-10]
 46868 00007EA4 55                      	push	bp
 46869 00007EA5 E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 46870 00007EA8 5D                      	pop	bp
 46871 00007EA9 732A                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 46872                                  
 46873                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46874                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46875                                  
 46876                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46877                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46878                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46879                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46880                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46881                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)

 46883                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 46889 00007EB1 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46890                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46891                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46892                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46893                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46894                                  					;    so.
 46895                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46896                                  %if 0
 46897                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46898                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46899                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46900                                  ;M070
 46901                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46902                                  ;

 46904                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46905                                  
 46906                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46907                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46908                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46909                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46910                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46911                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46912                                  %else

 46980                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 46981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46982                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 46983                                  ;	 BX= mode
 46984                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 46985                                  ;	 DX= flag
 46986                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 46987                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 46988                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 46989                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 46990                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 46991                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 46992                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 46993                                  ; Output: carry clear
 46994                                  ;		     AX= handle
 46995                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 46996                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 46997                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 46998                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 46999                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47000                                  
 47001                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47002                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47003

 47218                                  ; LOCK.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 47219                                  ;============================================================================
 47220                                  ; 14/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 47221                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47222                                  
 47223                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47224                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47225                                  ;
 47226                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47227                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47228                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47229                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47230                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47231                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47232                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47233                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47234                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47235                                  ;
 47236                                  ;   Error returns:
 47237                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47238                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47239                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47240                                  ;
 47241                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47242                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47243                                  ;
 47244                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47245                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47246                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47247                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47248                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read

 47730                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47731                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47732                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47733                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47734                                  ;
 47735                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47736                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47737                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47738                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47739                                  
 47740                                  ShareEnd:
 47741                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47742 00008108 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47743 0000810C C3                      	retn
 47744                                  
 47745                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47746                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47747                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47748                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47749                                  ;
 47750                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47751                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47752                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47753                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47754                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47755                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47756                                  
 47757                                  ShareEnter:
 47758 0000810D 51                      	push	cx
 47759                                  retry:
 47760 0000810E 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47761                                  attempt:
 47762 00008112 C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47763 00008116 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47764                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47765 00008118 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47766 0000811C 51                      	push	cx
 47767 0000811D E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47768 00008120 59                      	pop	cx
 47769 00008121 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47770 00008123 E89B96                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47771 00008126 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47772 00008128 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47773 0000812B 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47774                                  done:
 47775 0000812D 59                      	pop	cx
 47776 0000812E C3                      	retn
 47777                                  
 47778                                  ;============================================================================
 47779                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47780                                  ;============================================================================
 47781                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47782                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47783                                  
 47784                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47785                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47786                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47787                                  ;
 47788                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47789                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47790                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47791                                  ;
 47792                                  ;	Revision history:
 47793                                  ;
 47794                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47795                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47796                                  
 47797                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47798                                  ;
 47799                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47800                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47801                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47802                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47803                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47804                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47805                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47806                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47807                                  ;
 47808                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47809                                  
 47810                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47811                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47812                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47813                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47814                                  
 47815                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47816                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47817                                  
 47818                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47819                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47820                                  
 47821                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47822                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47823                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47824                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47825                                  
 47826                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47827                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47828                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47829                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47830                                  
 47831                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47832                                  ;
 47833                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47834                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47835                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47836                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47837                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47838                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47839                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47840                                  ; .size:
 47841                                  ;endstruc
 47842                                  
 47843                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47844                                  
 47845                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47846                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47847                                  
 47848                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47849                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47850                                  
 47851                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47852                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47853                                  
 47854                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47855                                  
 47856                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47857                                  ;
 47858                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47859                                  ;
 47860                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47861                                  ;
 47862                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47863                                  
 47864                                  ExecReady:
 47865 0000812F 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47866                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47867                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47868 00008131 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47869                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47870 00008135 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47871                                  
 47872                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47873 00008137 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47874 0000813A 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47875 0000813D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47876                                  
 47877                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47878 0000813F 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47879                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47880 00008142 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47881                                  
 47882                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47883 00008145 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47884                                  	
 47885                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47886                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47887 0000814A 36FF16[3E13]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47888                                  
 47889                                  er_setver:
 47890                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47891                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47892 0000814F F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47893                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47894 00008153 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47895                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47896 00008155 1E                      	push	ds
 47897 00008156 56                      	push	si
 47898                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47899 00008157 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47900 0000815A E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47901 0000815D E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47902 00008160 5E                      	pop	si
 47903 00008161 1F                      	pop	ds
 47904                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47905 00008162 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47906 00008165 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47907                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47908 00008169 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47909                                  
 47910                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47911 0000816D 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47912 00008173 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47913                                  
 47914                                  					; M068 - Start
 47915                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47916 00008175 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47917                                  
 47918                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47919 00008178 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47920                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47921                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47922                                  					; explanation
 47923                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47924                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47925 0000817E F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47926                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47927 00008182 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47928                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47929                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47930                                  	;push	ds
 47931                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47932                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47933                                  	;pop	ds
 47934                                  
 47935                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47936 00008184 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47937                                  
 47938                                  er_setA20:
 47939                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47940                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47941                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47942                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47943                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47944                                  
 47945 0000818A 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47946 0000818F 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47947                                  					; turned OFF.
 47948                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47949 00008193 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47950 00008195 C3                      	retn
 47951

 47983                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 47987                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 47990                                  
 47991                                  ParaRound:
 47992 00008199 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 47993 0000819C D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 47994 0000819E D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1

 48006                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48007                                  ;
 48008                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48009                                  ;
 48010                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48011                                  ;
 48012                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48013                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48014                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48015                                  ;
 48016                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48017                                  ;
 48018                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48019                                  
 48020                                  WhatCPUType:
 48021                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48022                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48023                                  
 48024                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48025                                  
 48026                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48027                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48028                                  ;
 48029                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48030                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48031                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48032                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48033                                  
 48034                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48035                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48036                                  
 48037                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48038                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48039                                  
 48040                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48041 000081A5 9C                      	pushf
 48042 000081A6 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48043 000081A7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48044                                  
 48045 000081A9 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48046 000081AB 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48047 000081AC 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48048 000081AD 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48049 000081AE 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48050 000081AF 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48051 000081B2 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48052 000081B5 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48053                                  
 48054 000081B7 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48055 000081BA 50                      	push	ax
 48056 000081BB 9D                      	popf
 48057 000081BC 9C                      	pushf
 48058 000081BD 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48059 000081BE 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48060 000081C1 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48061                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48062 000081C3 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48063                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48064 000081C4 43                      	inc	bx
 48065                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48066 000081C5 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48067 000081C7 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48068 000081C8 9D                      	popf
 48069                                  	
 48070                                  	;endm
 48071                                  
 48072                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48073 000081C9 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48074                                  
 48075                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48076                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 48084

 48090                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48091

 48094                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48095                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48096                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48097                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48098                                  DOSINIT:
 48099                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48100                                  	;
 48101                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48102                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48103                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48104                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48105                                  	;
 48106                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48107                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48108                                  
 48109 000081CA FA                              CLI
 48110 000081CB FC                              CLD
 48111                                  
 48112                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48113                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48114

 48116                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48117                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48118                                  	
 48119 000081CC 56                      	push	si

 48122                                  
 48123 000081CF 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48124                                  
 48125                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48126                                  
 48127                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48128                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48129                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48130                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48131 000081D1 B8[4186]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48132                                  
 48133                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48134 000081D4 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48135                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48136                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48137 000081D7 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48138                                  
 48139 000081D9 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48140                                  					; code segment
 48141                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48142                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48143                                  	;xor	si,si
 48144                                  	
 48145                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48146                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48147                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48148                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48149 000081DB 0E                      	push	cs
 48150 000081DC 1F                      	pop	ds
 48151                                  
 48152                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48153                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48154                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48155                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48156                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48157 000081DD 8E06[9781]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48158                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48159                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48160                                  
 48161                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48162 000081E1 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48163                                  
 48164 000081E6 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48165                                  
 48166                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48167                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48168                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48169                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48170                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48171                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 48172                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata
 48173 000081E8 B94013                  	mov	cx,DOSDATASIZE	; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 48174                                  				; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 01/07/2024
 48175 000081EB F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; move data to final location
 48176                                  	
 48177 000081ED 5F                      	pop	di			; restore ptr to BiosComBlock
 48178 000081EE 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore parms from BIOS
 48179 000081EF 5E                      	pop	si
 48180                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48181                                  	;pop	dx ; 30/05/2019	
 48182                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48183                                  	;pop	dx ; =*=
 48184                                  
 48185 000081F0 06                      	push	es
 48186 000081F1 1E                      	push	ds
 48187 000081F2 07                      	pop	es			; es:si -> device chain
 48188 000081F3 1F                      	pop	ds			; ds points to dosdata
 48189                                  
 48190                                  ;SR;
 48191                                  ;We get a ptr to the BIOS exchange data block. This has been setup right 
 48192                                  ;now so that the EXEC call knows when SysInit is present to do the special
 48193                                  ;lie table handling for device drivers. This can be expanded later on to
 48194                                  ;establish a communication block from the BIOS to the DOS.
 48195                                  
 48196                                  	;mov	[1040h],di	; Offset 0BA87h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48197                                  	;mov	[1042h],bx
 48198 000081F4 893E[2313]              	mov	[BiosDataPtr],di
 48199 000081F8 891E[2513]              	mov	[BiosDataPtr+2],bx	; save ptr to BiosComBlock
 48200                                  
 48201 000081FC 2E8C1E[0700]            	mov	[cs:DosDSeg],ds		; set pointer to dosdata in code seg
 48202                                  
 48203                                  	; Set the segment of Lowint23/24/28Addr in msctrlc.asm to dosdata

 49020                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49021                                  ;
 49022                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49023                                  ;
 49024                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49025                                  ;
 49026                                  ;	USED:	none
 49027                                  ;
 49028                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49029                                  
 49030                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49031                                  ;
 49032                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49033                                  ;
 49034 000084C8 50                      	push	ax
 49035                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49036 000084C9 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49037 000084CC CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49038                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49039                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49040                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49041 000084CE 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49042 000084D0 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49043                                  ;
 49044                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49045                                  ; need to call it later.
 49046                                  ;
 49047 000084D2 53                      	push	bx
 49048 000084D3 52                      	push	dx
 49049 000084D4 1E                      	push	ds
 49050 000084D5 06                      	push	es
 49051                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49052 000084D6 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49053 000084D9 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49054                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49055                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49056                                  
 49057 000084DB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49058                                  
 49059 000084E0 891E[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49060 000084E4 8C06[5110]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49061                                  cXMMexit:
 49062 000084E8 F8                      	clc
 49063 000084E9 07                      	pop	es
 49064 000084EA 1F                      	pop	ds
 49065 000084EB 5A                      	pop	dx
 49066 000084EC 5B                      	pop	bx
 49067 000084ED 58                      	pop	ax
 49068 000084EE C3                      	retn				; done
 49069                                  ;
 49070                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49071                                  ;
 49072                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49073 000084EF F9                      	stc
 49074 000084F0 58                      	pop	ax
 49075 000084F1 C3                      	retn

 49077                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49078                                  ;
 49079                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49080                                  ;
 49081                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49082                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49083                                  ;
 49084                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49085                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49086                                  ;		      if first entry
 49087                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49088                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49089                                  ;		      else
 49090                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49091                                  ;
 49092                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49093                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49094                                  ;
 49095                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49096                                  ;
 49097                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 49098                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49099                                  
 49100 000084F2 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49101                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49102                                  
 49103                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49104                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49105                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49106                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49107                                  
 49108                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 49109                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh
 49110                                  
 49111                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 49112 000084F3 1E                      	push	ds
 49113                                  
 49114 000084F4 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49115                                  
 49116 000084F9 E87A00                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 49117                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 49118                                  	
 49119                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49120                                  	; cx = 0
 49121 000084FC 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 49122                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 49123 000084FE 7531                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 49124                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49125                                  	;or	ax, ax
 49126                                  	;jnz	short patch_vec_seg
 49127                                  
 49128                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49129                                  	;cmp	[cs:num_entry],al ; 0
 49130                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49131 00008500 2E380E[F284]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 49132                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this
