 49577                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49578                                  ;
 49579                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49580                                  ;
 49581                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49582                                  ;
 49583                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49584                                  ;
 49585                                  ;	Description:
 49586                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49587                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49588                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49589                                  ;
 49590                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49591                                  
 49592                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49593                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 49594                                  
 49595                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49596                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 49597                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 49598                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 49599                                  
 49600                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 49601                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 49602                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 49603                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 49604                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 49605                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 49606                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 49607                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 49608                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 49609 0000861B [720F]                  	dw	i0patch
 49610 0000861D [7C0F]                  	dw	i20patch
 49611 0000861F [860F]                  	dw	i21patch
 49612 00008621 [900F]                  	dw	i25patch
 49613 00008623 [9A0F]                  	dw	i26patch
 49614 00008625 [A40F]                  	dw	i27patch
 49615 00008627 [AE0F]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 49616 00008629 [B80F]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 49617                                  
 49618                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 49619                                  
 49620                                  patch_in_nops:
 49621 0000862B 50                      	push	ax
 49622 0000862C 56                      	push	si
 49623 0000862D BE[1B86]                	mov	si,patch_table
 49624 00008630 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 49625                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49626                                  	; cx = 0

 49847                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49848                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49849                                  ;;
 49850                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49851                                  ;;
 49852                                  ;;	on return:
 49853                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49854                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49855                                  ;;
 49856                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49857                                  ;;
 49858                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49859                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49860                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49861                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49862                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49863                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49864                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49865                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49866                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49867                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49868                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49869                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49870                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49871                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49872                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49873                                  ;;
 49874                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 50082                                  ;============================================================================
 50083                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50084                                  ;============================================================================
 50085                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50086                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50087                                  
 50088                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50090                                  
 50091                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50092                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50093                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50094                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50095                                  ;
 50096                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50097                                  ; describing that data item.
 50098                                  
 50099                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50100                                  
 50101                                  ;
 50102                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50103                                  ;
 50104                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50105                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50106                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50107                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50108                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50109                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50110                                  ;
 50111                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50112                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50113                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50114                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50115                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50116                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50117                                  ;   as EOF).
 50118

 50359                                  ;============================================================================
 50360                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50361                                  ;============================================================================
 50362                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50363                                  
 50364                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50365                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50366                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50367                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50368                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50369                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50370                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50371                                  ; **********************************************************
 50372                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50373                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50374                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50375                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50376                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50377                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50378                                  
 50379                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50380                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50381                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50382                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50383                                  
 50384                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50385                                  
 50386                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50387                                  
 50388                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50389                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50390 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50391 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50392                                  
 50393                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50394                                  
 50395                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50396                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50397 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50398                                  RENBUF:	
 50399 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50400                                  
 50401                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50402                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50403 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50404                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50405 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50406                                  
 50407                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 50408                                   
 50409                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 50410                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 50411                                  
 50412                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 50413                                  
 50414                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 50415                                  
 50416                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50417                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50418                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50419                                  
 50420                                  NAME1:	
 50421 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50422                                  NAME2:
 50423 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 50424                                  DESTSTART:
 50425 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 50426                                          ;DB	((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 50427                                  	;times	5  db	0
 50428 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 50429                                  
 50430                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50431

 50433                                  EXTFCB:	
 50434 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 50435                                  SATTRIB:
 50436 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes

 50575                                  ; DOSDATA:0607h
 50576                                  
 50577                                  ; HIGH_SECTOR is a hack to allow passing 32-bit sector numbers where
 50578                                  ; we used to just pass 16 bits in a register. Now High_SECTOR holds
 50579                                  ; the high 16, the low 16 are still in the register.

 50974                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h

 50976                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 50977                                  
 50978                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50979                                  ;
 50980                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 50981                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 50982                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 50983                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 50984                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 50985                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50986                                  ; Example:
 50987                                  
 50988                                  MAP_CASE:
 50989                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 50990                                  
 50991 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 50992                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 50993                                  	;RETF
 50994                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50995                                  	;;;
 50996 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 50997                                  	;;;
 50998                                  Map1:
 50999 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51000 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51001 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51002 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51003                                  FINISH:
 51004 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51005 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51006 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51007 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51008 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51009                                  L_RET:	
 51010 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51011                                  
 51012                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE

 51363                                  
 51364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51365                                  ;
 51366                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51367                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51368                                  ;
 51369                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51370                                  ;
 51371                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51372                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51373                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51374                                  ;
 51375                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51376                                  
 51377                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51378                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51379                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51380                                  ;ELSE
 51381                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51382                                  ;ENDIF
 51383                                  ;ENDM

 51801                                  
 51802                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51803                                  ;
 51804                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51805                                  ;
 51806                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51807                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51808                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51809                                  ;
 51810                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51811                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51812                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51813                                  ;	   4. else 
 51814                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51815                                  ;	   6. endif
 51816                                  ;	7. else
 51817                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51818                                  ;	9. endif
 51819                                  ;
 51820                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51821                                  
 51822                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51823                                  
 51824                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51825                                  
 51826                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51827                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51828                                  
 51829                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51830                                  ;
 51831                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51832                                  ;
 51833                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51834                                  
 51835                                  ldivov:
 51836                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51837                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51838                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51839                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51840                                  i0patch:
 51841 00000F72 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51842                                  
 51843 00000F74 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51844                                  divov_cont:
 51845 00000F77 2EFF2E[4E0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51846                                  
 51847                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51848                                  ;
 51849                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51850                                  ;
 51851                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51852                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51853                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51854                                  ; will be restored then.
 51855                                  ;
 51856                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51857                                  
 51858                                  lquit:
 51859                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51860                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51861                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51862                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51863                                  i20patch:
 51864 00000F7C EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51865                                  
 51866 00000F7E E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51867                                  quit_cont:
 51868 00000F81 2EFF2E[520F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51869                                  
 51870                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51871                                  ;
 51872                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51873                                  ;
 51874                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51875                                  
 51876                                  lcommand:
 51877                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51878                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51879                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51880                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51881                                  i21patch:
 51882 00000F86 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51883                                  
 51884 00000F88 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51885                                  command_cont:
 51886 00000F8B 2EFF2E[560F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51887                                  
 51888                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51889                                  ;
 51890                                  ; INT 25h
 51891                                  ;
 51892                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51893                                  
 51894                                  labsdrd:
 51895                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51896                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51897                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51898                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51899                                  i25patch:
 51900 00000F90 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51901                                  
 51902 00000F92 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51903                                  absdrd_cont:
 51904 00000F95 2EFF2E[5A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51905                                  
 51906                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51907                                  ;
 51908                                  ; INT 26h
 51909                                  ;
 51910                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51911                                  
 51912                                  labsdwrt:
 51913                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51914                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51915                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51916                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51917                                  i26patch:
 51918 00000F9A EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 51919                                  
 51920 00000F9C E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51921                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51922 00000F9F 2EFF2E[5E0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 51923                                  
 51924                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51925                                  ;
 51926                                  ; INT 27h
 51927                                  ;
 51928                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51929                                  
 51930                                  lstay_resident:
 51931                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51932                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51933                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51934                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51935                                  i27patch:
 51936 00000FA4 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 51937

 51939                                  sr_cont:
 51940 00000FA9 2EFF2E[620F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 51941                                  
 51942                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51943                                  ;
 51944                                  ; INT 2Fh
 51945                                  ;
 51946                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51947                                  
 51948                                  lint2f:
 51949                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51950                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51951                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51952                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51953                                  i2fpatch:
 51954 00000FAE EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 51955                                  
 51956 00000FB0 E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51957                                  int2f_cont:
 51958 00000FB3 2EFF2E[660F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 51959                                  
 51960                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51961                                  ;
 51962                                  ; CPM entry
 51963                                  ;
 51964                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51965                                  
 51966                                  lcall_entry:
 51967                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51968                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51969                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51970                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51971                                  cpmpatch:
 51972 00000FB8 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 51973                                  
 51974 00000FBA E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51975                                  callentry_cont:
 51976 00000FBD 2EFF2E[6A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 51977                                  
 51978                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51979                                  
 51980                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51981                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 51982                                  %if 0
 51983                                  
 51984                                  lirett:
 51985                                  	iret
 51986                                  
 51987                                  %endif
 51988                                  
 51989                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51990                                  ;
 51991                                  ; LowIntXX:
 51992                                  ;
 51993                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 51994                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 51995                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 51996                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 51997                                  ;
 51998                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 51999                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52000                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52001                                  ;
 52002                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52003                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52004                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52005                                  ;
 52006                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52007                                  
 52008                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52009                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52010                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52011                                  
 52012 00000FC2 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52013 00000FC6 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52014                                  
 52015                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52016                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52017                                  %if 0
 52018                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52019                                  %endif
 52020                                  
 52021                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52022                                  LowInt23:
 52023                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52024                                  					; the stack
 52025 00000FCA 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52026 00000FCF 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52027                                  
 52028 00000FD4 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52029                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52030                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52031                                  
 52032 00000FD6 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52033                                  
 52034 00000FD9 2EFF2E[C20F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52035                                  
 52036                                  
 52037                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52038                                  LowInt24:
 52039                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52040                                  					; the stack
 52041 00000FDE 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52042 00000FE3 2E8F06[C80F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52043                                  
 52044 00000FE8 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52045                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52046                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52047                                  
 52048 00000FEA E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52049                                  
 52050 00000FED 2EFF2E[C60F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52051                                  
 52052                                  
 52053                                   
 52054                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52055                                  LowInt28:
 52056 00000FF2 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52057                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52058                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52059                                  
 52060 00000FF4 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52061                                  
 52062 00000FF7 CB                      	retf
 52063                                  
 52064                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52065                                  
 52066                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52067                                  ;
 52068                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52069                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52070                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52071                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52072                                  ;
 52073                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52074                                  
 52075                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52076                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52077                                  
 52078                                  disa20_xfer:
 52079 00000FF8 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52080                                  
 52081                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52082                                  
 52083                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52084                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52085                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52086                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52087                                  
 52088 00000FFB FA                      	cli
 52089 00000FFC 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52090                                  
 52091                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52092                                  	;;;
 52093 00001002 36C606[B812]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52094                                  	;;;
 52095                                  
 52096 00001008 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52097 0000100A 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52098 0000100C FB                      	sti
 52099                                  
 52100 0000100D 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52101 0000100E 56                      	push	SI
 52102 0000100F 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52103 00001011 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52104 00001013 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52105 00001015 CB                      	retf
 52106                                  
 52107                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52108                                  ;
 52109                                  ; M003:
 52110                                  ;
 52111                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52112                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52113                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52114                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52115                                  ; more info.
 52116                                  ;
 52117                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52118                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52119                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52120                                  ;
 52121                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52122                                  
 52123                                  disa20_iret:
 52124 00001016 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52125 00001019 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52126                                  
 52127                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52128                                  	;;;
 52129 0000101D FE0E[B812]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52130                                  	;;;
 52131                                  
 52132 00001021 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52133 00001025 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52134 00001029 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52135                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52136 0000102B 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52137                                  	
 52138                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52139                                  %if 0
 52140                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52141                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52142                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52143                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52144                                  %else
 52145                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52146                                  	;;;
 52147                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52148 0000102E C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52149 00001032 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52150 00001036 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52151                                  	;;;
 52152                                  %endif
 52153 00001039 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52154 0000103A 5B                      	pop	BX
 52155 0000103B 59                      	pop	CX
 52156 0000103C 5A                      	pop	DX
 52157 0000103D 5E                      	pop	SI
 52158 0000103E 5F                      	pop	DI
 52159 0000103F 5D                      	pop	BP
 52160 00001040 1F                      	pop	DS
 52161 00001041 07                      	pop	ES
 52162                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52163 00001042 CF                      	iret
 52164                                  
 52165                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52166                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52167                                  ;
 52168                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52169                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52170                                  ;
 52171                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52172                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52173                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52174                                  ;
 52175                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52176                                  
 52177                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52178 00001043 53                      	push	bx
 52179 00001044 50                      	push	ax
 52180                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52181 00001045 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52182 00001047 2EFF1E[4F10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52183 0000104C 58                      	pop	ax
 52184 0000104D 5B                      	pop	bx
 52185 0000104E C3                      	retn
 52186                                  
 52187                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52188                                  
 52189                                  XMMcontrol:
 52190 0000104F 00000000                	dd	0
 52191                                  
 52192                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52193                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52194                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52195                                  ;;;
 52196 00001053 00000000                	dd	0
 52197                                  SC_STATUS:
 52198 00001057 0000                    	dw	0
 52199                                  ;;;
 52200                                  
 52201                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52202                                  ;
 52203                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52204                                  ;
 52205                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52206                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52207                                  ;
 52208                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52209                                  ;
 52210                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52211                                  ;		
 52212                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52213                                  ;
 52214                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52215                                  
 52216                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52217                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52218                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52219                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52220                                  ;
 52221                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52222                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52223                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52224                                  
 52225                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52226                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52227                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52228                                  
 52229                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52230 00001059 9C                      	pushf
 52231 0000105A 1E                      	push    ds
 52232 0000105B 06                      	push	es
 52233 0000105C 51                      	push	cx
 52234 0000105D 56                      	push	si
 52235 0000105E 57                      	push	di
 52236                                  
 52237                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52238                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52239                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52240                                  
 52241                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52242                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52243                                  	;;;
 52244 0000105F 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52245 00001061 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52246 00001063 4E                      	dec	si
 52247 00001064 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52248 00001067 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52249 00001069 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52250                                  	;;;	
 52251                                  
 52252 0000106C B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52253 0000106F FC                      	cld
 52254 00001070 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52255                                  
 52256 00001072 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52257                                  EA20_RET:
 52258 00001074 5F                      	pop	di
 52259 00001075 5E                      	pop	si
 52260 00001076 59                      	pop	cx
 52261 00001077 07                      	pop	es
 52262 00001078 1F                      	pop	ds
 52263 00001079 9D                      	popf
 52264 0000107A C3                      	retn
 52265                                  
 52266                                  EA20_OFF:
 52267                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52268                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52269                                  
 52270 0000107B 53                      	push	bx
 52271 0000107C 50                      	push	ax
 52272                                  
 52273                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52274                                  %if 0
 52275                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52276                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52277                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52278                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52279                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52280                                  %else
 52281                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52282                                  	;;;
 52283 0000107D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52284 0000107F 2E8C16[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52285 00001084 2E8926[700F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52286 00001089 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52287                                  	;;;
 52288                                  %endif
 52289 0000108B BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52290                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52291                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52292 0000108E B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52293 00001090 2EFF1E[4F10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52294 00001095 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52295 00001097 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52296                                  
 52297                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52298                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52299                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52300                                  	;;;
 52301 00001099 2E8E16[6E0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52302                                  	;;;
 52303 0000109E 2E8B26[700F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52304                                  
 52305 000010A3 58                      	pop	ax
 52306 000010A4 5B                      	pop	bx
 52307                                  
 52308 000010A5 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52309                                  
 52310                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52311 000010A7 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52312 000010A9 CD10                    	int	10h
 52313 000010AB 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52314 000010AD 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52315                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52316                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52317                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52318                                  	;;;
 52319 000010AF B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52320                                  	;;;
 52321 000010B2 CD10                    	int	10h
 52322                                  XMMcont:
 52323                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52324                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52325                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52326                                  	;;;
 52327 000010B4 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52328                                  	;;;
 52329 000010B7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52330                                  	
 52331 000010B9 BE[1D11]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52332 000010BC 0E                      	push	cs
 52333 000010BD 1F                      	pop	ds
 52334 000010BE FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52335                                  XMMprnt:
 52336 000010BF AC                      	lodsb
 52337 000010C0 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52338 000010C2 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52339 000010C4 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52340 000010C6 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52341 000010C9 CD10                    	int	10h
 52342 000010CB EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52343                                  
 52344                                  XMMStall:
 52345 000010CD FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52346 000010CE EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End

 52523

 52525                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52526                                  
 52527                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52528                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52529                                  ;
 52530                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52531                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52532                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52533                                  ;
 52534                                  ;
 52535                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52536                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52537                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52538                                  
 52539                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52540                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52541                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52542                                  
 52543                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52544                                  
 52545                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52546                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52547                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52548                                  
 52549                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52550                                  
 52551                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52552                                  ;
 52553                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52554                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52555                                  ;
 52556                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52557                                  ;	push	es
 52558                                  ;	push	di
 52559                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52560                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52561                                  ;	pop	di
 52562                                  ;	pop	es
 52563                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52564                                  
 52565                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52566                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52567                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52568                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52569                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52570                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52571                                  	
 52572                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52573                                  
 52574                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52575                                  ;
 52576                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52577                                  ;
 52578                                  ;		push	cx
 52579                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52580                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52581                                  ;		jz	????
 52582                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52583                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52584                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52585                                  
 52586                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52587                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52588                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52589                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52590                                  
 52591                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52592                                  
 52593                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52594                                  ;
 52595                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52596                                  ;
 52597                                  ;
 52598                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52599                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52600                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52601                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52602                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52603                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52604                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52605                                  
 52606                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52607                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52608                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52609                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52610                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52611                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52612                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52613                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52614                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52615                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52616                                  
 52617                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52618                                  
 52619                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52620                                  ;

 52622                                  ;
 52623                                  ;
 52624                                  ;

 52627                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52628                                  ;	pop	ax
 52629                                  ;	jz	????
 52630

 52632                                  		db	036h,0A1h

 52634                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52635                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52636                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52637                                  
 52638                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52639                                  
 52640                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52641                                  ;
 52642                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52643                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52644                                  ;
 52645                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52646                                  ;
 52647                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52648                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52649                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52650                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52651                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52652                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52653                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52654                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52655                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52656                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52657                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52658                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52659                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52660                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52661                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52662                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52663                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52664                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52665                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52666                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52667                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52668                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52669                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52670                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52671                                  ;
 52672                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52673                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52674                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52675                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52676                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52677                                  ;
 52678                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52679                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52680                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52681                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52682                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52683                                  
 52684                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52685                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52686                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52687                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52688                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52689                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52690                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52691                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52692                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52693                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52694                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52695                                  			db	009H,003H
 52696                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52697                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52698                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52699                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52700                                  			db	05FH
 52701                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52702                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52703                                  
 52704                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52705                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52706                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52707                                  
 52708                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52709                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52710                                  ;
 52711                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52712                                  ;
 52713                                  ;

 52715                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52716                                  ;	    je l1
 52717                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52718                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52719                                  ;	    int 10h
 52720                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52721                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52722                                  
 52723                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52724                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52725                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52726                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52727                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52728                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52729                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52730                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52731                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 52808                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52809                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.

 52811                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52812

 52827                                  ;  endif

 52830                                  ;  endif
 52831                                  ;else
 52832 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52833                                  ;endif

 52848 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter

 52850 0000128B [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52851 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52852 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52853 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size

 52966                                  ;============================================================================
 52967                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 52968                                  ;============================================================================
 52969                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52970                                  
 52971                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 52972                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 52973                                  ;
 52974                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 52975                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 52976                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 52977                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 52978                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 52979                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 52980                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 52981                                  ; to call out here.
 52982                                  ;
 52983                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 52984                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 52985                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 52986                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 52987                                  ;

 52994                                  
 52995                                  ; DosData Segment
 52996                                  
 52997                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52998                                  
 52999                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53000                                  
 53001                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53002                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53003                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53004                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53005                                  
 53006                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53007 0000133E 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53008                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53009                                  
 53010                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53011                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53012                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53013                                  
 53014                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53015                                  %if 0
 53016                                  MagicPatch:
 53017                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53018                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53019                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53020                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53021                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53022                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53023                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53024                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53025                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53026                                  %endif
 53027                                  
 53028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53029

 53064                                  
 53065                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53066                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53067                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53068                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
